Course Title: PWM-Food Service: Food Safety Course Level 1
About This Course:
This course is only intended for the low wage workers in the PWM-Food Services Sector.

Food Safety Course Level 1 is a mandatory training program for all food and beverage staff working in SFA licensed food establishments and/or anyone interested to learn safe food preparation.

The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedures course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under the TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020.
What You'll Learn:
1. Practise good personal hygiene
2. Use safe ingredients
3. Handle food safely 
4. Store food safely
5. Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- No formal qualification
- Participant should have the ability to converse, read & write in English.

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1
About This Course:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
• LO1. Practise good personal hygiene before, during and after handling food
• LO2. Select and use safe ingredients
• LO3. Handle food safely
• LO4. Store food safely
• LO5. Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
• LO6: Adopt good workplace safety habits
What You'll Learn: This course aims to equip food handlers of both retail and non-retail food establishments with the knowledge and application skills to follow food safety and hygiene procedures and policies, as well as maintain the cleanliness and upkeep of premises. This is a mandatory course for chefs, cooks, kitchen helpers, food stall assistants and anyone who is involved in the preparation and handling of food, and anyone planning to work in F&B establishments. Learners certified competent will meet the licensing requirement to work as food handlers.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Entry Requirements
• At least 16 years old
• Able to speak, listen, write, and read basic English or Mandarin Chinese
• No prior work experience required

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Process Plant
About This Course:
CE1 - Identify the roles and responsibilities under the Workplace Safety and Health Act
CE2 - Identify and prevent fire and explosion hazards at the workplace
CE3 - Comply with safe work practices and control measures for material handling
CE4 - Comply with safe work practices and control measures for mechanical and electrical    works
CE5 - Comply with safe work practices and control measures when working on specialized operations
CE6 - Comply with safe work practices and control measures when working at Heights
CE7 - Comply with safe work practices and control measures when working in a confined space
What You'll Learn: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Process Plant is one of the skills that come under the  WSQ  Process Industry Framework. The module belongs to the system category under all process sectors for competency level 1.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participant must be able to read, speak and write in their medium of instruction and manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equal to Employability Skills System (ESS) Level 2

Course Title: WSQ Perform Rigger And Signalman Tasks
About This Course:
The ‘Performing Rigger and Signalman Tasks’ Course is designed to build the knowledge, skills and attitudes of all lifting personnel to increase the standards of operations and increase safety awareness when performing lifting operations as a Rigger and a Signalman.
This course is intended to equip the participants with the understanding of rigging and signaling and the knowledge and skills to manoeuvre a load safely to its destination, in a much safer work environment.
What You'll Learn:
The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the
professionalism of the manufacturing industry by equipping the workforce with essential generic and portable skills to adapt and be resilient to challenges in the dynamic working environment. It allows employers to access a pipeline of skilled workforce, which provides a competitive advantage and enables organisation success. It also equips workers with
cross-cutting generic manufacturing skills to effectively contribute and progress within an organisation as well as promote mobility across manufacturing companies.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to:
- Above 18 years of age
- Have a basic knowledge of the relevant sector of work
- Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
- Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2
- Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2

Course Title: WSQ Operate Scissor Lift
About This Course:
The “Operate Scissor Lift” Course is aimed at providing individuals with the knowledge and skills to operate scissor lifts safely. At the end of the course, participants will be proficient in selection of appropriate scissor lifts, conducting *risk assessment and route checks, identification of hazards for scissor lift operations, basic scissor lift operations and reinstating scissors lift in a safe manner.

CE 1 Prepare to carry out scissor lift operations
CE 2 Carry out scissor lift operations
CE 3 Conduct post operation of scissor lift
What You'll Learn: The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the professionalism of the manufacturing industry by equipping the workforce with essential generic and portable skills to adapt and be resilient to challenges in the dynamic working environment. It allows employers to access a pipeline of skilled workforce, which provides a competitive advantage and enables organisation success. It also equips workers with cross-cutting generic manufacturing skills to effectively contribute and progress within an organisation as well as promote mobility across manufacturing companies
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
• Have a basic knowledge of the relevant sector of work
• Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 3
• Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 3
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 3; and
• Be medically fit to work at height

Course Title: Comply with Workplace Safety and Health Policies and Procedures (SF)
About This Course:
At the end of the unit, participants will be able to:
1. Follow safe work practices and risk control procedures
2. Participate in workplace safety and health management activities
3. Follow workplace emergency response procedures
What You'll Learn:
Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) is included as one of the employability skills. The generic occupational safety and health competencies described in this module is minimum competencies for the implementation of effective workplace safety and health management.
In order to ensure that the generic competencies are relevant to all industries and workplaces, they do not address specific hazards or workplace safety and health issues relating to particular industries or work processes.

Institution: BELLS INSTITUTE OF HIGHER LEARNING PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Be a Smart Digital Citizen
About This Course: Recognize the Importance and the critical needs of digital Innovation in the workplace and society and to Apply functions within a phone and a range of smartphone applications to access life activities and alleviate productivity
What You'll Learn:
The course aims to equip individuals with digital literacy skills, particularly those required for use thru a smartphone or tablet. This is because, in general, there are more people who own a smartphone and tablet computer. Therefore, the focus on smartphones in our training will provide more benefit for our target learners. 
This program’s intention thru the guidelines in the TSC of Innovation Management – is to inculcate the awareness, mind-set and ability of individuals to confidently use digital workplace tools responsibly and effectively in order to solve problems, be productive, support well-being and thrive at work by processing and applying information and data, creating content, connecting and collaborating with other people, and reflecting on and adapting one’s digital practices. Having an Innovative mindset will play a key factor in the learner’s employability prospects and progress. 
Our program will include the following - 
1.    Introduction to the New World Of Technology - Cover a brief introduction of areas such as AI, IoT, Block Chain, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, RPA etc. and how they impact our day to day lives
2.    Provide brief examples of the above-mentioned Technology via interesting videos and use cases. Examples to be focused on daily life es-sentials and also work
3.    How New Technologies is changing our world through the above brief examples? - To focus on mobile technology and how it is influencing work and life. 
4.    Introduction to different Mobile Technology and Applications
5.    Mobile Technology - Transforming your Work + Life - Smartphone innovation over the years (How have the phone transformed?) Use cas-es of work and industry uses of mobile phone technology
6.    Different Applications to be covered and thought in class - Zoom, Health Passport, Paylah & PayNow, Trace Together, Lala Move, Healthhub SG, NTUC App/Redmart App, Doctor Anywhere, Send Helper (Apps are focus on areas of Finance, Lifestyle, Health and W
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Have at least upper Primary level education
Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification Workplace Literacy Level (WPL Level 3)
Have a least 2 years of relevant industry experience.

Course Title: PERFORM WORK IN CONFINED SPACE OPERATION
About This Course:
CE1 - Identify duties and responsibilities of all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Code of Practice
CE2 - Identify confined space hazards
CE3 - Use Gas Detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring
CE4 - Comply with Permit-to-Work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space
CE5 - Participate in an Emergency for confined space
What You'll Learn:
The Workplace Safety and Health Sect. 12 (3) stipulates that "It shall be the duty of every employer to ensure that those person at any work have received adequate instruction, information, training and supervision as is necessary unless he has undergone a safety and health training course approved by the commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health".

Participants are expected to be self-directed, with a mind to acquire skills and knowledge. They should be able to apply the acquired skill & knowledge to perform the duties of an entrant and attendant when working in a confined space, use gas detection instruments and participate in an emergency situation.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participant must be able to read, speak and write in their medium of instruction at a proficiency level equal to Employability Skills System (ESS) Level 2

Course Title: Perform Work At Height
About This Course:
This course aims to present the content and activities aligned to the Workforce Skills Qualification (WSQ) WPH-GMS-1110-1.1 Perform Work At Height module.

The “Perform Work At Height” course aims to provide learners with the knowledge and skills in performing work at height in construction and other industry sectors.
What You'll Learn:
At the end of this course, learners will acquire the knowledge and skills that would facilitate them to be able to:
1. Perform checks before and after use of Work at Height (WAH) equipment.
2. Perform proper use of WAH equipment in accordance to relevant legislation and guidelines, including evaluating use of fall arrest and fall prevention systems.
3. Perform self-relief techniques during harness suspension trauma situations.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Employability Skills (ES) Workplace Literacy level 3 and above.
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES Workplace Numeracy level level 3 and above.

Course Title: Manage Work At Height
About This Course:
This course aims to present the content and activities aligned to the Workforce Skills Qualification (WSQ) WPH-GMS-3309-1.1 Manage Work At Height module.

The “Manage Work At Height” course aims to provide learners with the knowledge and skills in planning, supervising, assessing and managing of work at heights.
What You'll Learn:
At the end of this course, learners will acquire the knowledge and skills that would facilitate them to be able to:
1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) legislation/Approved Code of Practice/Singapore Standards applicable to work at height.
2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of stakeholders, competent and responsible persons.
3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for work at height.
4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safe execution of work at height
5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
6. Establish and implement a system for effective monitoring and control of WAH risks
7. Don, check and correct Individual Fall Protection Equipment and respond to a fall emergency
Minimum Entry Requirement: Have at least WSQ ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 4 and above or equivalent and the ability to carry out hazard identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

Course Title: Occupational First Aid Course
About This Course: On completion of this unit, the learner will have knowledge and application skills in demonstrating first aid/CPR skills and be able to apply them in the workplace.
What You'll Learn:
1. First-aid Requirements in Factories and Other Workplaces
2. Industrial Toxicology
3. Safety & Accident Prevention
4. Basic Principles & Practice of First Aid
5. Wounds, Bleeding and Shock
6. Occupational Eye Injuries
7. Handling and Transportation of the Injured
8. Fractures and Soft Tissue Injuries
9. Breathing Difficulties
10. Burn Injuries
11. The Unconscious Patient
12. Management of Medical Emergencies
13. Revision
14. OFA Assessment
15. CPR + Use of AED
16. CPR + Use of AED Assessment
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participants of this course are advised to have at least ES WPLN Level 5 & above or equivalent.

Institution: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Child First Aid (Asynchronous and Practical)
About This Course: Through the Child First Aid Blended Course, trainees can complete the theory modules of the course online at our e learning portal and thereafter attend a classroom training session for practical modules and assessment. Trainees will be certified for a period of 2 years in 3 modules – Standard First Aid, BCLS AED and Child First Aid by the Singapore Resuscitation and First Aid Council.
What You'll Learn:
 Essentials of First Aid – Definition and Aims of First Aid, Roles / Limitations of a First Aider, Universal Precautions, First Aid Kit Contents and maintenance, Primary and Secondary Survey, Record and Report, SCDF My Responder App, Difference between Child and Adult Casualties.
 Unconscious Casualty (Non – Cardiac Arrest) – Head and Spinal injuries, Heat Disorder - Heat cramps, Heat exhaustion, Heat stroke, Fever, Fits, Fainting, Low blood sugar, stroke, The recovery position and lateral position for infant
 Respiratory Problems – Adult & Infant Foreign body Airway Obstruction (Conscious & Unconscious), Asthma (Administration of MDI with spacer and facemask),
Hyperventilation, Fumes inhalation, Allergic Reaction (Administration of Adrenaline Auto Injector).
 Shock, Bleeding and Wounds – Shock, Bleeding, Wounds, Bandaging, Application of Tourniquet.
 Musculoskeletal injuries - Fracture and Dislocation, Soft tissue injuries, Immobilization & Bandaging
 Burn injuries – Burns Depth and Severity of Burns, Classification and treatment of burns, scalding, Radiation / Sunburn, Chemical, Electrical, Thermal.
 Other First Aid Knowledge – Eye injuries (Chemical, Foreign Bodies, Blunt force trauma), vomiting and diarrhoea, Common Rashes, Nose Bleeding, Poisoning,
Transportation of casualty (1 & 2 Rescuer carry, improvised methods)
 CPR (Mouth to Mouth) + AED – theory of CPR+AED, Adult CPR+AED practical,infant CPR practical
Minimum Entry Requirement: Primary PSLE

At the end of the course, learner is able to
Prepare for cleaning activities

Remove Impacted soil from Hard Floor Surfaces
Remove Loose dust and debris from Hard Floor Surfaces
Perform Mopping of Hard Floor Surfaces
Reinstate Work Area

Course Title: Workplace Safety and Health for Food and Beverage Operations (Level 2)
About This Course:
1. Describe safety management systems in the food services industry
2. Observe organisational policies and procedures relating to WSH
3. Identify unsafe work conditions and practices
4. Maintain control measures in the work area
5. Recognise safety signs and hazard symbols
6. Use tools and equipment safely
What You'll Learn: Workplace safety and health (WSH) is an essential consideration in the food services industry.  With the potential for injuries and accidents in every aspect of food and beverage operations, it is crucial for workers to follow WSH practices in their work area to protect their safety and well-being.  Upon completion of this course, learners will acquire the knowledge and abilities to support organisational WSH by conducting checks according to work plans and instructions.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
1. Age 18 and above
2. Understand spoken English 
No formal academic qualifications required as this course is suitable for rank-and-file F&B staff

At the end of this section, the rigger and signalman should be able to understand and/or successfully perform the following:
• Legislations relating to rigger and signalman tasks
• Roles and responsibilities of the Rigger and Signalman in pre-lifting operations
• Roles and responsibilities of rigger and signalman during lifting operations
• Roles and responsibilities of rigger and signalman during post-lifting operations
What You'll Learn:
This unit is aimed at providing participants with the knowledge and skills to prepare and to tie the load for safe lifting by any form of lifting equipment
using correct and clear signals to guide the crane operator in the manoeuvring of a load safely to its destination.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
• Have a basic knowledge of the relevant sector of work
• Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2; and
• Be medically fit

Tarts & Short Crust Pastry Mise-en-Place B.Tarts & Short Crust Pastry Preparation and Baking Process C.Tarts & Short Crust Pastry Preparation and Baking Process D.Ensure Quality Control of Baked Tarts and Short-Crust Pastry E.Adhere to Hygiene & Food safety Requirements

Course Title: Make Cafe Style Bread
About This Course:
The learner will be able to demonstrate methods of preparing, scaling, mixing, fermenting, shaping, proofing, baking and storing café style breads
- Recipes and methods of making doughs and preparing different types of advanced breads
- Principles of baking advanced breads
- Procedures for mixing and fermenting doughs for advanced bread products
- Importance of flavours in bread products

b) Have at least primary school education or
c) is able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification Workplace Literacy Level 3 (WPL Level 3)

Course Title: Manage Work At Height
WSQ Operate Boom Lift
About This Course: The “Operate Boom Lift” Course is aimed at providing individuals with the knowledge and skills to operate boom lifts safely. At the end of the course, participants will be proficient in selection of appropriate boom lifts, conducting *risk assessment and route checks, identification of hazards for boom lift operations, basic boom lift operations and reinstating boom lifts in a safe manner.
What You'll Learn: The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the professionalism of the manufacturing industry by equipping the workforce with essential generic and portable skills to adapt and be resilient to challenges in the dynamic working environment. It allows employers to access a pipeline of skilled workforce, which provides a competitive advantage and enables organisation success. It also equips workers with cross-cutting generic manufacturing skills to effectively contribute and progress within an organisation as well as promote mobility across manufacturing companies

Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 3

Institution: TECS FIRE & SAFETY TRAINING PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Respond to Fire Incident in Workplace
About This Course:
On completion of this unit, the learner will have the knowledge and be equipped with the application skills and knowledge required to effectively respond to fire incidents. This includes:
• Introduce or reinforce the relevant legislations surrounding the formations and activation of CERT.
• Familiarize participants with the various possible fire hazards and the usage of fire protection systems in buildings.
• Instruct participants on correct methods to conduct initial fire-fighting using various extinguishing mediums.
What You'll Learn:
1. Interpret emergency response legislations and guidelines
2. Identify fire hazard scenarios and conduct situation assessment
3. Demonstrate usage of fire protection systems in the workplace
4. Respond to fire incidents using various extinguishing mediums
5. Handover incident and provide operational assistance to the appropriate body

Course Title: Perform Work in Confined Space Operation
About This Course: Upon completion of this unit, learners will be equipped with the necessary knowledge and expertise to perform the duties of an entrant and attendant when working in a confined space, use gas detection instruments and participate in an emergency situation.
What You'll Learn: CE1: Identify duties and responsibilities of all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Codes of Practice CE2. Identify confined space hazards CE3. Use Gas Detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring CE4: Comply with Permit-to-Work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space CE5: Participate in an Emergency for confined space.

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites
About This Course:
WSQ Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in construction. Construction workers are required to go through the course before they start work.

The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - clause 2 (6)) stipulates that “Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out construction work in building and engineering construction worksites must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health.”

After the course, the trainees should be able identify their own roles and responsibilities in a construction job, follow safe work procedures, adopt relevant risk control measures when working at height and respond to fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
CE1. Identify own roles and responsibilities as an employee in a Construction job

CE 2. Follow safe work procedures in construction work

CE 3. Follow safe “Work-at-Height” procedures

CE 4. Respond to fire emergencies
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level
equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to
Employability Skills (ES) level 2
 Have employment status as manual labour to carry out construction
work in building and engineering construction worksites
• Be medically fit.

Course Title: Videography Techniques for Social Media Platforms

Learners will be able to:
Comply Safety regulations and procedures pertaining to camera operations
Various types of smartphone camera lenses
Measure optimum focal distances required to create a sharp focus on primary subjects
Plot required sets, floor and props
Visual effects created from various types of smartphone camera lenses
Interpreting detail shot plan
Types of camera positions to shoot and frame shots
Capture complex camera shots that require the use of mounting equipment
Understand camera equipment and accessories

Maintenance of equipment and accessories

• Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 4 or equivalent

At least Primary Education 
Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 3 or equivalent. 
Learners are usually with little formal education
Short attention span, more of sharing, hence lecture must be bite-sized with discussion to aid understanding
Acquiring thinking skills through performing group discussion during class activities, hence translating knowledge into actions 
Content must be simple theory-based approach with step by step explanation; building on what they do/know at the workplace to how they could improve with the knowledge/skills acquired in the training
Motivation level of this group is low to medium and related examples should be relevant and applicable in their workplace
Need encouragement to boost self confidence level
The module provides balance between affective and cognitive dimension to learners

To engage the learners, practical-based sessions combined with bite sized lecture

Course Title: Create and Enhance Positive Customer Experience
About This Course: The purpose of this TSC Unit is to enable Auxiliary Police Officers, Auxiliary Police Officers (Enhancement) and Protection Officers to acquire the fundamental knowledge and be equipped with application skills in customer service while performing security duties at various deployment areas. This course will be conducted over period of 9 hours and 1.5 hours of Summative Assessment by AETOS Assessment Unit.
What You'll Learn:
This course is designed to enhance knowledge and abilities of AETOS Officers on applying customer service skills while performing security duties. It consits of the Knowledge (K1 - K9) such as qualities and characteristics of a service professional. Importance of going the extra mile for service to oneself and the organization.
The Abilities (A1 - A8) such as recognize the diverse range of customers and their needs and expectations. Demonstrate the qualities and characteristics of a service professional when delivering go the extra mile service to exceed customer's expectations.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Target Audience
In the role of a frontline professional, be it in the security profession, transport, courier/delivery, nursing, retail, customer service and any other people.

Entry Requirements
Learners must;
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WPL Level 4 
• Be able to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 4 
• Be able to act in a professional manner 
• Be able to observe confidently 
• Be vigilant at all times

Nationality
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent, holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Education Qualifications
The minimum entry educational qualification for learners shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent.

Course Title: CERT First Aider with CPR+AED
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners and/or appointed Company Emergency
Response Team (CERT) members will have the relevant knowledge and
application skills in Basic First Aid and CPR+AED to apply during an emergency
or accident:
1. Explain the duties and responsibilities of First Responder or CERT
member
2. Check and pack contents of First Aid Kit
3. Perform First Aid treatment for common medical emergencies at
workplaces or at home
4. Perform improvised carrying techniques
5. Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) effectively on adult
unconscious casualties
6. Perform the use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
effectively on adult unconscious casualties
What You'll Learn: Starting from 2017,there must be a minimum of 4 first aiders in a CERT. The course should cover basic first aid, as well as CPR+AED.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
P1. We highly recommend individuals to have attained at least secondary two education or level 5 of ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy.
P2. Must be physically fit and able to render help to another individual during an emergency.
P3. Medically fit with no pre-existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury. Learners with medical problems, such as bronchial asthma, any upper respiratory tract infection, orthopaedic problems (e.g. slipped disc), are encouraged to consult their own doctors before attending the course. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to
indicate if fit for training.
P4. Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training. You are advised to defer taking the course to at least 6 weeks after delivery.

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Metal Work
About This Course:
WSQ “Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Metal Work” is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in metal working. Metal working workers are required to go through the course before they start work.

The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - clause 2 (9)) stipulates that “Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out work in a factory engaged in the manufacture of basic metals, fabricated metal products, machinery or equipment and electrical machinery and equipment must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health.”

After the course, the trainees should be able identify their own roles and responsibilities in metal working, follow safe work procedures, and respond to fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
CE1. Identify own roles and responsibilities in metal working

CE 2. Follow safe work procedures in metal working

Course Title: Child First Aid Course (Classroom & Asynchronous)
About This Course:
Enable companies/participants to meet the Early Childhood and Development Agency (ECDA) requirements for First Aid training.

Provide participants with the necessary knowledge in identifying and managing victims during an emergency.

Equip participants with the skills in rendering First Aid when accidents occur.

Activate Emergency Medical Services, perform CPR effectively and safely on victims to ensure optimal chances of survival.

Child-specific contents such as hazard identification, HFMD and other common child ailments.
What You'll Learn:
During an unexpected emergency, the life and death of a victim may depend on proper First Aid given within the first few minutes of the incident. First Aid treatment is critical in preventing further injuries and pain to the victim before the arrival of medical professionals.

Despite Singapore’s reliable transport system, world-class hospitals and dense population, an Emergency Ambulance may take about 10 minutes or more, to respond to your location – too late to save the Brain which may be permanently damaged within 4 to 6 minutes without sufficient oxygenated blood circulation. However, having a First Aider in nearby can increase the success rate if he/she can take action while waiting for the Ambulance to arrive.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Primary PSLE
'N' Level or equivalent
'O' Level or equivalent
ITE Skills Certification (ISC)
'A; Level or equivalent
Higher NITEC
Polytechnic Diploma
Professional Qualification & Other Diploma
University First Degree
University Post-graduate Diploma & Degree/Master/Doctorate

Course Title: The Coaching Essentials
About This Course:
At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
• Understand the standards and ethical considerations related to providing coaching
• Acquire techniques to develop an effective coaching conversation for goal setting and collaborate with “coachee” to set goals and define specific development areas
• Demonstrate active listening methods and types of questioning techniques and models
• Provide effective coaching feedback
What You'll Learn:
This course is Module 1 of the Khysalis Coaching Series, an International Coaching Federation (ICF) accredited programme. Participants who complete the full Khrysalis Coaching Series comprising 3 modules, will be eligible to apply for Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialling from ICF.
This course gives you an understanding of the definition of coaching and comparison of coaching against other developmental methods.  Learn about the Coaching at an international standard and the benefits of coaching. 
Appreciate different coaching niches and the suitability to use coaching at the appropriate time. Learn about the different coaching personas and adopt different technologies used for coaching.
Explore the different issues for coaching and learn the definition of listening actively and the barriers to effective listening.  Learn how to listen effectively as a coach and practice on setting coaching parameters.
Develop questioning skills for coaching and define actions and accountability. Understand and utilise the different coaching models to have an effective coaching conversation. Finally, learn reflection as part of the coaching practice and enjoy the coaching practicum.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 8

• Have no less than 3 years’ experience in a supervisory or managerial role

Course Title: OCCUPATIONAL FIRST AID COURSE (OFAC)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will have the relevant knowledge and application skills in First Aid and CPR+AED to apply during an emergency or accident at their workplace.

1. Explain the duties and responsibilities of First Aider

2. List the legal requirements under the Workplace Safety & Health Act and Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid) Regulations (Cap. 354A, Rg 4) for a workplace

3. Check and pack contents of First Aid Box

4. Apply first aid to accident victims in the workplace

5. Manage victims of hazardous chemicals exposure

6. Manage a medical emergency at the workplace

7. Identify common workplace accidents requiring first aid treatment

"Where more than 25 persons are employed in a workplace, there shall be appointed in the workplace as first-aiders who shall be readily available during working hours such number of persons as complies with the ratio of one first-aider for every 100 persons employed in the workplace or part thereof." - WORKPLACE SAFETY AND HEALTH ACT

Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid) Regulations stipulates that “every person appointed as a first-aider shall

(a) have successfully completed a training course acceptable to the Commissioner; and

(b) undergo such subsequent retraining in first-aid treatment as the Commissioner may require”
What You'll Learn:
Module 1: Principles and practices of first aid

Module 2: Management of medical emergencies

Module 3: Wounds, bleeding and shock

Module 4: Fractures and soft tissues injuries

Module 5: Handling and transportation of the injured

Module 6: Eye and other injuries

Module 7: Burn injuries

Module 8: Breathing difficulties

Module 9: The unconscious casualty

Module 10: First Aid Requirements in Factories and Other Workplace

Module 11: Industrial Toxicology

Module 12: Safety and Accident Prevention

Module 13: CPR & use of AED
Minimum Entry Requirement:
P1. Learners are required to submit their passport-sized photo (.jpeg) in digital format upon receiving the confirmation e-mail.

P2. As regulated by Workplace Safety and Health Council, Ministry Of Manpower, companies enrolling employees for Occupational First Aid Course must attained at least secondary two education or level 5 of ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy.

P3. Must be physically fit and able to render help to another individual during an emergency.

P4. Medically fit with no pre-existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury. Learners with medical problems, such as bronchial asthma, any upper respiratory tract infection, orthopedic problems (e.g. slipped disc), are encouraged to consult their own doctors before attending the course. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training.

P5. Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons. In case of do

Course Title: Certified ScrumMaster
About This Course:
- Understand the concepts, fundamentals and best practices of using Scrum to build software
- Learn essential techniques in managing agile development using Scrum               
- Prepare for the certification of ScrumMaster assessment conducted by Scrum Alliance
What You'll Learn:
Certified ScrumMaster is the global standard for training in Scrum, the most widely adopted Agile management methodology globally.  Scrum is used for complex projects in a variety of industries, including software development, finance, manufacturing, shipping, and healthcare.  This training is an intensive 2-day course in using Scrum’s continuous improvement framework to reduce cost, increase task efficiency, and optimize effectiveness of complex processes and procedures.  The training emphasizes customer-centricity, continuous feedback, team collaboration, and process inspection and adaptation to implement continuous improvement.

The course is comprised of short modules that include lecture, discussion, real-world scenarios and case-studies, and mapping into real-world action.  The aim is to equip participants with knowledge, and also start them on a path to implementation of Scrum’s continuous improvement practices back at work.  The learning modules focus on:
• Skills to prioritize tasks and processes that deliver the most value to customers and stakeholders. 
• Techniques to maximize transparency around progress, issues, and solutions, helping to identify areas for improvement and optimize the effectiveness of the project.
• Strategies to manage risks and mitigate issues, including identifying risks, prioritizing them, and implementing mitigation strategies.
• Frameworks for continuous learning and improvement, with continuous retrospection to identify areas for improvement and optimize the effectiveness of the projects and processes.
• Strategies to manage change effectively, including how to communicate changes, prioritize action items, and manage risks associated with changes.
• Techniques to build team cohesion, enhance teamwork, and facilitate collaboration.
• Methods to optimize delivery of value to customers, with incremental delivery and iterative optimization to ensure that customers’ and stakeholders’ needs are met.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Preferably some knowledge or experience in managing team work

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites
About This Course:
1. Identify legal obligations in workplace safety and health
2. Identify hazards in a construction site: fire, explosion, falling from heights and falling objects, safe access, chemicals, mechanical, electrical, radiation, material handling, working in confined space and specialized operations
3. Recognize all types of industrial safety signs
4. Apply for safety permit prior to hot work
5. Put on personal protective equipment (PPE)
6. Take safety precautions when working with different hazards as stated above and other emerging hazards such as heat stroke, infectious diseases, ergonomics etc.
7. Respond in case of fire or emergency
What You'll Learn:
Apply Workplace Safety and health in Construction Sites is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in construction. Construction workers are required to go through the course before they start work.
The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - Clause 2 (6)) stipulates that "Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out construction work in building and engineering construction worksites must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health."
After the course, the trainee should be able to identify their own roles and responsibilities in a construction job, follow safe work procedures, adopt relevant risk control measures when working at height and respond to fire emergencies.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
• Have employment status as manual labour to carry out construction
work in building and engineering construction worksites
• Be medically fit.
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level
equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to
Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Have good organisational skills
• Be able to follow written and oral work instructions

Course Title: Perform Rigger and Signalman tasks
About This Course:
The “Perform Rigger and Signalman Task” course is aimed at providing individuals with the knowledge and skills to give correct and clear signals to guide the crane operator in the maneuver of a load safely to its destination.The “Perform Rigger and Signalman Tasks” Course is suitable for aspiring and
experienced individuals assigned as Rigger and Signalman in the workplace.

“Perform Rigger and Signalman Tasks” is a Competency Unit under the Logistics
Competency Category. The Competency Elements covered are:
CE 1 Prepare to perform rigger and signalman tasks
CE 2 Perform rigger and signalman tasks
CE 3 Reinstate rigger and signalman work area
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
• Have a basic knowledge of the relevant sector of work
• Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the
Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2; and
• Be medically fit

Course Title: Workplace Safety and Health Control Measures (Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan)
About This Course: On completion of this unit, learners will acquire the knowledge and skills to be a RM Team Leader/Risk Management Champion for the organisation in reducing risks at source by managing the risk management process at workplace. It involves developing a practical risk management implementation plan for the organisation which identify specific actions to be taken, by whom and time for their completion. It also entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the Risk Management Code of Practice (RMCP).
What You'll Learn:
Section 1 Identification
Section 2 Hazard(s) Identification
Section 3 Composition/Information on Ingredients
Section 4 First-Aid Measures
Section 5 Fire-Fighting Measures
Section 6 Accidental Release Measures
Section 7 Handling and Storage
Section 8 Exposure Controls/Personal Protection
Section 9 Physical and Chemical Properties
Section 10 Stability and Reactivity
Section 11 Toxicological Information
Section 12 Ecological Information (non-mandatory)
Section 13 Disposal Considerations (non-mandatory)
Section 14 Transport Information (non-mandatory)
Section 15 Regulatory Information (non-mandatory)
Section 16 Other Information

Course Title: WSQ Operate Forklift (3 days)
About This Course: This Competency Unit enables an individual to acquire the skills and knowledge to operate forklift in the manufacturing / logistics industry
What You'll Learn:
CE1. Prepare to carry out forklift operations
CE2. Inspect forklift
CE3. Carry out forklift operations
CE4. Reinstate and hand over forklift

Course Title: Supervise Construction Work for WSH
About This Course:
 Explain and interpret salient WSH legislations and other requirements relevant to construction industry
 Describe the WSH duties and responsibilities of a supervisor in construction industry
 Assist in safety and health planning and organisation at worksite
 Identify WSH hazards, evaluate and control risks in construction industry in accordance with risk management process
 Carry out WSH inspections in accordance with organisational inspection procedures
 Conduct incident investigation and prepare report in accordance with legal requirements and other organisational requirements
You will also be equipped with the following knowledge:
 Importance of Workplace Safety and Health (WSH)
 Consequences of unsafe work practices and workplace conditions
 Salient WSH legal and other requirements relevant to construction industry
 WSH (Construction) Regulations
 Overview of WSH management system
 WSH duties and responsibilities of supervisor in the construction industry
 Safety and health planning and organization
 Risk management process
 Typical construction activities
 Permit-to-work for high-risk construction works
 Typical WSH hazards
 WSH control measures
 Methods for hazards identification
 Types of organizational WSH inspections
 Incident investigation and reporting
What You'll Learn:
Previously known as the Building Construction Supervisors Safety Course (BCSS), the Construction Work for Workplace Safety and Health course is suitable for those working at a construction site as a foreman or supervisor. Site engineers and clerk of works or those with a diploma/ degree in engineering who wish to work in the construction industry should also consider taking the course.

Under the Workplace Safety and Health (Construction) Regulations 2007 reg. 9 (2b), no employee without adequate health and safety training is allowed to supervise or oversee any process, or work carried out in a worksite. The training should be conducted to ensure that construction work at the site could be done safely.

Through the WSQ-Supervise Construction Work for WSH (BCSS) course, participants can learn how to interpret and explain legislations from WSH and other prerequisites related to the construction industry. During the course, participants can learn the overview of the WSH management system, preparing them for the duties that will be required of a construction supervisor. They can also understand how to conduct comprehensive inspections that follow the proper procedures of organisational inspection, including investigating incidents and reporting them.

Please note that there will be a 15 min oral interview 1 week after the class ends. The interview date is typically 1 week after the final day of the class. Candidates are required to submit a written report as instructed by the trainer. Failure to do so will result in failure of the course.
Minimum Entry Requirement: - Have a Level 4 and above or equivalent standard in Employability Skills (ES) Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN).

Course Title: Manage Work At Height (Classroom + Asynchronous E-Learning)
About This Course:
The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the
professionalism of the workforce. This Competency Unit aims to equip the knowledge and skills in planning, supervising, assessing and managing of work at height.
What You'll Learn:
“Manage Work At Height” is a Competency Unit under the GMS WSQ Framework.
The Performance Statements covered are:
PS1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant Workplace Safety and Health
(WSH) legislation/Approved Code of Practice/Singapore Standards
applicable to work at height
PS2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of stakeholders,
competent and responsible persons.
PS3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for work at height PS4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safeexecution of work at height
PS5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
PS6. Establish and implement a system for an effective monitoring and controlof WAH risks PS7. Don, check and correct Individual Fall Protection Equipment and respond to a fall emergency
Minimum Entry Requirement:
WSQ Employability Skills System (ESS) Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 4 and above or equivalent.
Ability to carry out hazards identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

 Carry out pre-start inspection
 State factors affecting stability
 Identify common hazards during traveling, setup, operation and parking of MEWP and their control measures
 Conduct workplace inspection

 Use personal protective equipment appropriate to the task, worksite and environment as a result of a risk assessment conducted and according to the manufacturer’s guidelines.

- Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 3; and

Course Title: Bizsafe Level 2 - Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan
About This Course: Upon the completion of this course, learners will acquire the kills and knowledge to be a Risk Management(RM) Champion for the organisation in reducing risks at source by managing the risk management process at workplace and for recognition of bizSAFE level 2 by Workplace Safety and Health Council. It involves developing a practical risk management implementation plan for the organisation which identify specific actions to be taken, by whom and time for their completion. It also entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the Risk Management Code of Practice (RMCP)
What You'll Learn: This unit provides skills and knowledge to be a Risk Management(RM) Champion for the company. It involves developing a practical risk management implementation plan, entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the RMCP. This unit provides learners the opportunity to practice, and apply the knowledge and skills learnt to produce a practical risk management plan for the organisation, conduct hazard identification, apply risk assessment methodology to evaluate risks and implement the hierarchy of controls to mitigate risks as well as hazard communication through classroom discussions and practices. This leads to the award of bizSAFE (level 2) by Workplace Safety and Health Council (WSHC).

Course Title: Service Literacy in Mandarin
About This Course: This module is developed to strengthen the foundational competencies of a good Bus Captain. It helps new Bus Captains realise that driving a bus requires interaction with commuters. It provides them with the basic skills of interacting with different types of commuters and managing incidents on public buses. These are skills that new Bus Captains would require for their work.
What You'll Learn:
This module is targeted at the public transport sector – bus.
This module is part of the 5-day centralised training programme (Enhanced Vocational Licence Training Programme (EVLTP)) which targets the Public Transport (Bus) industry for new ODVL holders including Bus Captains (BCs). 
This is a pre-requisite module for all new BCs (targeted for 2000 BCs/year) to obtain an ODVL to operate an omnibus under the four (4) existing Public Transport Operators in Singapore.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
This course is a Certificate Level programme, targeted at new Bus Captains (BCs).

Considering that learners may be individuals opting for a mid-career switch, matured workers and/or school drop-outs, learners should meet the basic entry requirements as indicated below, with reference to the PTOs’ requirements under the Place-and-Train scheme (for new BCs), cross training (for Bus Technicians and Interchange/Bus Depot management staff):
1. 21 years old and above
2. Minimum 1-year clean driving record
3. Minimum Class 3 driving licence
Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 3 or equivalent for those with no formal qualification

Course Title: WSQ Perform Work At Height
About This Course:
To streamline safety training and reduce repetitive training, MOM-recognised courses and related industries will be transited to the WSQ System. These mandated safety courses will equip the employees with the essential competencies to work safely in the construction and other industry sectors.
• To equip all personnel with the relevant safety competencies to work in the manufacturing related industries;
• To reduce the gestation period before the worker can start working by harmonising the regulatory requirements with the industry endorsed WSQ training; and
• To provide clear progression pathway and address the necessary skills required to move up to the next level of responsibility
What You'll Learn:
The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the professionalism of the manufacturing industry by equipping the workforce with essential generic and portable skills to adapt and be resilient to challenges in the dynamic working environment. It allows employers to access a pipeline of skilled workforce, which provides a competitive advantage and enables organisation success. It also equips workers with cross-cutting generic manufacturing skills to effectively contribute and progress within an organisation as well as promote mobility across construction and other related companies.

“Perform Work At Height” is a Competency Unit under the GMS WSQ Framework. The Performance Statements covered are:
1. Perform checks before and after use of Work at Height (WAH) equipment
2. Perform proper use of WAH equipment in accordance to relevant legislation and guidelines, including evaluating use of fall arrest and fall prevention systems
3. Perform self-relief techniques during harness suspension trauma situations
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to have:
• Employability Skills (ES) Workplace Literacy level 3 and above.
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES Workplace Numeracy level level 3 and above.

Course Title: Driving Service Excellence in the Changi Experience [Classroom Facilitated, Asynchronous E-Learning]
About This Course:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:

- Deliver personalised and positively surprising customer experiences that embody the Changi Service DNA by utilising the Customer Service Knowledge Base (CSKB) in-sights. 

- Apply personalised interactions with self-service options effectively through the skills of balancing the human touch and technology, that embodies CAG’s sophisticated modernisation with a strong culture of service excellence.

- Utilise digital tools and resources that drive efficiency in productivity and alleviate manpower challenges.

- Demonstrate professional finesse in communication and interactions in alignment with the Changi Service DNA.

- Build trust that upholds CAG’s integrity in the safeguard of customer data in compliance with PDPA requirements.
What You'll Learn:
This course is targeted to provide Retail, Service and F&B frontliner service staff with tips and techniques to deliver service excellence in the customer experience at Changi Airport.

Learners will understand the Changi brand and service DNA, and the Changi specific digital tools that can help them to manage customer needs, delivering service excellence in return.

Changi Airport is home to millions of visitors from all over the world annually, and is a significant landmark in the world of travel. Hence apart from benefitting Singapore’s tourism and business travel industry, Changi Airport staff will also benefit from being trained to assimilate effectively into projecting the Changi brand positively.

Course Title: SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace 2.0 (SFDW 2.0)- General (2 days) (Classroom with asynchronous e-learning)

The course is divided into four domains, namely In-demand Digital Tools, Automation, Data Analytics, and Cybersecurity risks. Each domain is designed to provide participants with hands-on experience in the latest digital tools and techniques and equip them with the skills needed to thrive in today's digital world.

Course Title: Prepare Basic Dim Sum Dishes (Moist-Heat)
About This Course: To equipped Learners with the knowledge, skills and ability to be able to prepare different Basic Dim Sum dishes in Chinese Culinary by using the moist heat cooking method.
What You'll Learn: This is a fundamental course to learn and be equipped with the skills on the preparation of Basic Dim Sum Dishes by using moist heat in the cooking process. It is recommended for individuals who are seeking for a career opportunity in the food services industry with regards to Chinese Culinary. It is also recommended for Learners who are considering a career in Food Services but will like to understand what it is like to be working in a kitchen environment for 6 to 8 hours a day preparing Dim Sum and Chinese Culinary Dishes.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
The following are the target groups for this course.
a) School leavers and new entrants into the Food & Beverage industry who already have some basic culinary skills
b) Individuals who are keen to join the Food & Beverage trade.
c) Working professionals in the Food & Beverage industry who wish to upgrade their skills and knowledge to obtain an industry recognized certification
d) Individuals who wish to change their career and enter the Food & Beverage industry

To equip all personnel with the relevant safety competencies to work
in the Process and related industries;

CE 4: Respond to fire emergencies

worksites & be medically fit & above 18 years.
• Participant must be able to read, write, speak and to
manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to
Employability Skills (ES) level 2 (The language in which the
course is conducted).
• Students are expected to bring their own safety shoes
for the second day of the course

Course Title: Certified Scrum Product Owner
About This Course:
- Approach all aspects of the Product Owner role with skills and confidence
- Gather and write requirements using user stories
- Create an effective Product Backlog
- Estimate and plan projects/releases, and managing them to successful completion
What You'll Learn:
The Certified Scrum Product Owner course is the global standard for training in the primary leadership role in Scrum, the most widely adopted Agile management methodology globally.  The Scrum Product Owner role guides complex projects in a variety of industries, including software development, finance, manufacturing, shipping, and healthcare.  Certified Scrum Product Owner training is an intensive 2-day course in using Scrum’s continuous improvement framework to reduce cost and optimize effectiveness of value delivery. It emphasizes the importance of customer-centricity, continuous feedback, team collaboration, and process inspection and adaptation to identify and implement continuous improvement.

The course is comprised of short modules that include lecture, discussion, real-world scenarios and case-studies, and mapping into real-world action. The aim is to equip participants to function as a high-performance Product Owner and use Scrum’s continuous improvement practices to optimize delivery of value.  Learning modules focus on:
• Techniques to maximize transparency around business value, progress, and solutions, helping to identify areas for improvement and optimize value delivery.
• Techniques to analyze and quantify the business value and Return on Investment (ROI) of deliverable features and functionality for customers and stakeholders.
• Strategies for planning and sequencing delivery of value increments to customers and stakeholders, including Minimum Viable Product and Exceptional Viable Product.
• Strategies to manage risks and mitigate issues, including identifying risks, prioritizing them, and implementing mitigation strategies.
• Frameworks for continuous learning and improvement, with continuous retrospection to identify areas for improvement and optimize the effectiveness of the projects and processes.
• Strategies to manage change effectively, including how to communicate changes, prioritize action items, and manage risks associated with chan
Minimum Entry Requirement: This course is for IT and business professionals in the Banking and Financial Services industry who will be serving in the role of Product Owner or Chief Product Owner in an Agile project including their senior management. This course is suitable for those with little or no prior knowledge of Agile or Scrum.

Course Title: WSQ: Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan (bizSAFE Level 2)
About This Course:
This course aims to empower Risk Management Champions (top management, WSH Committee members, EHS personnel, Managers, Engineers & Supervisors) with the knowledge and skills in managing the risk management process at workplace and to devise their own risk management plans for their own. 

It involves developing a practical risk management implementation plan for the organisation which identify specific actions to be taken, by whom and time for their completion. It also entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the Risk Management Code of Practice
What You'll Learn:
Organisational Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Policy
Verify the expectations of a risk Management Champion/Risk Management Team Leader
Workplace Safety and Health Risk Management Regulations requirements
Form a risk management team
Risk management process
Risk Assessment
Establish hazard identification methodology
Classification of WSH hazards
Hazards associated with tools, equipment, materials and machines
Hazards associated with work processes/activities, workplace conditions and environment
At-risk behaviours
Concept of risk assessment
Establish risk assessment methodology
Establish risk control measures methodology
Develop a workplace risk management plan
What is SGSecure
Stakeholders of SGSecure in Workplace Safety, Health and Security
Roles of Risk Management Champions, RM Leaders and RA Leaders in SGSecure
Identifying workplace terror threats and implementing risk control measures
Formulating a Risk Assessment on terror threats
SGSecure deliverables in bizSAFE certification in levels 1 to 3
Appointing SGSecure Representatives
Present the risk management plan
Risk Communication of all identified hazards, risks evaluated and implemented risk control measures and SGSecure tenets

Course Title: PWM-Food Services: Transforming Moments into Memories Service 101 (Customer Service Excellence L1)

This programme seeks to bridge the performance / competency gaps found in frontline service staff in the Food Services Sector. Course Title: Child First Aid (Asynchronous E-Learning)
About This Course:

This course is accredited by SRFAC and aims to provide trainees with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate injuries and medical emergencies like severe breathing difficulties and bleedings not only in adult casualties but also that in children and infants. Course Title: PWM-Food Services: Workplace Safety and Health for Food and Beverages Operations (Chinese)
About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the Food Services Sector.
There are five learning units (LUs). They are offered sequentially by the topic, in a linear manner. The LUs are crafted & packed according to skills, knowledge, and attitudes required for optimum performance in the job role. Each LU is topical sequenced by Job Role and Environment Skills.
The learning units are as follows:
LU 1: Workplace Safety and Health Procedures
LU 2: Compliance of WSH Systems and Procedures
LU 3 – Safety Signs and Hazard Symbols
LU 4 - Risk Assessment and Control Measures
LU 5 - Improve WSH Environment at Workplace
What You'll Learn:
This course is meant to target the food and beverage operation sectors that are providing services or goods in their area of business. With this in mind, the target group for this module, “Workplace Safety and Health for F&B Operations” will be for:

● Existing food service sector employees including Barista / Bartender / Wine Server / Wine Waiter / Crew Leader / Baker / Cook / Serv-er / Service Crew / Kitchen Assistant, who are required to support organisational compliance to workplace safety and health (WSH)
● New hires in the food services sector
● For learners from different industry or mid-career changers who wish to embark on their career in the industry
● Individuals who wish to learn about WSH for F&B Operations personally

At the end of the course, learners are able to:
LO1. Apply the WSH Policies and Procedures
LO2. Manage WSH Roles and Responsibilities
LO3. Determine Non-Compliances, Unsafe Work Conditions and Practices at Workplace
LO4. Facilitate the Compliance Inspections in Work Area with HACCP
LO5. Understand the Importance of Safety Signs and Hazard Symbols at workplace
LO6. Explain the Importance of Risks and Control Measures to Stakeholders
LO7. Identify WSH Control Measures, Risk Assessment and PPE
LO8. Identify the Correct PPE and Safety Device for Safe Operations in Accordance with the Organisational Procedures
Minimum Entry Requirement: • Participants should at the very minimum have the ability to converse, read & write in Chinese

Institution: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Standard First Aid Course (Asynchronous E-Learning) (NROC)
About This Course:
Through the Standard First Aid Blended Course, trainees can complete the theory modules of the course online
at our e learning portal and thereafter attend a 1-day classroom training session for practical modules and
assessment. The coure comprises of an in-depth approach to performing critical emergency interventions while
equipping participants with the practical and theoretical skills to perform effective CPR and AED on adult
victims.
What You'll Learn:
- Essentials of First Aid – Definition and Aims of First Aid, Roles / Limitations of a First Aider, Universal
Precautions, First Aid Kit Contents and maintenance, Primary and Secondary Survey, SCDF My Responder App.
- Unconscious Casualty (Non – Cardiac Arrest) – Head injuries, Heat Disorder Heat cramps, Heat exhaustion, Heat
stroke, Fits, Fainting, Low blood sugar, stroke, The recovery position.
- Respiratory Problems – Adult Foreign body Airway Obstruction (Conscious & Unconscious), Asthma,
Hyperventilation, Fumes inhalation, Allergic Reaction.
- Shock, Bleeding and Wounds – Shock, Bleeding, Wounds, Bandaging.
- Musculoskeletal injuries - Fracture and Dislocation, Soft tissue injuries, Immobilization & Bandaging.
- Burn injuries – Burns Depth and Severity of Burns, Classification and treatment of burns, scalding,
Radiation / Sunburn, Chemical, Electrical, Thermal.
- Eye injuries – Chemical, Foreign Bodies, Blunt – force Trauma.
- Transportation of Casualty – 1 & 2 Rescuer carry, Improvised methods.
- CPR (Hands – Only) + AED, includes theory and practical.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Primary PSLE

Course Title: Standard First Aid + AED (Asynchronous E-Learning) (NROC Coaches)
About This Course:
This course provides the relevant knowledge and skills needed to apply first aid to adult casualty during any medical emergency that might arise and to use the Automated Defibrillator (AED) safely.  

- Recognise a medical emergency situation.
- Activate the appropriate emergency response system and follow the  Emergency Action Principles. 
- Recognise the signs and symptoms of identified emergencies, illnesses and injuries.
- Perform the necessary and correct first aid treatment to a casualty based on the emergency, illness and injury 
- Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) with use of Automated External Defibrillator (AED) for adult victims
- Able to manage foreign body airway obstruction (eg. choking) for conscious or unconscious adult victims
What You'll Learn:
Standard First Aid (SFA) + AED course is accredited by SRFAC in accordance to its guidelines and methodology stipulated. This course aims to provide participants with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate injuries and medical emergencies like severe breathing difficulties and bleedings. Participants will also learn skills and techniques to assist adults suffering from heart attack or cardiac arrest.

A valid Standard First Aid Course Certification is a requirement for all Coaches to attain or renew their coaching license under the National Registry of Coaches (NROC) of Sports Singapore.

CPR + AED Module is included in this course.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Physically healthy and able to complete course objectives
Able to speak, read and understand English effectively as our courses are conducted in English.

Course Title: Perform Rigger and Signalman Tasks
About This Course:
Performing Rigger and Signalman Tasks Course is designed to build the knowledge, skills and attitudes of all lifting personnel to increase the standards of operations and increase safety awareness when performing lifting operations as a Rigger and a Signalman.
This course is intended to equip the participants with the understanding of rigging and signaling and the knowledge and skills to manoeuvre a load safely to its destination, in a much safer work environment.
This is also a mandatory course in line with Workplace Safety and Health (Operation of Cranes) Regulations for individuals who are assigned to carry out the lifting operation of load involving a mobile crane or tower crane.
What You'll Learn:

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites
About This Course:
WSQ “Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites” is a
mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in construction.
Construction workers are required to go through the course before they
start work. After the course, the trainees should be able identify their own roles and
responsibilities in a construction job, follow safe work procedures, adopt
relevant risk control measures when working at height and respond to
fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
“Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites” is a Competency Unit
under the Process Industry Framework. The Competency Elements covered are:
CE 1: Identify own roles and responsibilities as an employee in a construction job
CE 2: Follow safe work procedures in a construction job
CE 3: Follow safe “Work-at-Height” procedures
CE 4: Respond to fire emergencies
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
• Have employment status as manual labour to carry out construction
work in building and engineering construction worksites
• Be medically fit.
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level
equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to
Employability Skills (ES) level 2
• Have good organisational skills
• Be able to follow written and oral work instructions

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites
About This Course: On completion of this unit, learners will have the skills and knowledge in applying workplace safety and health practices to ensure the safety of oneself and others at work in metal work by identifying own roles and responsibilities in a construction job by following safe work procedures and adopting relevant risk control measures when working in a construction site and responding to fire emergencies
What You'll Learn:
1. Identify own roles and responsibilities as an employee in a construction job
2. Follow safe work procedures in a construction job
3. Follow safe “Work-At-Height” procedures
4. Respond to fire emergencies
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Only students age 18 years old and above are allowed to enter the course, and are expected to:
- Be proficient in the English language (listen, speak, read and write) and adept in manipulating numerical figures - at a level comparable to Employability Skills (ES) level 2. (Applies to English Courses ONLY)
- Meet the required fitness standards.
- Capable of following oral and written work instructions
- Have the required employment status as a manual labourer to perform construction work in building and engineering construction sites.
- Possess adequate organisational skills.

This is a mandatory training course for Occupational First Aiders. The aim of the course is to train individuals to render first aid treatment to the casualty during an emergency or accident at the workplace.
Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid) Regulations 2006 Reg. 5 (2) stipulates that “every person appointed as a First Aider shall have undergone and successfully completed such training in first-aid treatment as the Commissioner may approve”.
What You'll Learn:
1. Enables trainees and corporates to renew and meet Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) act requirements.
2. Update trainees on safety protocols and safety regulations at workplace.

5. Recap appropriate response and establish emergency action plan
6. Identifying common hazards and dangers at the work place

Course Title: PWM-Security: Security Surveillance Management (Perform Remote Surveillance Function)
About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the PWM-Security Sector.

Remote surveillance often works in conjunction with security systems and are often internet-connected, so people can monitor the feed from anywhere. These used by both consumers and businesses alike to keep an eye on sensitive or vulnerable areas. 
CCTV surveillance often work in conjunction with security systems and are often internet-connected, so people can monitor the feed from anywhere. These used by both consumers and businesses alike to keep an eye on sensitive or vulnerable areas. 
In the security industry, CCTV surveillance training will equip security personnel with the necessary knowledge and abilities, as well as integrated competencies in the ever-evolving security landscape. This in turn help drive changes in the security industry, creating new value and productivity for their clients. Security personnel will thus be able to gain an advantage in terms of career prospects and personal development.
What You'll Learn:
Topic 1: Introduction to Remote Surveillance
Understanding the fundamental and principles of remote surveillance systems and operations
 Operate remote surveillance equipment in accordance to organisation operating procedures
 Carry out basic troubleshooting and report equipment faults to supervisors

Topic 2: CCTV Surveillance Cameras
Identify and differentiate the different types and purposes of surveillance cameras
 Types and uses of security remote surveillance equipment
 Carry out basic troubleshooting and report equipment faults to supervisors

Proficiency in reading, writing, and speaking English at WPL Level 3.
Ability to read content displayed on a computer monitor and have clear vision at a distance.
Basic skills in operating a computer.
Smartphone with an internet connection and QR code scanner function (this will be used during the POLWEL assessment).

In addition, learners will also learn search and recovery techniques which are specific to buildings due to the complexity and multi-level nature of buildings. This is in line with national CERT standards.
