Course Title: WSQ Inbound Marketing (TikTok)
About This Course:
1. Able to design an organization's inbound marketing implementation plan to attract prospects
2. Construct an overall organizational guide that drives customer-centric information
3. Able to design a customer decision journey mapping to convert prospects into leads
4. Able to create a con-tent and curation process across channels to meet the objectives of the inbound marketing plan
5. Able to review and optimize organization's inbound marketing strategy implementation and effectiveness
What You'll Learn:
Inbound marketing is an umbrella term, it encompasses a lot of unique tactics. After all, there’s more than one way to get a potential customer on your website, A blog, An infographic, An E-Book, A webinar, A Podcast, and even TikTok marketing is the practice to promote a brand, product or service. It can include different tactics, like influencer marketing, TikTok advertising and creating organic viral content.

As consumers grow smarter, their need to be marketed has changed. Now, they prefer to look for information on their own. And once they are convinced, they themselves want to reach out to the brands. Inbound marketing methodology is the perfect way to market to modern consumers. It is a technique that can help you market to the people who are reaching out to you. Inbound marketing methodology focuses on reaching potential customers who do not like interruptive messages or content. It provides consumers with the information they are already looking for. In this learning process, businesses can market to their potential customers while educating and solving their problems along the way.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Have a basic understanding of the inbound market and social media guideline, standard operating procedures and regulation 
• Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 5 
• Have basic experience on a different types of social media platform, tools and their operation e.g. YouTube, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram etc.
• Basic knowledge rules and regulations and terms of use of specific social media platforms and IMDA act on media
• At least Secondary school education.
• Workplace Literacy, IT and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 5 or equivalent. 
•     Learners must have basic understanding of Microsoft Word and Microsoft PowerPoint for written assessment and project work.

Course Title: Respond to Fire Incident in Workplace
About This Course:
• Introduce or reinforce the relevant legislations surrounding the formations and activation of CERT.
• Familiarize participants with the various possible fire hazards and the usage of fire protection systems in buildings.
• Instruct participants on correct methods to conduct initial fire-fighting using various extinguishing mediums.
What You'll Learn:
1. Legislations & regulations of fire safety and protection  (Comprehension)
2. Overview of Emergency Response Plan (Comprehension)
3. Overview of Company Emergency Response Team (CERT) (Knowledge) 
4. Potential fire hazard scenarios and injury (Comprehension)
5. Fire situation assessment (Comprehension)
6. Types and usage of fire protection system (Comprehension)
7. Fire extinguishing  (Comprehension)
8. Handover incident and provide operational assistance to the appropriate body (Application)
Minimum Entry Requirement:
This unit does not have any pre-requisites, meaning there are no courses or educational qualifications you must have in order to enrol.  However, learners are assumed to:
• Have related work experience
• Be able to listen, read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 4
• Self-directed learner
• Possess an open and analytical mind

Course Title: Certificate in Generic Manufacturing Skills (Integration)
About This Course:
At the end of the course, learner is able to:
• identify and describe opportunities for minor adjustments to work tasks to improve workflow, interact effectively with others and apply ethical codes of practice. 
• demonstrate some responsibility for their own learning and performance, take reference from and apply known solutions to familiar problems, work activities typically require minimal or no prior working experience.
What You'll Learn: Certificate in Generic Manufacturing Skills (Integration) develop learners who are able to demonstrate the learning outcomes based on the five domains of competence (Knowledge and Analysis; Application and Adaption; Innovation and Value Creation; Social Intelligence and Ethics; Learning to Learn) which are referenced from the Singapore Skills Framework Level 1. Overall, the learner would be able to operate in a standardised work context that is well-defined and use procedural knowledge to perform work tasks in defined work contexts under close supervision.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Check CTAG

Course Title: Workplace Safety and Health for Food and Beverage Operations Level 2
About This Course:
LU1: Overview of WSH policies, procedures and management system
- Describe the overview of the WSH management system and adhere to WSH policy and procedures in accordance to the WSH Act

LU2: Importance of maintaining work safety
- Explain the importance of a safe work environment and identify non-compliances, unsafe work conditions and practices 

LU3: Analysis of workplace tools and equipments
- Explain the importance of using PPE and safety devices for safe operations and to comply with it at the workplace following organisational WSH policies and control measures

LU4: HACCP and Risk assessments 
- Identify hazards using HACCP principles to mitigate unsafe work practices and conditions

LU5: Safety signs and hazard symbols
- Distinguish and interpret the types of safety signs and hazard symbols in order to comply with organisational directives and risk control methods

LU6: Conducting compliance inspections and reporting to stakeholders
- Assist in the conduct of compliance inspections and communicate associated risks and control measures to relevant stakeholders
What You'll Learn:
This course aims to help employees in Food Services Sector to support organisational workplace safety and health (WSH) by conducting checks according to work plans and instructions.

LU1: Overview of WSH policies, procedures and management system
LU2: Importance of maintaining work safety
LU3: Analysis of workplace tools and equipments
LU4: HACCP and Risk assessments 
LU5: Safety signs and hazard symbols
LU6: Conducting compliance inspections and reporting to stakeholders
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Have an understanding of the organisation’s product and service offering 
• Have an understanding of the organisation’s structure, standard operating procedures and guidelines on a relevant area of work. 
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification Literacy Level 3.

Course Title: Real Estate Salesperson (RES) Course
About This Course:
The objectives of the RES Examination are to ensure that new entrants meet the following requirements before they practice as real estate salespersons.

Possess the fundamental knowledge of real estate concepts, real estate market, law of contract, law of agency, planning and development control, and principles of marketing so as to be professionally knowledgeable when performing estate agency work.
Able to apply knowledge required for estate agency services, in particular knowledge on the handling of sale and lease of residential, commercial and industrial properties and including but not limited to title searches, immigration checks and financial calculations.
Understand and apply good ethics, relevant laws and regulations, and best practices in estate agency work so as to uphold the professional standing of salespersons.
Be knowledgeable about prevailing market information and government policies and regulations.
What You'll Learn: The RES course prepares new entrants with Real Estate fundaentals and knowledge of Singapore laws and policies on relevant scope involving the real estate industry. Upon completing th RES course, the new entrant are required to pass the RES exam within 2 years  and register as salesperson with CEA before handling any real estate transactions legally.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Singapore Citizen & SPR 21 years old above

Course Title: Operate Scissor Lift

Practice for Working Safely At Height related to MEWP

control measures

of a risk assessment conducted and according to the manufacturer’s guidelines.

Institution: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Basic Cardiac Life Support and AED (Asynchronous e-learning and Practical)
About This Course: The BCLS with CPR AED Blended course equips participants with the skills for resuscitating the collapsed adult and infant victims. Successful candidates will be awarded with a BCLS certificate and CPR AED accredited by Singapore Resuscitation and First Aid Council with 2-year validity. Trainees can complete the theory modules of the course online and thereafter attend a classroom training session for the practical modules and assessment
What You'll Learn:
• Cardiac Arrest and You – Introduction, the heart, the lungs and the circulation, risk factors for heart attack, what happens in a heart attack, what happens in a cardiac arrest, other common causes of cardiac arrest, the chain of survival. 
• Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) – The importance of Early CPR, Adult One – Rescuer CPR, Standards for proper chest compressions, the recovery position. 
• Automated external Defibrillator (AED) – The importance of Early defibrillation, AED, Preparation of AED use, Placement of Defibrillation Pads, Defibrillation Procedures, AED Protocol Summary, Post – incident Procedures, Child / Infant defibrillation. 
• Adult Foreign Body Airway Obstruction 
• Child CPR 
• Child Foreign Body Airway Obstruction
• Infant CPR 
• Infant Foreign Body Airway Obstruction
Minimum Entry Requirement: Primary Education

Course Title: Manage Work At Height
About This Course:
This course is designed to meet the minimum standard for working at height training for supervisors, assessors or managers in Singapore, as recommended in the WSH (Work At Heights) Regulations 2013 and the Approved code of practice for working safely at height (2011). The aim of the course is to provide learners with the requisite WAH knowledge to manage WAH activities, so that work can be carried out safely.
  1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant workplace safety and health (WSH) legislations / Approved code of practice / Singapore standards applicable to work at heights (WAH)
  2. Identify and explain the roles and responsibilities of stakeholders, competent and responsible persons,
  3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk and implement control measures for WAH activities.
  4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safe execution of WAH activities.
  5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
  6. Establish and implement a system for an effective monitoring and control of WAH risks
  7. Demonstrate competency in donning, checking and correction of Individual Fall Protection Equipment and Responding to a fall emergency.
What You'll Learn: On completion of this unit, learners will have knowledge and skills in managing work at height, so that such work can be carried out safely.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Employability Skills System (ESS) Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 4 and above, or equivalent
  • Ability to carry out hazards identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.  Only participants with a minimum of 100% attendance on training hours will be allowed to sit for the examination.

Course Title: Perform Work in Confined Space Operation
About This Course: To equipped learners with the necessary knowledge and expertise to perform the duties of an entrant and attendant when working in a confined space, use gas detection instruments and participate in an emergency situation.
What You'll Learn:
- Identify duties and responsibilities of all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Codes of Practice
- Identify confined space hazards
- Use Gas Detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring
- Comply with Permit-to-Work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space
- Participate in an Emergency for confined space

Course Title: Manage Work At Height
About This Course:
The aim of the course is to provide course learners with the requisite WAH knowledge to supervise, plan/assess and manage work at height activities so that work is carried out properly and safely.

At the end of the course, the learners shall be able to:

1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant WSH Legislations / Approved Code of Practices / Singapore Standards applicable to Work-at-Heights

2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of Stakeholders, Competent Person and Responsible Person

3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for WAH activities

4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safe execution of WAH activities

5.Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan

6. Establish and implement a system for an effective monitoring and control of WAH risks

7. Demonstrate competency in donning, checking and correcting of Individual Fall Protection Equipment and First Response to a fall emergency
What You'll Learn:
This course has been designed to meet the minimum standard for Working at Height Training for Supervisors, Assessors and Managers in Singapore, as recommended in the WSH (Work at Heights) Regulations 2013 and the Approved Code of Practice for Working Safely at Height (2011). The course is for anyone involved in the supervision, planning/assessment or management of work at height activities.

The provisions under the Regulations regarding the roles of the various personnel under the PTW system still apply.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
At least WSQ ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 4 and above or equivalent and the ability to carry out hazards identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

It is also highly recommended that all learners undertaking this course shall be physically fit so as to complete all practical activities.

• Participants will acquire the skills to manage child illnesses through regular emergency drills and effectively communicate parents' concerns.

Course Title: Standard First Aid + AED (NROC Coaches)
About This Course:
This course provides the relevant knowledge and skills needed to apply first aid to adult casualty during any medical emergency that might arise and to use the Automated Defibrillator (AED) safely.  

Recognise a medical emergency situation.

Activate the appropriate emergency response system and follow the Emergency Action Principles. 

Recognise the signs and symptoms of identified emergencies, illnesses and injuries.

Perform the necessary and correct first aid treatment to a casualty based on the emergency, illness and injury.

Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) with use of Automated External Defibrillator (AED) for adult victims.

Able to manage foreign body airway obstruction (eg. choking) for conscious or unconscious adult victims.
What You'll Learn:
Standard First Aid (SFA) + AED course is accredited by SRFAC in accordance to its guidelines and methodology stipulated. This course aims to provide participants with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate injuries and medical emergencies like severe breathing difficulties and bleedings. Participants will also learn skills and techniques to assist adults suffering from heart attack or cardiac arrest.

A valid Standard First Aid Course Certification is a requirement for all Coaches to attain or renew their coaching license under the National Registry of Coaches (NROC) of Sports Singapore.

CPR + AED Module is included in this course.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Physically healthy and able to complete course objectives

Able to speak, read and understand English effectively as our courses are conducted in English.

Course Title: Advanced Communication Strategies: Using Strategic Persuasion To Get What You Want
About This Course:
The programme aims to equip professionals with the skills to:
1. communicate clearly and concisely.
2. engage people with greater flair and confidence.
3. structure and express your ideas in more convincing and persuasive manner.
4. inspire buy-ins.
5. build stronger relationship, rapport and credibility with stakeholders.
What You'll Learn:
Day 1:
-Avoid 12 seemingly innocent communication barriers that block conversations, damage relationships and
cause conflict
-Capture and keep the attention of your listeners – even the busy ones – by learning how to communicate
clearly and concisely
-Discover powerful ways to keep your listeners excited, engaged and at the edge of their seats while you
are talking – energies, styles, behaviours and the opening lines
-Understand your communication style and influence behaviour
-Understand personality types and the styles and preferences so as to correspond in an appropriate way
-Learn how to analyse situations, select styles and behaviour, develop the flow and distancing strategy so
as to make a pitch at your advantage
-Practice session – small group role play and discussion, observation and feedback
Day 2:
-Learn about challenging influence situations – influencing teams and groups, influencing virtually,
influencing cross cultural, influencing the “Big Boys” and influence amid office politics
-Discover powerful and irresistible persuasive language patterns, phrases and scripts that you can “plug
and play” into everyday conversations to make you instantly more persuasive
-Use covert persuasion techniques to easily turn objections into agreements even with resistant people and
inspire loyalty
-Identifying and prioritising your stakeholders and develop a communication plan to help manage them
effectively
-Building strong relationship, credibility and rapport with stakeholders
-Practical assessment

Course Title: WSQ Social Media Marketing
About This Course: The Social Media Marketing course targets digital marketing personnel to enhance the individual's knowledge about the customer buying journey and ability to create and execute marketing campaigns that require websites, landing pages, and product pages. It has six learning units sequenced from the fundamentals of social media platforms (e.g., key features of each social network like Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube) to the step-by-step process of implementing a social media marketing campaign.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees will be able to define social media marketing and describe its importance in today's digital marketing landscape, including:
● selecting the right mix of social media platforms for an organisation to engage clearly defined audiences to achieve a set of marketing objectives 
● implementing research methods through the use of social media tools to discover social media opportunities and identify any gaps
● planning a comprehensive social media strategy involving the building of a customer avatar and matching of social media marketing goals to customer objectives
● proposing the most effective social media campaign activities for each channel, based on the best practices in content creation and management
● evaluating and determining the most suitable social media content types, styles and modes of delivery across the different social media platforms
● interpreting social media marketing results and navigating social media analytics tools
● designing and implementing a social media Community Management Plan to deal with audiences at the different stages of brand engagement
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● 1 GCE ‘O’ level or equivalent; OR
● NITEC/Higher NITEC; OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Institution: COSEM SAFETY & SECURITY SERVICES PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Respond to Fire Emergency in Buildings
About This Course:
On completion of this unit, the learner will have the knowledge and be equipped with the application skills to function as a member of an emergency response team in order to implement the emergency response skills during an emergency incident in buildings. This includes:
• Introduce or reinforce the relevant legislations surrounding the formations and activation of CERT.
• Familiarize participants with the various possible fire hazards and the usage of fire protection systems in buildings.
• Instruct participants on the proper donning and operating procedures of Breathing Apparatus (BA) sets.
• Familiarize the students with the appropriate techniques for use during fire-fighting in high-rise buildings and snatch rescue operations.
• Instruct participants on correct methods to conduct initial fire-fighting using various extinguishing mediums.
What You'll Learn:
ESTABLISH THE OBJECTIVES FOR RESPOND TO FIRE EMERGENCY IN BUILDING
PETROLEUM AND FLAMMABLE MATERIAL REGULATIONS
CERT AUDIT GUIDELINES AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN
CAUSES OF FIRE AND POTENTIAL FIRE HAZARD SCENARIOS AND INJURY
DIFFERENT TYPES OF FIRE SAFETY AND FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEMS
BREATHING APPARATUS
HIGH RISE FIREFIGHTING PROBLEMS AND FIREFIGHTING OPERATIONS
FIRE SAFETY COMMON FIRST AID EQUIPMENT AND CARDIOPULMONARY RESUSCITATION (CPR)
RESCUE AND EVACUATION TECHNIQUES
FIRE FIGHTING EQUIPMENT
HANDOVER INCIDENT AND PROVIDE OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE TO THE APPROPRIATE BODY

Course Title: Health and Wellness Programme Management
About This Course:
This course aims to equip employers, human resource practitioners, operation supervisors, and people managers with the skills and knowledge on supporting employees with inclusive health and wellness workplace and programs.

This course also aims to address the following learning needs of its learners by training them to:
a. Acquire specialist skills to promote workplace health and safety programmes in their workplace.
b. Define the current state of the health and wellness of different employee groups.
c. Understand the benefits of employee health and wellness programmes.
d. Identify new trends and technologies that promote healthy lifestyles.
e. Understand the legislative requirements related to employee health and wellness data.
f. Use the right data collecting methods to conduct research on best practices in employee health and wellness management.
g. Review and refine the implementation of employee health and wellness programmes according to plan.
h. Gather feedback on the effectiveness of employee health and wellness programmes.
What You'll Learn:
This course focuses on enhancing employee health and wellness programs in the workplace. It explores various factors that contribute to the success of these programs, emphasising the importance of creating a healthy work environment. Learners will gain insights into the latest trends and technologies that can promote a healthy lifestyle among employees.

It delves into the best practices in managing employee health and wellness, covering topics such as designing effective wellness initiatives, creating supportive policies, and establishing a culture of well-being within the organisation. Learners will learn how to assess the needs and preferences of their workforce and tailor wellness programs accordingly.

An essential aspect is the implementation of employee health and wellness programs. Learners will learn practical strategies for planning, executing, and evaluating these initiatives. They will explore different program models and interventions, considering factors such as physical activity, nutrition, stress management, and mental well-being.

Effective communication plays a crucial role in the success of health and wellness programs, i.e. guidance on disseminating information about these initiatives to employees. Learners will learn about communication strategies by leveraging various channels, crafting engaging messages, and promoting program participation.

Furthermore, learners will gain skills in evaluating the impact of employee health and wellness programs. They will learn how to gather feedback from employees, assess program effectiveness, and make data-driven improvements. The course emphasises the importance of continuous monitoring and evaluation to ensure the long-term success of these initiatives.

Throughout the course, learners will engage in interactive sessions, case studies, and group discussions. At the end, learners will have the knowledge and tools to design, implement, and evaluate effective employee health and wellness programs.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
The Minimum Entry Requirements to ensure that learners can cope with the course as well as benefitting from peer learning through interaction are as follows:
•  Minimum ‘N’ Level and be able to read, listen, speak and write English or at a proficiency level of the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ WPLN Level 5).
•  At least 1 year of supervisory experience
•  Age between 25 to 70 years old

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher) (Chinese)
About This Course:
At the end of the course, learners will have renewed their ability to:
• LO1. Practise good personal hygiene before, during and after handling food
• LO2. Select and use safe ingredients
• LO3. Handle food safely
• LO4. Store food safely
• LO5. Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
• LO6: Adopt good workplace safety habits
What You'll Learn: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher) is a mandatory training program for all food and beverage staff working in SFA licensed food establishments and/or anyone interested to learn safe food preparation. This course will equip learners with food & beverage safety and hygiene policies and procedures to ensure food safety. Thus, with effect from 30 November 2020, the Refresher Basic Food Hygiene course is now known as Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher).
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Entry Requirements
- Food handlers will now be required to attend their first refresher training five years after completing their Basic Food Hygiene Course and the subsequent ones at 10-year intervals, instead of the previous cycle of once every three years. If you have completed your Basic Food Hygiene Course before 1 Oct 2014, you are required to attend your first refresher training three years after your course completion date instead of 5 years. 

- Learners must be able to listen, speak, read, and write English or Mandarin at a basic level (at least WPLN2). 

- Learners must provide a copy of their old Basic Food Hygiene Course certificate to be eligible for the refresher course.

Course Title: Deterrence (Perform Security Duties at Protected Areas and Protected Places)
About This Course:
The purpose of this course is to enable Security Officers and Auxiliary Police Officers to acquire the fundamental knowledge and be equipped with the application skills to deter undesired outcomes when on duty at protected areas and protected places.


This course is designed to enhance knowledge and abilities of officers on Infrastructure Protection Act 2017 which includes:


a) Interpretations of section in Infrastructure Protection Act 2017

b) Powers of inspection at 'surrounding areas' of Protected Areas and Protected Places

c) Powers over photography and UAV

d) Guidelines on Move-On Order
What You'll Learn:
The training hour for this course is 24 hours. It consists of Knowledge 1 to Knowledge 7 and Ability 1 to Ability 6.

The following delivery strategies and methods are catered for the intended target audience:

. Lecture / Presentation
. Demonstration cum practice
. Role play (Scenario Based)
. Case Study
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Target Audience
Personnel performing the role of Auxiliary Police Officer (APO) and Auxiliary Police Officer (Enforcement) (APOE) and Security Officer

Entry Requirements
Learners must;
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WPL Level 4 
• Be able to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 4 
• Be able to act in a professional manner 
• Be able to observe confidently 
• Be vigilant at all times


Nationality
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent Residents or Malaysian holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Age
The minimum entry age for an APO and Security Officer shall be 18 years old at the time of application and the maximum age shall be 60 years old.

Physical and Medical Requirement
• Certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work
• Not be colour-blind or hearing impaired

Education Qualifications

• The minimum entry educational qualification for Auxiliary Police Officers and APO (Enforcement) shall be 3 GCE

This course aims to help the organisation to implement workplace safety and health (WSH) practices in accordance with legislative requirements.

This course aims to help the Barista/Bartender/ Wine Server /Wine Waiter /Commis Sommelier / Host / Hostess / Crew Leader/ Pastry Cook/ Baker/ Senior Cook / Station Chef/ Server / Service Crew / Runner/ Assistant Pastry Cook / Assistant Baker / Kitchen Assistant/ Cook / Kitchen Assistant to support organisational compliance to workplace safety and health (WSH) legal and other requirements within the work area by conducting checks according to work plans and instructions.

Introduction to Breads

Course Title: Customer Experience Innovation (SF - Supervisor)
About This Course: With consumers’ ever-increasing demands and expectations cum the many shifts and changing dynamics of retail, businesses will need help with technology and data science combined with human ingenuity to forecast trends thereby provide insights to design for consumers and be future-ready. Participants will learn the importance of customer experience and the needs to innovate.
What You'll Learn:
It is a challenging time for brands and businesses today as the retail landscape is continuously evolving and ‘The Experience Factor’ in the retail environment has vastly heightened.
  
Businesses will need help with technology and data science combined with human ingenuity to forecast trends thereby provide insight to design for tomorrow’s consumers and be future-ready. 
 
In the Customer Experience Innovation – Future Of Customer Experience module, participants learn the importance of Customer Experience and the need to modernise business structures – with consumers’ ever-increasing demands and expectations cum the many shifts and changing dynamics of retail mutations forming blurred lines between industries … fashion, beauty, food, interior sectors to big data and new tech, pushing the limits of marketing and business strategies.

The course will cover the following topics:

- What is customer experience?

- Moving away from touchpoints to journey

- Why customer experience matters?

- Necessary factors for an unforgettable customer experience

- Making customer experience a competitive advantage

- Customer experience measurement
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- GCE 'O' level Credit (at least C6) in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) score: Level 5 for Reading, Listening and Numeracy; and
- With at least 2 years supervisory working experience in retail or 3 years supervisory / managerial working experience in non-retail sector.

Course Title: Threat Observation (Recognise Terrorist Threats)
About This Course: On completion of this course, learner will have the knowledge, skills and attitudes required of a Security Officer and Auxiliary Police Officer to describe contemporary terrorist threats, identify person-borne threats, vehicle-borne threats and object-based threats.
What You'll Learn:
This course consists of the following abilities:
A1 - Identify persons found to be behaving suspiciously
A2 - Identify disorderly and threatening behaviour
A3 - Recognise impact of successful terrorist attack on assignment area based on updated information on current terrorist threats
A4 - Recognise person borne, vehicle-borne and object-based threats based on various TTI of malicious intent and obvious signs
A5 - Take appropriate action to observe suspicious person(s), vehicles in accordance with protocols in dealing with the respective threats
A6 - Conduct security questioning on suspicious persons after period of observation
A7 - Review and report collected information to relevant person / authorities in accordance with organisational procedure on terrorism
K1 - Characteristics of terrorists
K2 - Methods of terrorist attack
K3 - Trends in terrorism
K4 -Types of observation skills to recognise tell-tale indicators
K5 - Tell-tale Indicators (TTI) of suspected casing activities, objects or mails with improvised Explosives Devices (IEDs) and chemical or biological agents
K6 - Tell-tale Indicators (TTI) of suspected person-borne, vehicle-borne Improvised Explosive Devices (IED)
K7 - Tell-tale Indicators (TTI) of suspected casing by Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)
K8 - Protocols on dealing with person-borne threats, vehicle-borne threats and object-based threats
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Qualification:
• The minimum entry educational qualification for Auxiliary Police Officers and APO (Enforcement) below the rank of Auxiliary Police Inspector shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent.
• The minimum entry educational qualification for Security Officer shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent and have completed the Basic Licensing Unit. 

Nationality:
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent Residents or Malaysian holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Physical and Medical Requirement:
• Certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work
• Not be colour-blind or hearing impaired

Entry Requirements:
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WPL Level 4 
• Be able to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 4 
• Be able to act in a professional manner

Course Title: goRPA (Robotic Process Automation)
About This Course:
Too many administrative and repetitive tasks to manage? Keen to automate some of your work processes and eliminate human errors? Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is the solution!

goRPA (Robotic Process Automation) empower employees to increase productivity and eliminate errors through the automation of repetitive admin work. With RPA, our more time can be channelled to higher value-add work. 

This course is conducted in two phases: 

- Phase 1: A two-day classroom session on the introduction to RPA, sharing of use cases, hands-on scripting exercises in RPA, RPA project management, and reviewing of participants’ use case processes.

- Phase 2: Three half-day sessions to facilitate RPA use case implementation. Project teams with one to four participants will be formed to embark on their first use case projects. Mentors will be assigned to facilitate each project group.
What You'll Learn:
1. Learn how RPA can automate repetitive admin tasks through hands-on exercises 
2. Identify and review administrative, repetitive tasks to be automated
3. Apply RPA to automate tasks to first use case project
Minimum Entry Requirement: Proficiency in English

Course Title: Occupational First Aid Course (Refresher)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:
1. Explain the duties and responsibilities of a First Aider.

Aid) Regulations.
3. Check and pack contents of First Aid Box.
4. Apply first aid to accident victims in the workplace.
5. Manage a medical emergency at the workplace.
6. Manage victims of hazardous chemicals exposure.
7. Identify common workplace accidents requiring first aid treatment.
What You'll Learn:
This is a mandatory training course for Occupational First Aiders. The aim of
the course is to train individuals to render first aid treatment to the casualty during an emergency or accident at the workplace.
Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid) Regulations stipulates that “every
person appointed as a first-aider shall (a) have successfully completed a
training course acceptable to the Commissioner; and (b) undergo such
subsequent re-training in first-aid treatment as the Commissioner may
require”.

What You'll Learn: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher) is a mandatory training program for all food and beverage staff working in SFA licensed food establishments and/or anyone interested to learn safe food preparation. Thus, with effect from 30 November 2020, the Refresher Basic Food Hygiene course is now known as Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher).

Course Title: Performing Effective Product Demonstration (Level 1)
About This Course:
As we observe the reopening of economy across various sectors, there is an increased in demand of being able to demonstrate product accurately to customers. During the past few years of pandemic, consumers have to undertake the active role of seeking for information on their own, often virtually. Now that Singapore enters the new-normal of moving endemic phase, customers has returned to retail stores, requesting for information face to face. Employees are found ill-prepared for such engagements and aren’t always able to satisfy customers’ demand for information to make better decisions for themselves. In addition, there’s an exponential increase in online shopping. With more online purchases made, organisations are required to have delivery personnel who are capable to demonstrate product on delivery.

By the end of this course, learners will be able to:

LO1: Take precautionary steps during preparation of product demonstration to ensure compliance to Consumer Protection (Fair Trading) Act 
LO2: Determine suitability of the environment to conduct product demonstration
LO3: Prepare required logistics and  documents for product demonstration
LO4: Get product ready for demonstration
LO5: Conduct product demonstration confidently and in accordance to organisation's requirements
LO6: Apply different methods of product demonstration based on requirements
LO7: Effective Communication with customers through using and interpreting verbal and non-verbal communication cues
LO8: Address all customers' requirements using appropriate questioning skills
What You'll Learn:
The following Target Sectors are selected to benefit from this course: 
- Start-ups and New Business 
- Small and Medium Enterprises (SME)

This course has been designed to assist these Target Sectors to acquire the skills and knowledge to addressing the demands of product demonstration within their organisations.  As the set-up of these organisations are small, they are heavily reliant on each contributing member within the organisation to be able to be representatives and demonstrators of the products and services rendered.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Assumed Skills
Learners are assumed to: 
- Possess reasonable command of written and spoken English as the delivery and assessment will be conducted in English.

Assumed Attitude
Learners are assumed to: 
- Be open to active learning and sharing as there will be open discussions and a personal reflection component in the assessment.

Assumed Knowledge
Learners are assumed to: 
- know how to interpret social cues and body language

A1 - Operate security screening equipment to capture relevant evidence in accordance to organisation standard operating procedures (SOPs)

Qualification:

• The minimum entry educational qualification for Security Officer shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent and have completed the Basic Licensing Unit. 

Nationality:
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent Residents or Malaysian holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Entry Requirements:

Course Title: Fashion & Fabrics (Basic Top & Skirt)
About This Course:
BEFORE TRAINING:
Learners are not familiar with the technicalities of fabric materials and are not able to fully utilize this knowledge in developing garment designs or merchandise range. Likewise, they are not aware of how to optimize material consumption most efficiently and reduce material waste.

Learners are not equipped with the hard skills to allow for alterations or customizations for their clients in their garment merchandise range. Their designs and customizations may be limited by their technical knowledge and are very dependent on the expertise of others, especially those overseas, to produce and/or alter for them.

AFTER TRAINING:
With this course, learners are able to utilize their technical knowledge of fabrics in their jobs to improve their design development and enhance their merchandise range and selection. Their understanding of materials will enable them to make the most suitable selections for garment production and design, as well as being able to utilize materials most efficiently with an awareness of how to upcycle.

Learners are equipped with the technical knowledge to create the foundational womenswear top & skirt patterns for any body size and achieve industry recognition towards the skills of patternmaking & sewing through the structured curriculum.

WHERE THESE SKILLS APPLY IN THE INDUSTRY:

Retail staff and retailers for fashion labels who possess this competence will be able to advise their clients based on material quality, finishing, fit and design that is suitable for their clients. 
Merchandisers and buyers will have fundamental understanding on good quality finishes, fit and whether the material selection is ideal for the garment in purchasing for their label. 
Fashion Designers and label owners will be equipped with the selection criteria for materials and will be able to do samples and alterations on their own. 
Tailors, seamstresses and pattern drafters will be able to advance their skills in customizing garments
What You'll Learn:
This course will provide a strong foundation starting with the understanding of fabric materials, its fiber characteristics and how it impacts design. 

Thereafter learners will get immersed into the process of garment production from conception, design fundamentals, taking measurements, patternmaking, cutting and material layout, sample making, sewing and finally alterations. Learners will also understand industry practices through using industry tools and symbolic labelling. 

All these through the practical applications of womenswear garments that can be applied to both slow (bespoke) and fast fashion.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
LANGUAGE & LITERACY PROFICIENCY & MINIMUM EDUCATION LEVEL:
The education requirements of learners:
1. Learners should possess PSLE Math and English OR;
2. Possess the Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) proficiency equivalent at level 4

TARGET AGE GROUP:
Adults between 25 - 60 years

ASSUMED ASK & EXPERIENCE:
Medium level of anxiety to learn as learners are highly motivated to either use this skill as a source of upgrading their skillset or employment, however they have to actively keep up with the pace of the curriculum and fulfil the assessment. It is very skills-based and people are very open and attentive and are medium to highly motivated to learn and practice as this foundation course opens up a lot of potential in further development.

As this is a foundation course, we target 2 groups:
1. Learners with little experience and are new to the industry 
2. Learners with many years of experience but are interested to develop a part of the skillset they don't possess

individuals assigned as Lifting Supervisor in the workplace.

Course Title: WSQ TikTok Content Creation
About This Course:
This content creation course is targeted at any working professional in any sector who want to use TikTok as a marketing platform. They will acquire the expertise to craft engaging videos that resonate with TikTok's vast user base, including the significant portion in Singapore. 

This training not only equips the learner with the know-how to make their content popular but also strategically aligns with their company's objectives. Emphasizing practical skills that cater to current industry demands, this course positions the learner advantageously for career growth, whether they're starting fresh or building on existing knowledge.

2. Examine various types and styles of content to be delivered to customers on TikTok

3. Construct digital storyboards with principles of digital storytelling

4. Develop a content delivery process of marketing content delivery to TikTok users

5. Create guidelines for executing a TikTok content strategy

Course Title: Perform Work in Confined Space Operation
About This Course:
At the end of the programme you will be able to:

•Know the Legal Requirements on confined spaces as stipulated by the WSH Act. WSH (confined space) Regulations; WSH (Construction) Regulations; WSH (Ship Building & Ship Repairing) Regulations; WSH (General Provision) and Code of Practice for Confined Spaces (SS 568:2011) 
•Know the Penalties for non compliances under WSH Act
•Know the Roles, responsibilities and activities of an entrant and attendant
•Know the Roles and responsibilities of supervisor, confined space safety assessor, rescue personnel and authorized manager
•Identify the Types of confined space and work carried out in confined space  
•State the Types of personal protection equipment and their functions
•State the Types of respiratory protection equipment and their uses
•Follow and state the Types of safety / warning signs
•Know and state the Types of atmospheric hazards and their consequences
•Know and state the Types of physical and biological hazards and their consequences
•Know the Risks when working in a confined space, severity of consequences and likelihood
•Know the Symptoms of persons exposed to typical atmospheric hazards
•Know and state the Methods to prevent and control confined space hazards
•Know the Types of common gas detection instruments and their uses
•Know the Limitations of gas detection instruments
•Know the Common mistakes when using gas detection instruments
What You'll Learn:
This competency unit consists of the following elements:
CE1.Identify duties and responsibilities of all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Codes of Practice
CE2.Identify confined space hazards
CE3.Use Gas Detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring
CE4.Comply with Permit-to-Work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space
CE5. Participate in an Emergency for confined space

Course Title: Data Visualization Begins With Me
About This Course:
"Numbers can only tell so much on paper. As the saying goes – a picture is worth a thousand words. The value of analysis is very limited if it cannot be clearly communicated to others through the use of visualisations, and this can lead to missed business opportunities.
 
This one-day course will cover the analytics process, data cleaning techniques, how to conduct exploratory data analysis within the data and apply visualisation techniques that help to “tell the story” that resides within the data.

At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
• Explain the key visualisation concepts and principles with reference to the business environment
• Understand how to choose the appropriate visualisation for the intended purpose 
• Create effective visuals to understand business data and present business insights using visualisation application
• Communicate insights effectively by applying appropriate data visualisation techniques as a data story
"
What You'll Learn:
"Numbers can only tell so much on paper. As the saying goes – a picture is worth a thousand words. The value of analysis is very limited if it cannot be clearly communicated to others through the use of visualisations, and this can lead to missed business opportunities.
 
This one-day course will cover the analytics process, data cleaning techniques, how to conduct exploratory data analysis within the data and apply visualisation techniques that help to “tell the story” that resides within the data.

• Understand how to choose the appropriate visualisation for the intended purpose 
• Create effective visuals to understand business data and present business insights using visualisation application
• Communicate insights effectively by applying appropriate data visualisation techniques as a data story
"

Course Title: Implement Incident Management Processes

3. Utilise appropriate communication methods when managing an incident to control all internal and external resources.

5. Undertake post-emergency evaluation and debrief.

Minimum entry requirements

About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the PWM-Food Services Sector.

Previously known as the Basic Food Hygiene Refresher Course, this half-day Singapore Food Agency (SFA) accredited course aims to equip food handlers of both retail and non-retail food establishments with the REFRESHER knowledge and application skills to follow food safety and hygiene procedures and policies, as well as maintain the cleanliness and upkeep of premises.
What You'll Learn:
- It is a regulatory requirement to pass this course in order to be a food handler.
- To equip you with the REFRESHER knowledge and skills to prepare safe and hygienic food.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Food handlers will now be required to attend their first refresher training five years after completing their Basic Food Hygiene Course and the subsequent ones at 10-year intervals, instead of the previous cycle of once every three years. If you have completed your Basic Food Hygiene Course before 1 Oct 2014, you are required to attend your first refresher training three years after your course completion date instead of 5 years.

Course Title: Occupational First Aid Course
About This Course:
Upon completing of this program, the participants shall be able to:

 Explain the duties and responsibilities of First Aider
 List the legal requirements under Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid)
Regulations 2006 for the workplace
 Check and pack contents of First Aid Box
 Apply first aid to accident victims in the workplace
 Manage a medical emergency at the workplace
 Manage victims of hazardous chemicals exposure
 Identify common workplace accidents requiring first aid treatment
What You'll Learn:
This is a mandatory training course for Occupational First Aiders. The aim of the course is to train individuals to render first aid treatment to the casualty during an emergency or accident at the workplace.

Workplace Safety and Health (First Aid) Regulations 2006 stipulates that “every person appointed as a first-aider shall (a) have successfully completed a training course acceptable to the Commissioner; and (b) undergo such subsequent re-training in first-aid treatment as the Commissioner may require”.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
This course assumes a sufficient level of English language proficiency to benefit from the training program and undertake the assessment, such as ESS Workplace literacy and numeracy Lever 5 and above.

Participants who do not possess the assumed knowledge and skills set out above should not be precluded from training but it is recommended that they be consulted and advised on suitable preparatory course that they could undertake to improve their ability to benefit from the course.

Course Title: WSQ Search Engine Optimisation
About This Course: This course provides a comprehensive overview of search engine optimisation (SEO), which is the practice of optimising a website to improve its ranking and visibility in search engine results pages (SERPs). It will focus on both the technical and creative aspects of SEO, providing trainees with a comprehensive knowledge of the subject. Through hands-on exercises and projects, trainees will gain practical experience in implementing SEO strategies and techniques, including analysing SEO data via Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and commercial SEO tools.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to assess and propose suitable marketing channels and platforms to develop a marketing plan, including:
● assessing the advantages and disadvantages of SEO and SEM, and proposing suitable search marketing tools and SEO activities to address marketing objectives and target customers
● conducting extensive keyword research to curate relevant content to reinforce the organisation’s competitive advantage, key messages, and brand, and implementing on-page SEO to increase organic search engine rankings
● developing content marketing and linking building plan to rank various types of content on the organic search engine results pages
● measuring and analysing the effectiveness of SEO campaigns and determining factors that can improve keyword rankings and SEO-related KPIs and metrics
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● WPLN Level 5
● 1 GCE ‘O’ level or equivalent (≥ 21 years old); OR
● NITEC/Higher NITEC (≥ 21 years old); OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Course Title: Asian Delights: Noodles (Japanese Cuisine)
About This Course:
Unit 1: Prepare Ingredients for Japanese Noodle Dishes
Unit 2: Japanese Noodle Dishes
Unit 3: Presenting Japanese Noodle Dishes
What You'll Learn: This course will expose learners to the basics of Japanese Cuisine development, particularly focused in the various types of Japanese Noodle cuisine. Learners embarking on this course will have an idea on what to expect when working in a professional or home kitchen.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
a) At least 18 years old
b) Have at least secondary 2 school education
c) Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification Workplace Literacy Level (WPL Level 3)

Course Title: PWM-Security: Deterrence (Manage Disorderly Conduct & Threatening Behavior)

Course Title: Operate Lorry Crane Course
About This Course: 1.State the legislative requirements for the safe use of lorry crane 2.List the duties and responsibilities of personnel involved in lifting operations 3.Identify the principal components of a lorry crane 4.Identify hazards and implement control measures involving lorry crane operation 5.Checking of ground condition and proximity hazards 6.Conduct pre-lift inspection of lifting accessories on lorry crane 7.Practice good housekeeping of lifting accessories 8.Select the appropriate rigging equipment 9.Estimation of load and determine centre of gravity 10.State the factors affecting lifting capacity and interpret load chart 11.Respond to lifting accidents and emergencies 12.Observe safety when operating a lorry crane 13.Set up outrigger for lifting operation 14.Load / Unload materials onto the lorry crane safely 15.Lift and place materials using the lorry crane safely
What You'll Learn: 1. Introduction to lorry crane operations. 2. Fundamentals of lorry crane operations. 3. Safe Work Practices. 4. Conduct Routine Checks. 5. Plan Lifting Operations 6. Set Up Crane. 7.Lift and Transfer Load. 8. Shut down and Secure Crane. 9.Practice. 10. Review

Course Title: Safe and Defensive Driving Light Vehicle - Class 3 (Classroom)
About This Course:
This training programme aims to trainer the truck drivers (Class 3) to equip the knowledge and skills to equips drivers with the necessary defensive driving skills and techniques to recognize these hazards, and the preventive measures to be taken.

It helps the learner to avoid possible accident by identifying possible hazards on road or workplace and adequately be prepared to cope with pressures of safe driving.
What You'll Learn:
The learners are able to identify road hazards which can help them to avoid accident
The learners are able to recognise potential hazards using visual perceptive skills
The learners are able to explain the limitations of light vehicle (Class 3)
The learners are able to explain the type of defensive driving techniques used to avoid hazards
The learners will be able to identify signs of fatigue and know when to conduct safety precaution techniques for themselves.

Course Title: Guard and Patrol (Perform Armed Guard and Patrol Duties) - Blended Learning
About This Course: On completion of this course, learner will have the knowledge, skills and attitudes required of an Auxiliary Police Officer to prepare daily work activities, perform armed guard access control duties and armed patrol duties, report incidents as well as hand and take over duties.
What You'll Learn:
This course consists of the following Knowledge and Abilities:
K1 - Organizational procedures for preparing and performing armed guard and patrol activities
K2 - Types of facility premises
K3 - Site layouts and locations of assignment
K4 - Types of equipment required for armed guard and patrol activities
K5 - Organizational procedures on use of firearms
K6 - Relevant legal requirements and standards relating to armed guard and patrol activities
K7 - Protocols in handling incident security breaches and irregularities while performing armed guard and patrol activities
K8 - Force and guard duties doctrine
K9 - Principles of effective communication
K10 - Organizational procedures for reporting of incidents during guard and patrol activities
K11 – Types of mobile interface and technology
A1 - Check and clarify assignment details with appropriate authorities
A2 - Prepare and arrange equipment necessary for armed guard and patrol duties
A3 - Perform guarding and patrolling of premises in accordance with organisational procedures with the use of mobile devices
A4 - Perform appreciation of area according to organisational procedures
A5 - Access the situation to determine the type of risks and threats occurred during duty
A6 - Take appropriate action to situations involving suspicious objects and person in accordance with organisational operating procedures
A7 - Provide situation reports to control room periodically in accordance with organisational operating procedures
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Qualification:

• The minimum entry educational qualification for Security Officer shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent and have completed the Basic Licensing Unit. 

Nationality:
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent Residents or Malaysian holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Course Title: PWM-Food Service: Food Safety Course Level 3 (Chinese)
About This Course:
This course is only intended for the low wage workers in the PWM-Food Services Sector.

At the end of the 3-day course, learners will be able to :
- Conduct food safety and hygiene checks on personal hygiene practices, usage of safe ingredients, safe handling of food, food storage, equipment and cleanliness of entire premises to identify hygiene lapses and manage non-conformance

-Understand concepts and principles of Pre-Requisite Programs and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) system 

-Implement food safety and hygiene inspection policies and procedures, manage and address nonconformance issues through effective implementation of pre-requisite programmes and HACCP-based Food Safety Management System (FSMS)
What You'll Learn:
This course aims to equip supervisors and managers in food establishments with the application, skills and knowledge to conduct food safety and hygiene checks 

Learners will learn about food safety practices and regulatory requirements, pre-requisite programmes implemented in food establishments, methods used to conduct food safety and hygiene inspection/check, food safety and hygiene lapses and corrective actions, and concepts and principles of Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participants will be required to have the ability to converse, read & write in Chinese.

Course Title: Hawker Delights
About This Course: This course aims to aid learners on how to prepare local favourites, to aid them in their employment and career placement opportunities in F&B establishments.

Course Title: WSQ Affiliate Marketing Essential
About This Course:
1. The learner will be able to examine key components of an organisation’s affiliate marketing strategies and develop an implementation plan in alignment to the organization’s overall marketing strategy.

2.The learner will be able to analyse different affiliate partners and platforms to develop an affiliate marketing portfolio for organization’s products and services. 

3.The learner will be able to examine policies and guidelines on affiliate marketing and analyse critical factors on affiliate partners selection.  

4.The learner will be able to review affiliate marketing campaign management and monitor performance metrics on ROI (Returns on Investment)
What You'll Learn:
Affiliate marketing is a digital marketing model that connects retailers with independent sales and marketers who are willing to invest time and money to sell their products. 

Most of the available affiliate marketing models are based on performance which means that retailers only pay when the affiliate delivers a specific customer action. 

In ecommerce, it can be an online purchase which makes affiliate marketing a cost-effective way for retailers.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Our target audience include marketing/sales executives and managers who are in the retail sector for at least a minimum of six months and wish to upskill as well as individuals who are interested in a career in digital marketing. 

The assumed skills and knowledge for this course are as follows:

• Aged between 20 years old and above 
• Minimum at least 1 GCE “O” level
• Able to read, listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System (ESS) Literacy Level 6;
• Able to count with a proficiency equivalent to Employability Skills System (ESS) Numeracy Level 6
• Able to have an understanding and working knowledge of Sales and Marketing principles and practices
• Have basic computer literacy Level 2

Course Title: Artisan Cosmetic Materials Design
About This Course:
Learning Objective 1: Analyse user needs for materials to be used in artisan product design based on current trends.

Learning Objective 2: Maintain a taxonomy of materials according to their functions and uses in artisan product design.

Learning Objective 3: Propose materials for artisan product design based on material characteristics to meet user needs.

Learning Objective 4: Inspect the final product design to ensure they have functionality, usability and form.
What You'll Learn: This course will guide learners on building a competitive advantage upon a strong foundation of emphasizing quality in their products by using materials that allow the learner to customize/personalize to meet customer requirements versus standard products from mass productions. At the end of the course, learners will then be able to equip the necessary knowledge to select and safely handle a wide variety of different materials (ingredients) to meet design needs, as well as the skills in performing different small-scale processing methods.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Age: 21 years old and above
Minimum Secondary or equivalent 
Minimum PSLE English Language Score of C (pre-2021 system) or AL6 (post-2021 system)
Work experience: Not required
Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Emplovability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WL) Level 4

Institution: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Standard First Aid Course (NROC Trainees)
About This Course:
The Standard First Aid Course comprises of an in-depth approach to performing critical emergency
interventions while equipping participants with the practical and theoretical skills to perform effective CPR and AED on adult victims.
What You'll Learn:
- Essentials of First Aid – Definition and Aims of First Aid, Roles / Limitations of a First Aider, Universal
Precautions, First Aid Kit Contents and maintenance, Primary and Secondary Survey, SCDF My Responder App.
- Unconscious Casualty (Non – Cardiac Arrest) – Head injuries, Heat Disorder Heat cramps, Heat exhaustion, Heat
stroke, Fits, Fainting, Low blood sugar, stroke, The recovery position.
- Respiratory Problems – Adult Foreign body Airway Obstruction (Conscious & Unconscious), Asthma,
Hyperventilation, Fumes inhalation, Allergic Reaction.
- Shock, Bleeding and Wounds – Shock, Bleeding, Wounds, Bandaging.
- Musculoskeletal injuries - Fracture and Dislocation, Soft tissue injuries, Immobilization & Bandaging.
- Burn injuries – Burns Depth and Severity of Burns, Classification and treatment of burns, scalding,
Radiation / Sunburn, Chemical, Electrical, Thermal.
- Eye injuries – Chemical, Foreign Bodies, Blunt – force Trauma.
- Transportation of Casualty – 1 & 2 Rescuer carry, Improvised methods.
- CPR (Hands – Only) + AED, includes theory and practical.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Primary PSLE

Course Title: ITIL®4 Foundation (SF)
About This Course:
• Understand the ITIL Service Value System
• Understand and describe the key concepts for creating value for services
• Describe the Four Dimensions of Service Management
• Understand the Service Value Chain and its activities
• Explain the use ITIL guiding principles
• Explain some of the key ITIL practices like Incident management, Problem management , Change control and etc.
What You'll Learn: This is a three-day course which offers the participant with comprehensive understanding of the ITIL 4 concepts, terminology and principles being applied for IT Service Management. It embraces key concepts from Lean, Agile and DevOps to provide an integrated, collaborative and holistic approach to deliver business value for an organization. After completing the course, the participant will be equipped with adequate knowledge to prepare themselves for the ITIL 4 Foundation exam.
Minimum Entry Requirement: It is recommended the participant to have at least 1 years of working experience in IT industry.

Course Title: Basic Cardiac Life Support + AED
About This Course:
This course aims to provide  relevant knowledge and skills on CPR and relief of relief of foreign body airway obstruction in a conscious and unconscious infant and adult casualties. This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) on an adult casualty.

- Recognizing and managing heart attack
- Understanding the chain of survival
- Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an adult victim
- Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an infant victim
- Use of automated external defibrillator on an adult victim
- Recognizing and managing an adult choking victim
- Recognizing and managing an infant victim
What You'll Learn: This course is accredited by SRFAC and aims to provide participants with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate cardiac arrest and choking in adults and infants. This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) on an adult casualty.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Physically fit to do chest compressions

Course Title: Essentials of Leadership (ESLP) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course: This course introduces learners to self-leadership as a teacher and extends that to leading colleagues and aligning to Centre’s mission, vision, and core values. Learners will examine common practices of leaders in the local settings and how they are categorised into the leadership theories in Early Childhood settings.  Practical and essential skills such as communication, building trust and relationships, teaming strategies, and handling challenging situations will be covered.
What You'll Learn:
Learners will be able to:
1. Examine Centre’s mission, vision, and core values in relation to self.
2. Guide colleagues to understand complementary roles of all staff members in the Centre’s operations;
3. Explore leadership practices in local context and identify them in relation to ECE leadership theories;
4. Demonstrate strategies for building relationships. 
5. Demonstrate the use of effective communication with others and handling challenging situation
6. Develop team leadership skills to work with a diverse group of staff members.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
1) Be ECDA-certified as EY2/L1/L2 teacher
2) Currently employed in a childcare registered or licensed with ECDA

Course Title: SCA Barista Skills Intermediate (Asynchronous eLearning and Classroom)
About This Course:
Barista Skills Intermediate is ideal for those who have barista experience and want to improve coffee sensory and advanced espresso and milk techniques while preparing for more complex job functions in the barista profession. It builds on from the Barista Skills Foundation Module and is suitable for junior baristas who are planning for professional skill development and aspiring cafe entrepreneurs

What will be taught:
1) Advanced espresso techniques
2) Advanced milk techniques
3) Drink building, workflow and efficiency
4) Cost and waste management

1) Advanced espresso extraction
What You'll Learn:
Learners will gain a deeper understanding of the coffee itself, specifically the impact of a coffee’s variety, origins and processing methods on flavour, the parameters of coffee quantity, grind texture, water quality, extraction time and their interaction when dialling in a brew recipe, drink construction and taste differences, workflow management and efficiency, sensory aspects of the espresso extraction; milk handling and techniques as well as latte art. 

In addition to coffee preparation, this course also covers key concepts regarding health and safety, customer service, and basic business practices.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Basic literacy and numeracy
- Attended SCA Barista Skills Foundation or equivalent

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites (Mandarin)
About This Course:
WSQ Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in construction. Construction workers are required to go through the course before they start work.

The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - clause 2 (6)) stipulates that “Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out construction work in building and engineering construction worksites must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health.”

After the course, the trainees should be able identify their own roles and responsibilities in a construction job, follow safe work procedures, adopt relevant risk control measures when working at height and respond to fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
CE1. Identify own roles and responsibilities as an employee in a Construction job

CE 2. Follow safe work procedures in construction work

CE 3. Follow safe “Work-at-Height” procedures

CE 4. Respond to fire emergencies

This course targets cleaning staff who are working in the Airport Terminals, Offices, Business Buildings and Complexes, Shopping Centres, Residential, Public Transport, Hospitality, Retail, Hawker Centres and Food Courts or anyone who requires the necessary skills and knowledge to perform basic cleaning of hard floor surfaces.

Course Title: Manage Work At Height
About This Course:
1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Legislation/Approved Code of Practice/Singapore Standards applicable to work at height
2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of stakeholders, competent and responsible persons.
3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for WAH activities
4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safe execution of WAH activities
5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
6. Establish and implement a system for effective monitoring and control of WAH risks
7. Don, check and correct Individual Fall Protection Equipment and respond to a fall emergency
What You'll Learn: This course has been designed to meet the minimum standard for Working at Height Training for Supervisors, Assessors or Managers in Singapore, as recommended in the WSH (Work at Heights) Regulations 2013 and the Approved Code of Practice for Working Safely at Height (2011).

Learners are assumed to have:
• Have at least WSQ ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 4 and above or equivalent and the ability to carry out hazard identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

Course Title: The Practicing Coach
About This Course:
At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
• Develop an understanding of the core standards, competencies, and ethical considerations to develop one’s coaching practice
• Exemplify and demonstrate the desirable behaviours that represent a demonstration of the core standards, competencies, and ethical considerations in a coaching conversation
• Experiment and practice with different coaching models for effective coaching conversations
• Evaluate one’s coaching practice through reflection
• Gain insights of the requirements to be credentialed as a certified professional coach
What You'll Learn:
This course is Module 3 of the Khysalis Coaching Series, an International Coaching Federation (ICF) accredited programme. Participants who complete the full Khrysalis Coaching Series comprising 3 modules, will be eligible to apply for Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialling from ICF.
The Practicing Coach is targeted at individuals who aspire to deepen their coaching capabilities. As you embark on this module, you will build desirable coaching traits encouraging others to grow. Leaders will be able to enhance their coaching ability, self-awareness and mindfulness.
You will gain self-awareness and mindfulness as you implement the self-reflection techniques required in this coaching journey to hone and accelerate your coaching ability. Ample opportunity to practice active listening and asking questions to help others move forward with coaching conversation guidelines to help you start and close the session.
This course is highly experiential where learners will focus on honing their craft through peer practice and assessment in small-group settings or be in the “hot-seat”. In the “hot-seat”, to-be Coach will demonstrate their coaching techniques and be assessed by their peers and Coach-Mentors.

This course meets the International Coaching Federation (ICF) standards requirements.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 8

• Have no less than 3 years’ experience in a supervisory or managerial role

Course Title: WSQ PEOPLE MANAGEMENT WITH ENNEAGRAM
About This Course: Understanding the different personality types and leadership styles helps leaders understand their natural talent in leadership. This can further help them to hone their communication and leadership skills. By understanding how to manage different personality types, leaders are able to work on their strengths and avoid management pitfalls.
What You'll Learn: After this course, learners will be able to understand what motivates people learn how to avoid the common pitfalls in team building. They can appreciate diversity in different personality types and learn how to leverage on each other’s strength as a team. They are also able to appreciate their own personality profiling as a leader and discover how to be at their best to communicate effectively with different personality types.

Course Title: Generative AI: Applications, Prompt Engineering and the power of ChatGPT
About This Course:
At the end of the 1-day course, participants will be able to:
• Define ChatGPT and learn the fundamentals of ChatGPT
• Explore the applications of ChatGPT in businesses and examine how to train and fine-tune a ChatGPT model
• Learn the Advanced ChatGPT technique s (conversational Artificial Intelligence, chatbots, customisation for specific tasks) and analyze the best practices of using ChatGPT
• Understand the ethical considerations of using ChatGPT
• Discover the strategies for maintaining and updating your ChatGPS model
• Acquire the lessons learnt from the challenges of using a ChatGPT with real-world case studies and examples
What You'll Learn: With Microsoft weighing a $10 billion investment in OpenAI, ChatGPT, as its acronym indicates, is a generative language model based on the ‘transformer’ architecture. Founded by OpenAI in 2015, this language model is capable of processing large amounts of text and learning to perform natural language processing tasks effectively. This chat research tool crossed 1 million users in just 5 days after its launch. Many tech executives and venture capitalists have even compared it to Apple’s debut of the iPhone in 2007. ChatGPT surpasses language barriers and can be utilised in various industries, such as improving customer service, generating attractive posts on social media, solving errors in code and many more. In this course, participants will learn the fundamentals of ChatGPT, examine its benefits and learn to employ its technology in businesses.

Course Title: Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan (Synchronous e-learning)

It involves developing a practical risk management implementation plan for the organisation which identify specific actions to be taken, by whom and time for their completion. It also entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the Risk Management Code of Practice (RMCP)..
What You'll Learn:
- Expectation of RM Champion / RM Team Leader
- Form RM Team
- Establish Hazard identification Methodology
- Establish RA methodology 
- Establish Risk Control Methodology
- Develop a workplace RM plan
- Present the RM plan
- Risk Communication
