Course Title: AI-Driven Digital Marketing: Mastering the Future
About This Course:
AI-Driven Digital Marketing: Mastering the Future" is a comprehensive course structured into three learning units.

LU1: focuses on equipping learners with a fundamental understanding of an organization's marketing mix. By the end of this unit, learners will be proficient in analysing marketing mix elements in the context of an organization's retail formats.

LU2: builds on the foundation established in LU1. It delves deeper into the framework for marketing mix success and explores AI solutions in marketing strategies. Upon completion of this unit, learners will have the skills to create digital marketing campaigns that align with organizational objectives.

LU3: Emphasizing the importance of monitoring marketing mix performance and engaging stakeholders. Learners will acquire methods to assess marketing mix elements and create evaluation criteria for stakeholder engagement in marketing mix performance evaluation.
What You'll Learn:
LO1:
Analyse elements of an Organisation's marketing mix
(K1,K4)

LO2:
Interpret the importance of emerging trends that creates marketing opportunities
(K2,K6)

LO3:
Evaluate the elements of a well-balanced marketing mix in relation to organisation’s retail formats
(K3,A4)

LO4:
Examine the importance of re-alignment of marketing mix 
(K7)

LO5:
Create a digital marketing campaign that meets targeted customers and organizational, strategic and operational marketing objectives and desired
positioning
(K5, A2, A3, A5)

LO6:
Apply 2 methods to monitor performance of marketing elements against the digital marketing mix objectives
(A1,A6)

LO7:
Evaluate the performance of marketing mix through performance measurements and stakeholders engagement 
(K8,A7)
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Min secondary school education
• Learners who are not able to fulfill basic literacy requirements for the program will be advised to register for the WSQ Workplace Literacy (WPL) Program. Contact information of the providers for the WPL will be provided if necessary.
• Learners without any formal qualifications (e.g., Secondary or post-Secondary Level etc.) will be required to provide SOA or supporting documents to prove that they have attended WSQ training programs (equivalent or higher) or prove of relevant working experience to justify abilities and competencies.  They will then know the expectations of the course such as the willingness to participate in class activities which include group discussion, brainstorming, and presentation that requires medium to high sociality and emotion. If the learners do not meet any of the above requirements, they could submit a writing proficiency assessment and interview by a program specialist who will then approve on a case-by-case basis.

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1
About This Course:
On completion of this course, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include:

The course will cover the following lessons and five topics:

Topic 1: Practise good personal hygiene
Topic 2: Use safe ingredients
Topic 3: Handle food safely
Topic 4: Store food safely

What You'll Learn:
The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedures course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under the TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020. This is to harmonise the training curriculum and assessment across retail and non-retail food businesses, in alignment with the refreshed SSG Skills Framework (SFw) for Food Services.

The course consists of 6 hours of training and 1.5 hours of assessment. Upon successful completion of the course and assessment, a Statement of Attainment (SOA) will be awarded to the participants. This will accord the participants to work in food and beverage preparation / pre-requisite to operate a food shop/stall.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Any person who is planning to handle and prepare food and beverage in SFA-licensed food establishment i.e. Kitchen Managers, Supervisors, Chefs, Sous Chefs, Cooks, Kitchen Assistants, Food Stall Assistants and all food and beverage handlers.

Course Title: Perform Work At Height
About This Course:
The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the
professionalism of the manufacturing industry by equipping the workforce with
essential generic and portable skills to adapt and be resilient to challenges in the
dynamic working environment. It allows employers to access a pipeline of skilled
workforce, which provides a competitive advantage and enables organisation
success. It also equips workers with cross-cutting generic manufacturing skills to
effectively contribute and progress within an organisation as well as promote mobility
across construction and other related companies.
What You'll Learn:
“Perform Work At Height” is a Competency Unit under the GMS WSQ Framework.
The Performance Statements covered are:
PS1. Perform checks before and after use of Work at Height (WAH) equipment
PS2. Perform proper use of WAH equipment in accordance to relevant
legislation and guidelines, including evaluating use of fall arrest and fall
prevention systems

situations

Course Title: Workplace Safety and Health for Food & Beverage Operations
About This Course:
This course will impart knowledge to learners on the importance of adhering to Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) policies and procedures and complying with them. This will help reduce the cases of workplace accidents in the food and beverage industry. The learning outcomes are: 
LO1: The learner will be able to explain key components of WSH policies and procedures.
LO2:  The learner will be able to identify the WSH issues in accordance with organisational procedures to promote a safe environment and reduce risk injuries. 
LO3: The learner will be able to define ways to communicate risk control measures to stakeholders.
LO4: The learner will be able to identify the appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), tools, and equipment to use for safety compliance.
LO5: The learner will be able to describe common safety signs, instructions, and hazard symbols.
What You'll Learn: This workshop equips learners with the skills, knowledge, and abilities on Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) for Food and Beverage Operations. Among other things, learners will develop the ability to identify potential hazards, unsafe practices, and non-compliances within a workplace setting. By the end of this course, the learners will be adept at adhering to WSH policies, assisting in compliance inspections, and actively promoting a secure working atmosphere.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
a) Education level is likely to be GCE 'N' Credit (at least C6) in English or 
b) WPLN score of Level 3 for Reading, Speaking, Listening, Writing and Numeracy, or
c) With at least a lower secondary education or its equivalent.

Institution: ACADEMY OF DESIGN ARTS AND MEDIA PTE. LTD.
Course Title: WSQ Operate Drones up to 25kg
About This Course:
Drones also known as Unmanned Aircrafts are getting widely adopted to enhance business performance. To fly a drone commercially, you must obtain an Unmanned Aircraft Pilot License (UAPL) issued by Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore. 

This course prepares you for Class A (Rotorcraft) UAPL assessment with restriction <25kg. This course does not include UAPL assessment. After this course, you can choose to sit for the theory test administered by CAAS and/or take the practical assessment with us at a separate cost.
What You'll Learn:
Learning Unit 1: Theory
This course comprises of 1 day theory course to get you familiarized with the basic mechanics of an Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) which covers the syllabus of UAPL Theory Test administered by CAAS. 

Learning Unit 2: Practical – Basic 
Up to 6 sessions of outdoor drone piloting executing various drone manoeuvres and control using a mini-drone (<7kg). 

Learning Unit 3: Practical – Advanced
Up to 2 sessions of outdoor drone piloting executing various drone manoeuvres and control using a larger drone (<25kg).
Minimum Entry Requirement:
This course is applicable to anyone who is keen to learn how to pilot a drone for business operations. There is no pre-requisite in terms of working experience or drone handling. However you should be comfortable operating a remote controller system that will manoeuvre a drone. 
There is much outdoor drone piloting practices so you must be prepared to be outdoor under the sun.

In addition you should be at least 21years old and either completed at least secondary education or demonstrate ability to speak, listen, write, and read English with Numeracy skills at a minimum proficiency level equivalent to Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level (WPLN) level 4.

About This Course:
At the end of the course, participant should be able to
• Trace the history of Changi Airport
• Identify the main thrust of Changi Airport Development
• Understand the challenges faced by Changi against Competitions
• Gain insights into the key features of Jewel Changi Airport
• To understand the integral role of Jewel Changi Airport in Sustainable Town Planning of Singapore
• To identify the contribution of  Stakeholders towards whose Passion Made Possible Singapore
• To empower the learners with passion stories of business owners in Jewel Changi Airport.
• To equip the learners with skills to manage an effective walking trail ifor the various passion tribes within the Jewel Changi Airport
What You'll Learn: This course traces the transformation  of Changi International Airport as a air hub into a destination attraction, a first class showcase  of sustainable development that integrates and enrich community, balances the ecosystem, invigorates travellers and lift the economy . The course aims to  provide insights into the challenges faced by Changi, its main contributing role in Sustainable Planning and Development and the positive contribution of The Jewel Changi Airport in our economy. In addition to learning to manage a walking trail for different passion tribes of The Jewel, Tourist guides could also effectively identify and deliver the PMP stories of our  various stakeholders within the complex to their guests. This course is suitable for all tourist guides who conducts cultural and heritage tours, educational programs for school students and food trails.

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Metal Work (Mandarin)
About This Course:
WSQ “Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Metal Work” is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in metal working. Metal working workers are required to go through the course before they start work.

The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - clause 2 (9)) stipulates that “Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out work in a factory engaged in the manufacture of basic metals, fabricated metal products, machinery or equipment and electrical machinery and equipment must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health.”

After the course, the trainees should be able identify their own roles and responsibilities in metal working, follow safe work procedures, and respond to fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
CE1. Identify own roles and responsibilities in metal working

CE 2. Follow safe work procedures in metal working

CE 3. Respond to fire emergencies

Course Title: PWM-Food Services: WSH for Food and Beverage Operations – Level 2 (Chinese)
About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the Food Services Sector.
LO1 -Learner is able to identify the specific legalities that are applied under WSH and eventually define the systematic system of workplace safety and health and illustrate its procedures in the workplace.

LO2 -Learner is able to infer and relate the criticality of maintaining a safe working environment and decreasing the risk of injury.

LO3 -Learner is able to assess the applicability of using different safety devices and personal protective equipment being utilized in the workplace of an organisation.

LO4 -Learner is able to identify the various non-compliances, hazardous working conditions, and practices that are found in the workplace.

LO5 -Learner is able to identify and illustrate common safety signs and hazard symbols.

LO6 -Learner is able to employ strategies in identifying different types of hazards and demonstrate practices to control the risks.
What You'll Learn:
This course is targeted largely for, but not limited to, employees from the Food and Beverage industry. With the increasing trend of workplace injures caused by slips, trips and falls in the F&B sector, Slips, Trips and Falls Campaign 2021 was launched by the WSH Council to raise awareness of slip, trips and falls risks in the F&B industry.

This course will help employers in the F&B industry prepare their employees on raising awareness and importance of workplace safety and health in the F&B sector.

Course Title: Demonstrate the Service Vision (Service Leadership) (Chinese)

Course Title: Family & Adult Support Tool (FAST) - User (Synchronous & Asynchronous)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to :
1. Illustrate how the TCOM framework is applied in helping families in the local context
2. Rationalise the use of FAST as an assessment tool for communication
3. Analyse the principles of the FAST assessment tool
4. Quantify the family’s needs and strengths using the FAST
5. Analyse the needs and strengths to be prioritised in a case plan
6. Formulate a case plan to address prioritised needs and strengths
What You'll Learn: The Family and Adult Support Tool (FAST) is a multiple purpose information integration tool that is designed to be the output of an assessment process. The FAST Singapore version, adapted from Child and Adolescents Needs and Strengths (CANS), the original Family Advocacy Support Tool (FAST), and Adults Needs and Strengths Assessment (ANSA) which are developed by the John Praed Foundation. The overall purpose is to facilitate an understanding of the needs and strengths of the families served and to bring to bear effective interventions that will help change lives. The FAST accurately represents the shared vision of the needs of the individual and the family in the community. The output is then used to inform a variety of activities at different levels of the system, from service planning at the individual level to resource management at the system level and the monitoring of service outcomes (i.e. Transformational Collaborative Outcomes Management (TCOM) approach).
Minimum Entry Requirement:
The target audience includes all social service professionals who work with families such as social workers, heads of family service centres and school counsellors.

The skills and knowledge for this course, which the learner is assumed to possess, are as follows:
• Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6
• Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6
• Be able to use numeracy skills equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 6

Course Title: The Hidden Face of Joo Chiat (for Licensed Tourist Guide Only)
About This Course:
Participants will learn about the origin and development of Joo Chiat, such as how it is a mini-Singapore and why it became the First Heritage Town in 2011. 

At the end of the course, participants should be equipped with the knowledge to curate and conduct a specialised tour on Joo Chiat.
What You'll Learn:
Through site visits and classroom training, the course will enhance guides’ knowledge on the heritage of Joo Chiat.

Participants will visit businesses that contributed to Joo Chiat’s food culture.. We will explore the architecture of Joo Chiat’s shophouses and study how the various murals are linked to Joo Chiat’s history.

During the classroom training, participants will gain insights on Chew Joo Chiat and his legacy. By learning about the numerous communities in the area, we will also appreciate how Joo Chiat is like a mini-Singapore.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Licensed Tourist Guide

Course Title: Threat Observation (Recognise Terrorist Threats)

Minimum Entry Requirement: As WSQ's principle is open access to anyone, there is no predetermined entry requirement. Nevertheless, it is recommended that learners should possess the Security WSQ basic licensing before embarking on this module.  In lieu of the basic licensing, candidate should possess at least 3 years of working experience, and can comprehend, speak and communicate in English.

Course Title: Basic Cardiac Life Support + AED (Practical and Asynchronous)
About This Course:
This course aims to provide  relevant knowledge and skills on CPR and relief of relief of foreign body airway obstruction in a conscious and unconscious infant and adult casualties. This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) on an adult casualty.

- Recognizing and managing heart attack
- Understanding the chain of survival
- Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an adult victim
- Performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an infant victim
- Use of automated external defibrillator on an adult victim
- Recognizing and managing an adult choking victim
- Recognizing and managing an infant victim
What You'll Learn:
This course is accredited by SRFAC and aims to provide participants with knowledge & techniques to recognise and mitigate cardiac arrest and choking in adults and infants.

This course will also provide you with the knowledge and skills on how to use an Automated External Defi brillator (AED) on an adult casualty.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Able to speak, read and understand English effectively as our courses are conducted in English.
- No history of underlying medical heart and lung conditions
- Physically fit with no pre existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury.
- Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons.

Course Title: Apply Workplace Safety and Health in Construction Sites (Mandarin)
About This Course:
Course Objectives
WSQ " Apply Workplace Safety and health in Construction Sites" is a mandatory WSH training course for all workers working in construction. Construction workers are required to go through the course before they start work.
The Workplace Safety and Health (Factories, Safety Training Courses order - Clause 2 (6)) stipulates that "Any worker employed in manual labour to carry out construction work in building and engineering construction worksites must undergo a safety and health training course approved by the Commissioner for Workplace Safety and Health."
After the course, the trainee should be able to identify their own roles and responsibilities in a construction job, follow safe work procedures, adopt relevant risk control measures when working at height and respond to fire emergencies.
What You'll Learn:
Course Description
CE 1: Identify own roles and responsibilities in construction job
CE 2: Follow safe work procedures in construction site
CE 3: Follow safe “Work-at-Height” procedures
CE 4: Respond to fire emergencies
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to:
- Must be above 18 years of age and are assumed to:
- Have employment status as manual labour to carry out construction work in building and engineering construction worksites.
- Be medically fit.
- Be able to listen, read, speak and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
- Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills (ES) level 2
- Have good organisational skills
- Be able to follow written and oral work instructions.

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Chinese)
About This Course:
On completion of this course, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include:

The course will cover the following lessons and five topics:

Topic 1: Practise good personal hygiene
Topic 2: Use safe ingredients
Topic 3: Handle food safely
Topic 4: Store food safely
Topic 5: Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
What You'll Learn:
The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedure Course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020. This is to harmonise the training curriculum and assessment across retail and non--retail food businesses, in alignment with the refreshed SSG Skills Framework (SFw) for Food Services.

The course consists of 6 hours of training and 1.5 hours of asessment. Upon successful completion of the course and assessment, a Statement of Attainment (SOA) will be awarded to the participants. This will accord the participants to work in food and beverage preparation / pre-requisite to operate a food shop/stall.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Any person who is planning to handle and prepare food and beverage in SFA-licensed food establishment i.e. Kitchen Managers, Supervisors, Chefs, Sous Chefs, Cooks, Kitchen Assistants, Food Stall Assistants and all food and beverage handlers

Course Title: People Leadership Program (SFw)
About This Course:
• Facilitate implementation of organization strategies
• Promote compliance with corporate governance requirements
• Understand and enhance their personal role and style effectiveness
• Adopt a systematic approach to leading people
• Enhance their skills in giving instructions, coaching, delegating, managing poor commitment and counseling difficult cases
• Effectively manage or supervise the people with whom they have to work with in diverse situations
• Influence decision making
• Demonstrate commitment to self development
What You'll Learn:
People are an important resource to any organization – in many ways, the most important resource. In today’s economy, not only are people expensive assets, human capital has become as important, if not more so, than financial assets and physical capital. Hence, just as financial assets and physical capital have to be effectively managed, attention needs to be paid to the management and development of human capital. In particular, high potential employees and key personnel should be developed systematically and professionally, and not in a haphazard manner, in order to enhance an organization’s capability.

This program is based on an original conceptual framework developed by Capelle to equip managers with the skills necessary to interact with and manage people, and improve participants’ interpersonal effectiveness.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Lower sec education (completed secondary sch w/o N or O level pass)

Course Title: SECURITY SURVEILLANCE MANAGEMENT (PERFORM REMOTE SURVEILLANCE FUNCTION)
About This Course: This course is curated to enhance the knowledge and abilities of Senior Security Officers (SSO) in Security Surveillance Management (Perform Remote Surveillance Function). The new knowledge and abilities aim to help equip them with the necessary skills required to meet the rigour of operating advanced security technology as more Security Agencies and Service Buyers adopt Outcome-Based Contracts.
What You'll Learn: AETOS Training Academy (ATA) will be adopting and acceding to the MHA requirements in enhancement to the mandatory training for Senior Security Officers (SSO).
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Nationality
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent, holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Age
The minimum entry age for learners shall be 18 years old at the time of application and the maximum age shall be 70 years old.

Physical and Medical Requirement
Learners must have certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work

Education Qualifications

The minimum entry educational qualification for learners shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent.

Process of Application
The Training Organization shall be responsible for verifying the authenticity of all the documents supporting the application.

Course Title: Security Surveillance Management (Perform Remote Surveillance Function)
About This Course: WSQ Security Surveillance Management is designed to equip security officers with the essential knowledge and skills to perform remote access surveillance functions using security software programmed and equipment.
What You'll Learn:
The learning units are sequenced to mirror the authentic application of the daily routine of a Senior Security Officer. The aim of this course is to introduce the learners to private security industry at Senior Security level, with enhancements made to the technological skillset of a Senior Security Officer. 
Thus, the sequencing of the learning units will follow the daily routine of a Senior Security Officer, which includes starting from
1) LU1: Operate Remote Surveillance, which is key task of a senior security officer, followed by 
2) LU2: Identify abnormal and suspicious behaviour via the operating of security surveillance software, followed by  
3) LU3: Report abnormal behaviours and escalate situations to enforcements. This reflects the routine work of a Senior Security officer where he/ she will be required to reports and escalate situations.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
1. Ability to read, write, speak, and listen to English at WPL Level 3. 
2. Ability to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 3. 
3. Education: Minimum Secondary 2 education. 
4. Age: 21 and above 
5. Experience in Security Industry: 6 months security industry experience as a Security Officer. 
6. Learners should be able to read a computer monitor and see at a distance and possess basic skills 
in operating a computer 
6. At the ATO Admin/Registration Counter: 
• A checklist to be provided to Admin to ensure the learner requirements (above) are met 
• To make recommendations on suitable courses if the individual does not meet the entry criteria 
• Verification of authenticity can be done via checking on certificates 
• Those that do not meet the entry requirement will be subjected to interview before acceptance

Course Title: DevSecOps Engineering and Automation
About This Course:
"At the end of the course, the participants will be able to:
- Apply Agile practices for software delivery.
- Implement DevSecOps practices within the agile method of software delivery.
- Implement Software Configuration Management activities using tools.
- Implement DevSecOps Methodology, Workflow and Tools
- Implement Software Build Management using leading tools.
- Evaluate Threat model and secure build and deployment environment
- Implement effective risk assessments and threat modeling in a rapidly changing environment
- Implement Agile Automated Testing using leading tools.
- Perform Automated Testing using the tools in the agile development environment.
- Evaluate the need for continuous integration (CI) and build a CI system
- Perform Continuous Integration methods
- Apply and Implement Continuous Delivery techniques in an Agile environment
- Perform Continuous Delivery using an automated continuous integration approach.
- Implement Security into Continuous Deployment (CD) pipeline
- Implement cloud DevSecOps automation pipeline tools on a leading Cloud platform.
- Implement Design and write automated security tests and checks in CI/CD
What You'll Learn:
The process to release software to users is often painful, risky and time consuming. Continuous Delivery can help large organisations to become lean, agile and innovative by having reliable and low risks releases, making it possible to adapt continuous updates in line with user feedback, market shifts and changes to business strategies.

As a result, the entire delivery process is accelerated while improving the quality. Teams from test, support, development and operations function and work together as one delivery team.

Over the past several years, information security has struggled to keep up with the fast-paced DevOps movement. DevSecOps — an extension of DevOps — aims to remedy this by embracing security as an essential part of DevOps culture. 

This DevSecOps Engineering and Automation short course aims to provide a 5 Days in-depth understanding of DevSecOps Engineering and Automation concepts, practices and tools.

Participants will learn both the theoretical concepts and practical modules in lectures and hands-on workshops.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Have experience in software development
Be Familiar with Software Configuration Management
Be experienced in installing and configuring software
Know Shell scripting
Have experience deploying code to production
Pre-reading of the materials such as: Puppet, Dockers, Containers, GitHub and Jenkins

Course Title: Service Challenges (Level 1)
About This Course:
AA1 - Use service recovery procedures to respond to service challenges in accordance with organisation guidelines
AA2 - Escalate unresolved service challenges using appropriate channels in accordance with the organisation’s guidelines
AA3 - Demonstrate resilience in the handling of service challenges
KA1 - Types of triggers in the service environment
KA2 - Types of service challenges
KA3 - Importance of responding to service challenges
KA4 - Principles of effective communication
KA5 - Method to escalate service challenges
KA6 - Service escalation channels
KA7 - Resilience and methods to demonstrate resilience
IVC1 - Strive for win-win outcomes when handling service challenges
IVC2 - Identify and suggest areas of improvement that may arise out of service challenges
SIE1 - Empathise with customers while facing service challenges to prevent situation from escalating
LL1 - Keep abreast of latest products and services and service delivery procedures to avoid creating service challenges
LL2
What You'll Learn: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required for service staff to respond to challenging service situations with the use of appropriate verbal and non-verbal communication techniques. It involves recognising triggers which may lead to service challenges, use of service recovery procedures to respond to the challenges and escalating unresolved service challenges..

Course Title: Workplace Productivity using Excel
About This Course: Perform understanding on essentials of data analytics and manage entries in a spreadsheet. Perform calculations in worksheets while using their integrated functions tools and to create charts using the chart tool and perform setup of worksheet for print and presentation outputs.
What You'll Learn: To provide a light introduction to using a spreadsheet programme such as Excel to store, manipulate and manage data. Currently, many of these companies are trying to convert manual, paper-based processes to digital, computer-based processes.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are encouraged to:
• Have basic knowledge on own work role and the corresponding responsibilities and limitations
• Have minimum primary school education  
• Develop Writing, Reading, Listening and Speaking of English to a proficiency level equivalent to Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 2
• Develop Numeracy skills to a proficiency level equivalent to Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 2 
• Have some work experience preferred. 
Our staff and course consultants attending course enquirers would screen interested trainees whether they fulfill the course pre-requisites which include the above WPLN levels. Learners who do not meet the WPLN Levels would be encouraged to take up the appropriate WPLN courses.

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1

At the end of the course, participants will be proficient in selection of appropriate scissor lift, understanding legal obligation, performing continuous risk management, performing pre-start inspection of scissor lift, understand scissor lift operational requirements, perform proper shutdown procedures, understand common operational problems and be able to operate a scissor lift safely.

Course Title: The Business of Fishkeeping and Aquascaping
About This Course:
•Explore business fundamentals of aquascaping 
- Aquascaping as a form of therapy that can be used on patients by healthcare professionals and program coordinators, therapists and social workers.  
• Establish the business model for business set-up in the area of aquascaping 
- Doing market research for contractors in aquascaping including in healthcare institutions.
• Provide insights on prototyping and instructional design to aquascaping
• Provide the ideas on product and market development based on the different types of business model 
• Understand the insights on fish care and feeding
• Select suitable aquatic plants for aquascaping
• Perform maintenance of water quality system
• Possess fundamentals of aquascaping techniques
What You'll Learn:
Fishkeeping and aquascaping can be a hobby, a business, or a form of therapy. In this course, participants will learn the basic knowledge and skills to set up an aquarium with aesthetically pleasing aquascape. Hobbyists who wish to invest or set up a business in this area will gain  insights into the business practices of this area.  Therapists or contractors can also learn how to set up and maintain an aquarium with the proper aquascaping techniques and science in fish nutrition and water quality management.

This course is suitable for:
Pet retail shop owners or employees who are handling/dealing with aquarium retail ornamental fishHobbyists who aims to set up their fishkeeping and aquascaping businessOccupational/rehabilitation therapists, social workers, child/elderly care providers or contractors who want to set up and maintain aquariums with beautiful aquascapes as a form of therapeutic interventions
Minimum Entry Requirement: Nil

Course Title: Management of Family Violence: Introduction (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:
- Relate the impact of different types and forms of family violence on family members
- Apply theoretical framework to explain the prevalence of violence in families
- Propose ways to address factors that may hinder professionals ability to manage family violence cases
- Apply legal and systemic provision to protect victims of family violence
- Respond appropriately to suspected cases of family violence
What You'll Learn:
The 3-day workshop will equip learners with the dynamics of family violence, an overview of integrated system of managing family violence in Singapore as well as the knowledge and skills in identifying and handling intake sessions with persons facing family violence and the persons who abuse. 

Guest speakers from key organisations in the integrated management of family violence network such as Family Justice Court, SPF, Child Protection Services and medical setting, will also be invited to ensure comprehensive coverage of the topic.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• A fundamental understanding of family violence, child abuse, child sex offenders, child development and needs, and legislations on family violence in relation to duty of care.
• An awareness of own organisational policies and procedures to child safe practices.
• Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6.
• Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 6.
• Be able to use numeracy skills equivalent to the Employability Skills System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 6.

Course Title: Introductory Programming using Python
About This Course:
Learn the basics of computer programming and write your first programme in Python! As one of the easiest programming languages to pick up, Python makes a great entry point for beginners. With this course, master the basics of computer programming in a language widely embraced by top companies like Google and Netflix. 

In this foundational course, you will learn the essentials of Python and key programming concepts such as data types and variables, file handling, functions and many more. Then, apply these skills to help you write your very own computer program in Python.
What You'll Learn:
By the end of this course, participants will have learnt about:

    data types and variables

    expressions and statements

    ·operators

    input / output

    decision making and repetition

    strings, lists, tuples, dictionaries

    handling of files (text files, spreadsheets)

    functions, modules and packages
Minimum Entry Requirement: Proficiency in English

Course Title: Hazardous Substances Management (Manage Hazardous Substances)
About This Course: Covers the competencies in identifying the sources of hazardous substances and implementing control measures to manage the associated risks.
What You'll Learn:
This unit covers the knowledge, and skills and knowledge for management of hazardous substances at the workplace.
This includes identifying the sources of hazardous substances, implementing control measures to manage the associated
risks. Persons who successfully completed this unit of competency will be recognised as the ‘competent persons’ for the
control of hazardous substances at the workplace by the Ministry of Manpower. This competency unit also provide the
learners with the knowledge needed to manage hazardous substances, as required by the National Environmental
Agency, for the fulfillment of their duties as hazardous substances license and permit holders.
Minimum Entry Requirement: WSQ Employability Skills Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 6 or Grade C6 in GCE 'O' level English and Mathematics and Grade C6 in GCE 'O' level Science (Chemistry) Recommended to have 2 years working experience in any industry

Course Title: Workplace Communication (synchronous E-learning)

●  Coach staff for effective communication

Course Title: Operate hook-lift mounted trucks and equipment to collect and transport waste during waste collection
About This Course:
The objectives of this course are as follows:
1. Align to SSG’s and NEA’s new TSC code for this course’s required competencies
2. Align to Skills Ladder of the Progressive Wage Model (PWM) for Waste Management
3. Conduct competency-based training and assessment (CBTA) to workers with similar PWM job roles of Driver, Senior Driver, Captain
What learners are able to do after attending and passing this course:
(1) Informed of and are able to identify current waste types, waste containers, waste bins, waste collection points in Singapore’s waste management context.
(2) Avoid/prevent abnormal work issues, abnormal equipment and tools issues, incidents, and communicate more effectively to appropriate persons on the abnormalities/incidents. Aware of the Do’s and Don’ts of Environmental Public Health Act (EPHA) and adhere to Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) guidelines.
(3) Identify, check, safely use and reinstate/maintain current waste collection tools and equipment in their work.
What You'll Learn:
1. The National Environment Agency (NEA) plans, develops and administers Singapore’s solid (or general) and hazardous waste management systems. This includes licensing and regulatory functions to ensure that waste is properly collected, treated and disposed of.
2. NEA licenses general waste collectors (GWCs) in Singapore with licence classes according to the respective types of waste, namely Class A, Class B, Class B.1 and Class C. GWCs primarily serve commercial and industrial premises.
3. As stipulated by NEA in the “Application for General Waste Collector Licence Prerequisites and Information / Documents to be Submitted”, applicants for Class A and Class B licence are required to submit documentary proof of competency issued by SkillsFuture Singapore
(SSG) of their driver as follows:
Driver – Use Appropriate Mechanical Devices to Compress & Transport Waste During Waste Collection (Hooklift) (TSC code: EVS-WMO-2002-1.1, to be obsoleted)
Driver – Operate hook-lift mounted trucks and equipment to collect and transport waste during waste collection (TSC code: EVS-WMO- 2002-2.1, this course)
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Pre-requisites:
1. Possess a valid Singapore Class 4 driving licence
2. Able to read, write, listen to English: WPLN level 2 equivalent

Institution: SINGAPORE RESCUE TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) + AED Provider
About This Course: This Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) + AED Provider course is suitable for participants who are keen to understand the importance of a rescuer's role in the chain of survival. Through classroom interactive teaching, practice and assessment, participants will be proficient in essential lifesaving skills such as Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), usage of automated external defibrillator (AED) and also to relief foreign body airway obstruction in a conscious and unconscious adult and infant.
What You'll Learn: The Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) + AED Provider Course provide participants with the essential lifesaving knowledge and skillsets such as to perform quality Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), usage of automated external defibrillator (AED) and also to relief foreign body airway obstruction. Participants will learn according to the latest guidelines provided by Singapore Resuscitation and First Aid Council (SRFAC) and upon completion of course and assessment, a certificate with 2 years validity will be awarded.

Course Title: BCLS and AED
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will have the relevant knowledge and
application skills in BCLS+AED to apply during an emergency or accident for adult and infant casualties.
1. Explain the duties and responsibilities of BCLS+AED Provider
2. Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) effectively on adult unconscious casualties
3. Perform the use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
effectively on adult unconscious casualties
4. Perform the relief of Foreign Body Airway Obstruction (FBAO)
effectively on adult conscious and unconscious casualties
5. Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) effectively on infant
unconscious casualties
6. Perform the relief of Foreign Body Airway Obstruction (FBAO)
effectively on infant conscious and unconscious casualties
7. Manage a medical emergency
What You'll Learn:
This classroom-based training course will equip learners with the competencies to provide skills outlined by Singapore Resuscitation and First
Aid Council (SRFAC) in the BCLS+AED Provider Course.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
P1. Prior reading completed of the SRFAC BCLS+AED Provider Manual.
P2. We highly recommend individuals to have attained at least secondary two education or level 5 of ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy.
P3. Must be physically fit and able to render help to another individual during an emergency.
P4. Medically fit with no pre-existing medical conditions such as knee,spinal or joints injury. Learners with medical problems, such as bronchial asthma, any upper respiratory tract infection, orthopaedic problems (e.g.slipped disc), are encouraged to consult their own doctors before attending the course. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training.
P5. Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training. You are advised to defer taking the course to at least 6 weeks after delivery.

Course Title: Tantalising Tarts and Pastries

Course Title: Office Management Skills for Admin Professionals (Classroom & Asynchronous)
About This Course:
Do you constantly feel like the expectations and demands placed upon you seem to be increasing as of late? Your role as an administrative professional has now been put to the challenge of meeting these expectations, which include delivering quality service and results in the course of your work.

Support or administrative roles help to keep the business running in an organisation. In fact, as business progresses in this ever-changing environment, your employer’s expectations for you changes as well, leading to a need for such roles to evolve.

This is your opportunity to take charge of your own professional development and ensure that you remain competent in your job.
What You'll Learn:
Course Objectives
Upon completion of the course, learners will be able to:
1. Understand the demands of and maximise administrative support roles and responsibilities 
2. Effectively relate to and manage different stakeholders
3. Improve their self-confidence and competencies for success
4. Apply effective strategies to communicate and solve problems
5. Apply essentials tools and strategies to increase work productivity

Course Outline
1. Managing Role Expectations
– Difference then and now roles of admin professional
– Why it is important to level-up

2. People Management
– Who are your stakeholders
– Knowing strengths and limitations
– Understanding workplace dynamics

3. Positive EQ for Workplace Effectiveness
– IQ vs EQ
– What it means to have EQ at the workplace

4. Communication Skills
– Impact of effective communication
– How empathetic listening and communication improve workplace effectiveness

5. Managing Time and Priorities
– Identifying the productivity blockers
– Tackling the blockers
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Able to speak, read, and write at a English proficiency level of ES WPLN L3 or equivalent 
- Age group of 21 and above 
- Required years of experience: 6 months of work experience
- Minimum education level: GCE 'O' Level

Course Title: WSQ Digital Content Creation
About This Course:
“Content is King,” a term widely used in digital content creation, popularised by Bill Gates in 1996. Fast forward to today, it still remains the golden rule of the internet because content drives engagement, visibility, brand authority, audience value, social sharing, and conversion.

This 2-Day WSQ Digital Content Creation course is meticulously crafted to equip you with the essential skills needed to transform your creative concepts into standout content and bring your ideas to life.

This content creation training course offers a comprehensive learning experience through a blend of theory and hands-on projects. Learn how to create, strategise and manage digital content that resonates with your target audience, with emphasis on SEO and promotion through social media and email marketing.

You will also explore the latest trends and AI tools for both content and videos, gearing you up for this ever-evolving world of digital content creation.

If you’re ready to make a difference online, this course is exactly what you need.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to:
● transform an overall content management strategy into policies on web content creation and curation, breaking down the strategy into specific guidelines and rules that govern how content is created, curated, and managed on the web.
● develop a web content strategy for an organisation, including defining target audiences, setting clear goals, planning content creation, and evaluating content management system options, considering cost, scalability, user-friendliness, and integration capabilities.
● create and optimise various forms of digital content, including written, multimedia, and interactive content, adhering to best practices for search engine optimisation (SEO), user experience (UX) design, and accessibility to enhance the visibility, engagement, and effectiveness of web content for their target audience.
● assess emerging tools and techniques, including applying them to enhance user engagement and adapt to evolving user behaviours in their content creation and management efforts.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● WPLN Level 5
● WSQ Advanced Certificate in Digital Marketing; OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience in a digital marketing-related field); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Course Title: Digital Transformation in the Era of 5G & AI (Synchronous eLearning)
About This Course: This course is designed to equip participants with a comprehensive understanding of digital transformation from both business and technical viewpoints. It emphasizes the importance of leveraging advanced language generation technologies, like ChatGPT to meet organizational needs and streamline processes. The curriculum delves into four critical technology drivers of digital transformation: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Automation, Cloud Computing, and Big Data Analysis, highlighting AI as the most significant disruptor in today's workplace. Participants will learn how to strategically implement AI within their organizations to drive digital transformation effectively. Moreover, the program covers practical applications of prompt engineering with ChatGPT AI, enhancing participants' skills in utilizing these tools for organizational benefits. Additionally, it involves evaluating the impact of emerging technologies on business processes and operations through cost-benefit analysis, guiding stakeholders in making informed decisions about adopting new and emerging technologies to fulfill organizational objectives.
What You'll Learn:
Learners will be able to:
Create awareness of the main digital disruptors impacting the workplace
Understand GPT-3 and Chat GPT API
perform In-depth prompt engineering with ChatGPT
analyze the Cases studies on exceptional Chat-GPT applications
Explore lesser known capabilities of Chat-GPT like- translation, image captioning, summarization etc.
Create impressive AI-generated images
Generate AI-generated videos from texts and blogs
Add AI voiceover to videos
Work with Open AI API and Open AI Playground
Analyse the scope of AI implementation into businesses
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are expected to:
Have completed GCE “N” Level or in the absence, be able to comprehend , read, write and speak English and with Numeracy at WSQ Workplace Literacy (WPLN) Level 4

No prior technical qualifications or experience is required but learners are expected to have:
Basic computer literacy
Basic Internet Usage skills

Min 1 year experience in the proposed job roles or 1 year relevant working experience in the related industries.

Learners who do not qualify in terms of education, literacy and/or numeracy but have at least 1 year of working experience in any industry will be admitted on a case-by-case basis, subject to approval by Bells Management Representative (MR).

Course Title: 因“材”施教–如何利用有效资源进行华文教育 (How to Use Resources Effectively for Chinese Language Education) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
1. 广泛获取各类与多元文化相关的华语绘本、阅读材料、听力材料
2. 广泛获取和收集各类可回收材料及自然素材
3. 运用以上材料或资源进行多元文化以及环境相关的语言教育
4. 使用以上资源生成具有新加坡本地多元文化及环境特色的华语教学活动

1. Widely explore and search for different sorts of Chinese learning materials such as picture books, literacy aids and listening materials etc. and resources according to local multicultural environment
2. Maximize the collecting and utilizing of all kinds of recycled materials and natural materials for teaching and learning aids development
3. Effective using the above materials and resources for multicultural and environment language education
4. Develop interesting, multicultural & environment oriented and localized Chinese learning activities by taking the advantages of using the above materials and resources
What You'll Learn:
新加坡是多元文化的国家，文化的多元对其教育的影响体现在不同形式，不同内容的教材上（阅读，绘本，听力教材…）；新加坡自然环境适于“生物成长”，树木丰富，自然材料多样。如何利用自然的有效资源，因地制宜，发挥优势，因“材”施教，十分值得探讨。本文试图从：1）环境对幼儿成长的影响。2）如何利用有利材料（案例分析）设计华语教学活动。
3）各类材料的使用及制作方法。三个方面来说明“材料”对 华语教学的影响。

As Singapore is a multicultural country, the impact of cultural diversity on its education should be reflected from utilizing different forms of teaching materials, such as literacy aids, picture books, listening materials and etc. Meanwhile Singapore is also a place rich in wide varieties of natural materials. Thus, as Preschool Language educators, it is important to be able to explore the usage of different natural resources according to the Preschools’ local environment. This course will focus on: 1) the environmental impact on the growth and development of young children. 2) how to utilize localized materials to design Chinese learning activities (by case study). 3) how to use recycled, natural materials to design teaching materials and learning aids. The above three aspects are the main points to illustrate how resources can impact and enhance the Chinese language education in Preschool.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
LON Certification Status: L1, L2, EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Lead Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator

Course Title: PWM-Food Services: Food Safety Course Level 1 - Chinese (Refresher)
About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the PWM-Food Services Sector.

Previously known as the Basic Food Hygiene Refresher Course, this half-day Singapore Food Agency (SFA) accredited course aims to equip food handlers of both retail and non-retail food establishments with the REFRESHER knowledge and application skills to follow food safety and hygiene procedures and policies, as well as maintain the cleanliness and upkeep of premises.
What You'll Learn:
- It is a regulatory requirement to pass this course in order to be a food handler.
- To equip you with the REFRESHER knowledge and skills to prepare safe and hygienic food.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Food handlers will now be required to attend their first refresher training five years after completing their Basic Food Hygiene Course and the subsequent ones at 10-year intervals, instead of the previous cycle of once every three years. If you have completed your Basic Food Hygiene Course before 1 Oct 2014, you are required to attend your first refresher training three years after your course completion date instead of 5 years.

- Learners must be able to listen, speak, read and write Mandarin at a basic level (at least WPLN2).

- Learners must able to provide a copy of their old Basic Food Hygiene Course certificate in order to be eligible for the refresher course.

Course Title: PWM-Food Services: Customer Service Excellence (Chinese)
About This Course:
This course is only for the low wage workers in the Food Services Sector.
This module will address today’s needs of employers who seek to ensure that all employees in the food service sector are aware of the importance of customer service excellence and are able to follow guidelines to provide positive customer service to a diverse range of customers.
What You'll Learn:
This unit aims to equip the learner with the knowledge and application skills in providing positive customer service to a diverse range of customers. With this in mind, the target group for this module, “Customer Service Excellence” will be for:

● Existing food service sector employees including Barista / Bartender / Wine Server / Wine Waiter / Crew Leader / Baker / Cook / Server / Service Crew / Kitchen Assistant, who are required to provide positive customer service to a diverse range of customers
● New hires in the food services sector
● For learners from different industry or mid-career changers who wish to embark on their career in the industry
● Individuals who wish to learn about customer service excellence personally

This module will provide the learners with the knowledge and skills to follow guidelines to provide positive customer service to a diverse range of customers. The learning outcomes are as follows:
LO1. Recognise the Diverse Range of Customers and their Needs and Expectations
LO2. Develop a Positive Customer Experience by Offering Personalised Service
LO3. Exhibit the Qualities and Characteristics of a Service Professional
LO4. Understand the go-the-extra-mile service that will benefit oneself and the organisation
LO5. Identify Triggers in Service Environment
LO6. Articulate Effective Communication Skills when Interacting with Customers and Escalating Unresolved Service Challenges
LO7. Create a Professional Image and Persona
LO8. Develop feedback on areas of improvement and unresolved service challenges through proper escalation channels
Minimum Entry Requirement: • Able to converse. read and write in Chinese.

Course Title: WSQ Copywriting and Content Writing
About This Course:
We’re living in an era where authenticity and personalised content have a huge impact on how brands are perceived and influence consumer decisions. This holds true for consumers in Singapore, who value genuine connections and respond positively to content that resonates with their preferences and interests.

Our 2-Day WSQ Copywriting and Content Writing course is designed for aspiring writers and anyone looking to master the art of copywriting and content writing. You will be guided on how to use digital storytelling to craft customised content that connects with your audience in a way that feels genuine while achieving your brand’s goals.

This copywriting course covers creating digital storyboards, incorporating SEO in your copywriting, using multi-channel content strategies, ethics and more, ensuring that your content and writing will be impactful and inspire action.

By the end of this content writing training course, you will be equipped to conceptualise and create ideas that resonates with your audience while achieving your marketing objectives.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to demonstrate their skills and knowledge to:
● apply the principles of digital storytelling to conceptualise and create content ideas that effectively meet marketing objectives, engaging audiences and driving desired actions in the online landscape.
● create a digital storyboard as an integral component of a content strategy plan, including applying multichannel content strategies that adhere to the parameters of delivering content for marketing purposes, incorporate the essential features of marketing content, and employ various modes of content delivery to achieve marketing objectives.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● WPLN Level 6
● WSQ Advanced Certificate in Digital Marketing; OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience in a digital marketing-related field); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

As for SOs, the new knowledge and abilities aim to help equip them with the necessary skills required to meet the rigour of operating advanced security technology as more Security Agencies and Service Buyers adopt Outcome-Based Contracts. This training will develop skillsets across, technology, process, people & specialised skills and uplift the security workforce.
What You'll Learn: This course has been designed To adhere to the MHA and Security Industry Stakeholders on enhancements to the mandatory training was identified in consultation with the industry and also aligned to the Security ITM – Security 4.0 skillsets. The intent of the enhancements to the mandatory training is to upskill our Security Officers in their knowledge and abilities to bridge the training gap in their current roles. The enhancements do not aim to change the current job functions of SOs,  to enhance their skillsets to grow in their current positions, given the advancement in technology-related competency.

Course Title: WSQ Digital Marketing Analytics (Google Analytics)
About This Course: The Digital Marketing Analytics (Google Analytics) course targets digital marketing personnel to develop crucial knowledge and skills to effectively use Google Analytics to measure and analyse the performance of digital marketing campaigns. It covers different analytics tools and techniques, and trainees will learn how to identify the appropriate tools and techniques to be utilised for different needs, including appraising the business outcomes variables on service and e-commerce websites and forecasting future demand on deployed digital marketing analytic tools.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to:
● interpret the types of data required for digital marketing analytics as well as the value and purpose of different kinds of market and digital data 
● examine sources of market, competitor, customer and product data, consumer trends and sales tracking systems and technologies
● compare demand forecasting and statistical modelling techniques to analyse market trends and industry developments, and their impact on marketing activities
● deploy analytical tools and methodologies and develop questions to gather data from digital marketing analytics tools
● analyse customer and competitor dynamics through deployed analytics tools
● operate digital marketing analytics tools to monitor marketing and advertising performance, and apply the measurement of return on investment (ROI) to evaluate marketing effectiveness
● examine variables that affect product and/or service demand on your website via the deployed digital marketing analytics tool
● appraise business outcomes variables on service and ecommerce websites and forecast future demand on deployed digital marketing analytic tools
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● WPLN Level 5
● 1 GCE ‘O’ level or equivalent (≥ 21 years old); OR
● NITEC/Higher NITEC (≥ 21 years old); OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Course Title: Respond to and support the investigation of incidents in Environmental Services - Waste Management - Materials Recovery (Level 2)
About This Course:
This course, "Respond to and support the investigation of incidents", is a stipulated/mandatory WSQ course inside the "Recommendations of the Tripartite Cluster for Waste Management Industry on Introducing Progressive Wage Model(PWM) for the Waste Management and Materials Recovery Sub-Sectors" for the following Job Roles:
• Senior Crew (Waste Collection)

• Supervisor (Waste Collection)
• Driver (Waste Collection)
• Senior Driver (Waste Collection)

LO4. Apply methods of immediate medical assistance

Course Title: Fashion & Fabrics (Basic Dress with Lining)
About This Course:
Learners will now be able to differentiate between the high end and the fast fashion industries, and therefore discern the differences in quality through the analyses of both the materials used as well as the finishing. They will be able to upskill themselves and execute better finishes and designs that can be implemented and developed later on into evening or bridalwear, such as with the use of the princess line cut and lining.

They will also be able to create well-fitted and customized pieces that are accustomed to the individual body shapes and sizes through the methods of drafting and alterations that will be covered.

Learners who design fashion can independently do up basic dress samples and prototypes from scratch or even train someone else to do it, starting from taking body measurements, producing pattern blocks for dresses, evolving the designs and polishing it up with appropriate garment finishes without outsourcing to overseas facilities. They can make simple modifications to their designs and alterations and will also be able to perform basic quality checks on the garments produced.

Learners who deal with fabrics and merchandise can identify the characteristics of fabrics, thereby being able to determine their quality and suitability for given designs.
What You'll Learn:
This course will allow learners to identify common fabrics and the characteristics that determine their quality and suitability for dresses. They will learn to take measurements of the human body according to the industry standard for making garments or for doing fittings.

They will develop pattern drafts both in quarter-scale and full-scale for a range of designs of womenswear dresses and utilize the sewing and overlock machines to execute the sewing sequence for sleeves and dresses along with different seams, zippers, and types of finishes.

Thereafter learners will execute fittings and bespoke alterations for the garments, suited for high-end fashion.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Literacy & Numeracy:
Learners should possess PSLE Math and English OR;
Possess the Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) proficiency equivalent at level 4

Assumed Attitudes, Skills & Knowledge:
A year’s experience in the textile, fashion, design or retail industry is recommended
Recommended to have constructed at least 2 garments or accessories using a variety of materials
Interested to gain foundational and technical knowledge in materials, drafting and sewing

Course Title: Sustainability 101 for the Green Economy
About This Course:
Completing the course enables you to:
• Understand your company's green transition.
• Share insights and learn about the common concepts vital for the green economy.

Course Title: Perform Work in Confined Space Operation
About This Course:
At the end of the programme you will be able to:
• Know the Legal Requirements on confined spaces as stipulated by the WSH Act. WSH (confined space) Regulations; WSH (Construction) Regulations; WSH (Ship Building & Ship Repairing) Regulations; WSH (General Provision) and Code of Practice for Confined Spaces (SS 568:2011)
• Know the Penalties for non compliances under WSH Act
• Know the Roles, responsibilities and activities of an entrant and attendant
• Know the Roles and responsibilities of supervisor, confined space safety assessor, rescue personnel and authorized manager
• Identify the Types of confined space and work carried out in confined space
• State the Types of personal protection equipment and their functions
• State the Types of respiratory protection equipment and their uses
• Follow and state the Types of safety / warning signs
• Know and state the Types of atmospheric hazards and their consequences
• Know and state the Types of physical and biological hazards and their consequences
• Know the Risks when working in a confined space, severity of consequences and likelihood
• Know the Symptoms of persons exposed to typical atmospheric hazards
• Know and state the Methods to prevent and control confined space hazards
• Know the Types of common gas detection instruments and their uses
• Know the Limitations of gas detection instruments
• Know the Common mistakes when using gas detection instruments
What You'll Learn:
The purpose of this competency unit is to enable learners to Perform Work in Confined Space Operations based on a set of competency elements, which includes:
• Identify duties and responsibilities o all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Codes of Practice
• Identify confined space hazards
• Use Gas detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring
• Comply with Permit-to-work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space
• Participate in an emergency for confined space
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to:
• Have basic knowledge of personal protective equipment (PPE)
• Know how to use basic PPE provided at workplace
• Be able to follow written and oral work instructions
• Be able to listen, read, speak and write English a proficiency level equivalent level to the Employability Skills System (ESS) level 2
• Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to Employability Skills System (ESS) level 2

Course Title: PWM-Food Service: Food Waste Disposal and Reduction
About This Course:
This course is only intended for the low wage workers in the PWM-Food Services Sector.

Performance Gaps the Course will address include:
* Lack of awareness about food waste disposal and reduction amongst individuals in the Food Service industry
* Lack of knowledge and ability to identify food wastage gaps and how that could be improved.
* Lack of understanding of the food waste problem and the practical solutions to address it.
* Lack of understanding of reducing waste at different stages of the operation process.
* Lack of education as to how reducing food waste can benefit businesses, customers, and the environment.

Employment, Job Development or Job Upgrading: 
* This module falls under PWM. In this context, Food Waste Disposal and Reduction training can enable current and future employees of the Food and Beverage Operation sector in Singapore to have knowledge and ability to identify food wastage gaps and how that could be improved.
* It educates them as to how reducing food waste can benefit businesses, customers, and the environment. It can help employees in the F&B sector by uplifting wages and skills for workers in the Food Services Industry, thus providing employment, job development and job upgrading benefits.

Relevance to Industry 
The Food Waste Disposal and Reduction course aligns with PWM by Tripartite Cluster for the Food Services Industry (TCF). This training program is relevant in effectively tackling the problem of food wastage in Singapore. Learners who gain an understanding of the food waste problem and the practical solutions to address it, will then work towards reducing waste at different stages of the operation process in the Food Services Industry. 

Course Objectives: 
1. Identify Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to dispose food waste 
2. Identify operating procedures for equipment that process food waste
3. Determine the possible causes for food spoilage or wastage
4. Explain preventive measures to avoid food wa
What You'll Learn:
With a focus on achieving zero waste in Singapore, reducing food waste has become crucial for sustainable development. Currently, food waste constitutes nearly half of the average 1.5kg of daily household waste in Singapore. 
This 1-day course helps learners understand the food waste issue and practical solutions to tackle it at various operational stages, with the aim of reducing food waste and bringing advantages to businesses, customers, and the environment.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
* Able to read, write and speak in English (WLPN Level 3 and above).
*  Min 21 years old. 
*  Primary school level onwards education.
*  Skills and knowledge of the F & B domain across industries. 
*  No prior experience is required. 
*  Learners who do not meet the MER may be considered through interviews on a case-by-case basis.

Course Title: Security Screening Management (Conduct Security Screening of Person and Bag)

This Competency Unit enables an individual to acquire the attitude, skills and knowledge
required in understanding and complying with legal responsibilities and obligations to

elective units, is tailored to provide the skill outcomes required by a security officer working
in the sub-sector of Security Manpower Services.

Course Title: Fun Elements of Art in Chinese Language (Synchronous e-learning)

2-Day workshop, each day is intended to be 7 hours. The purpose of this programme is to discuss the importance of art in young children's learning and development and to describe elements of an art program within a developmentally appropriate early childhood curriculum.
The programme will help participants understand that Art can help children develop cognitively, socially, emotionally, physically and creatively. Participants will also recognize that art also has value in and of itself. Fostering the development of children's aesthetic sense and engaging children in creative experiences should be also be the objectives of an early childhood art program

attitudes that include:  a sense of responsibility, able to support and add value to business operation, being passionate in performing work activities

This module is a step up initiative aimed at consolidating the strong foundation in the ICDL Digital Citizen Computer Fundamentals Programme that enhances the capability of participants with extensive computer skills and knowledge. It is designed to provide extensive hands-on practices that will not only help participants gain the necessary computer knowledge, more importantly, this will assure them that the skills they have acquired through the course are practical.
