Course Title: Mushroom Cultivation for City Farmers
About This Course:
By the end of this workshop, participants will learn 
• the variety and nutritional/medicinal values of edible mushrooms 
• cultivation & growth requirements and pest manage
• the process of growing mushroom, from spores until harvesting
• the application IoT technologies in monitoring and maintenance of mushroom cultivation
• the insider’s tips on running a mushroom business .                                                                            • the potential for product development, market development and r start up ideas
What You'll Learn:
From shiitakes to truffles, mushrooms can range from everyday food fare to a costly food delicacy. Rich in proteins, micronutrients and antioxidants, many mushrooms have high nutritional and medicinal values. This high-value crop is well suited to be grown in urban setting. They do not require sunlight, can be grown vertically in confined space, and thrive on waste materials such as food composts and coffee grounds which are abundant in a city. By the end of this workshop, participants will learn 
• the variety and nutritional/medicinal values of edible mushrooms 
• cultivation & growth requirements and pest manage
• the process of growing mushroom, from spores until harvesting
• the application IoT technologies in monitoring and maintenance of mushroom cultivation
• the insider’s tips on running a mushroom business .                                                                            • the potential for product development, market development and r start up ideas
Minimum Entry Requirement: Learners should have some basic understanding and/or  interest in mushroom cultivation and business.

Course Title: AOP – Customer Management (Level 1)
About This Course: Those with two months or more work experience in the environmental service industry, particularly as a General Cleaner / Pest Control Worker, or have completed similar module are eligible to enrol in this assessment-only-pathway (AOP) module. This AOP module only consist of assessment. Ineligible participants may enrol in the 8-hour module that consists of training and assessment.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- 21 years and above.
- Speak, listen and read English at Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 3, and manipulate numbers at Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 3.
- Never attended school; pre-primary / kindergarten education; primary education without PSLE / PSPE certification or equivalent.
- Minimum of two months of work experience in the environmental service industry as a General Cleaner or have completed similar module.

Institution: SINGAPORE FIRST AID TRAINING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
Course Title: CERT First Aider - BFA with CPR & AED (Asynchronous e-learning and Practical)
About This Course: CERT members, who comprise of Response Team and Site Incident Controller, are required to undergo the training requirements of Fire Fighting & Rescue Response including first aid. The First Aid and CPR AED course comprises of an in-depth approach to performing critical emergency interventions while equipping participants with practical and theoretical skills to perform effective CPRAED on victims.
What You'll Learn: CERT is a group of appointed in-house first responders identified by a company to be competently trained in preventing any emergency from escalating into a major disaster. This is a requirement by Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF). In this asynchronous learning version, trainees can complete the theory modules of the course online and attend a half day practical training and assessment session in class.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Primary School or WPLN Level 5

Course Title: Perform Work in Confined Space Operation
About This Course: On completion of this unit, learners will be equipped with the necessary knowledge and expertise to perform the duties of an entrant and attendant when working in a confined space, use gas detection instruments and participate in an emergency situation.
What You'll Learn:
This competency unit consists of the following elements:
CE1.     Identify duties and responsibilities of all personnel involved in confined space work under the WSH Legislations and Codes of Practice
CE2.     Identify confined space hazards
CE3.     Use Gas Detection Instruments for atmospheric monitoring
CE4.     Comply with Permit-to-Work system and safe work procedures when working in confined space
CE5.     Participate in an Emergency for confined space

Institution: ACADEMY OF DESIGN ARTS AND MEDIA PTE. LTD.
Course Title: WSQ Operate Drones up to 7kg
About This Course:
Drones also known as Unmanned Aircrafts is getting widely adopted to enhance business performance. To fly a drone commercially, you must obtain an Unmanned Aircraft Pilot License (UAPL) issued by Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore. 

This course prepares you for UAPL assessment but does not include the assessment. After this course, you can choose to sit for the theory test administered by CAAS and/or take the practical assessment with us at a separate cost.
What You'll Learn:
LU1: Theory. Some of the topics include: 
• Introduction to UAS 
• UAS Components and Systems
• Principles of Flight; Aerodynamic and Control of motion
• Flight Plan, Pre-Flight checklist, 
• In-Flight control checks and Post-Flight  checks
• Air Navigation Act 1966 (ANA)
• 101 – Unmanned Aircraft Operations Regulations
• Airspace restrictions
• Permits
• Navigation & Meteorology

LU2: Practical. 
• 5 sessions of outdoor drone piloting executing various drone manoeuvres and control
Minimum Entry Requirement:
This course is applicable to anyone who is keen to learn how to pilot a drone. There is no pre-requisite in terms of working experience or drone handling. However, there is much outdoor drone piloting practical hours so you must be prepared to be outdoor under the sun.

In addition, you should be at least 21 years old and have at least completed secondary education.

Course Title: Beautiful Artisan Breads
About This Course: This course seeks to enable participants to acquire the necessary knowledge, skills and techniques to prepare and make delicious and beautiful artisan breads to a satisfactory standard. Participants will be able to apply what they have learnt at various workplaces such as hotels, bakeries, cafes and other food establishments.
What You'll Learn: This hands-on course will assist learners to attain skills on how to make beautiful artisan breads. The course will also impart knowledge on principles and techniques of preparing and proofing dough for artisan breads.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Age: Minimum 21 years old and above
• Trainees must have at least Primary level with ability to understand and write basic English and/or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) score: Level 4 for Reading, Speaking, Listening, Writing and Numeracy
• Recommended for trainees to have at least 1 year of working experience in the food services industry or 2 years in the non-food services industry.
• Recommended to have attended Basic Breads or Café Style Bread module prior to registering for the Beautiful Artisan Breads course

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher)

On completion of this unit, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include:

Topic 2: Use safe ingredients

Topic 3: Handle food safely

Topic 4: Store food safely

Topic 5: Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises

This programme aims to equip food handlers of both retail and non-retail food establishments with the knowledge and application skills to follow food safety and hygiene procedures and policies, as well as maintain the cleanliness and upkeep of premises.

They are required to attend and pass their first refresher training by the 5th year from the date of first passing FSC L1, and thereafter the second and subsequent training every 10th year from the last refresher course passed date.

- National Environment Agency (NEA)
- Ministry of the Environment

Course Title: Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan
About This Course: Learners will acquire the knowledge and skills to be a RM Team/Leader/Risk Management Champion for the organisation in reducing risks at source by managing the risk management process at workplace. It also entails formation of risk management team, risk assessment, controlling and monitoring the risks, communicating these risks to all persons involved and in compliance with the risk management code of practice (RMCP).

5. Risk assessment methodology

During which, learners have managed stakeholders at different levels and have a good understanding of the organisation’s strategic thrusts. It also includes establishing frameworks for WSH management programmes and emergency preparedness and response plan in accordance with organisational safety and health needs and WSH legal and other requirements.

Course Title: Managing Digital Products

•Evaluate where product management can be practised to improve organization effectiveness in solving customer problems
•Execute the product life cycle activities
•Adopt and apply the suitable principles, techniques and tools in product management framework  to delivery value to both organization and customer
What You'll Learn:
The Managing Digital Products (MDP) course is a foundational course that is part of the NUS-ISS Digital Products and Platforms Training Roadmap for product managers, product owners, service managers, business analysts, product engineers, and product marketers. 

This course presents participants with a practical and interactive learning experience to pick up skills and tools to successfully manage new and existing products in the digital world. It will cover:

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher)(Chinese)
About This Course:
On completion of this course, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include:

The course will cover the following lessons and five topics:

Topic 1: Practise good personal hygiene
Topic 2: Use safe ingredients
Topic 3: Handle food safely
Topic 4: Store food safely
Topic 5: Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
What You'll Learn:
The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedure Course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020. This is to harmonise the training curriculum and assessment across retail and non--retail food businesses, in alignment with the refreshed SSG Skills Framework (SFw) for Food Services.

The course consists of 6 hours of training and 1.5 hours of asessment. Upon successful completion of the course and assessment, a Statement of Attainment (SOA) will be awarded to the participants. This will accord the participants to work in food and beverage preparation / pre-requisite to operate a food shop/stall.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Any person who is planning to handle and prepare food and beverage in SFA-licensed food establishment i.e. Kitchen Managers, Supervisors, Chefs, Sous Chefs, Cooks, Kitchen Assistants, Food Stall Assistants and all food and beverage handlers.

Course Title: WSQ WordPress Website Creation
About This Course: WordPress is a popular platform that allows individuals and businesses to create and manage their websites without advanced technical skills. The learning content of this course includes a range of WordPress tools and plugins that enhance the website's functionality and appearance, which enable trainees to design and develop a professional and functional website using WordPress from start to finish. The applied learning approach is used throughout the course to facilitate the learning of website planning, website hosting, website design, website development, website customisation, website security, website optimisation, website maintenance, and website troubleshooting.

Course Title: Adopting Internet of Things into Operations
About This Course: Participants will be given an overview of the different digital technologies and how business operations have changed as a result of these technologies. They will have the opportunity to develop and take back an Internet of Things (IoT) device. The data gathered from the device can be remotely monitored via dashboards, and they can perform analytics and machine learning techniques on it.
What You'll Learn:
- Identify the different digital technologies and the new business models that arise from them
- Build an IoT device and visualize the data gathered from the sensors via a IoT platform
- Apply Analytics and some Machine Learning techniques on the data
- Relate on how business operations can change with these technologies.
Minimum Entry Requirement: GCE O Levels or quivalent

Course Title: Respond to Service Challenges
About This Course:
The customer is the source of the organisation's cash flows, so organisations must create excellent customer experiences to build strong relationship with them. As such, this course aims to educate individuals, especially those working in the service sectors, the importance of handling and responding service challenges. 
At the end of the course, the frontline service staff should be able to handle and respond service challenges in accordance to organisational service standards.
What You'll Learn:
The four learning units (LU) are:
-LU1: Types of triggers and service challenges (KA1, KA2, KA3, KA5, KA6)
-LU2: Principles of effective communication (KA4)
-LU3: Methods to respond to service challenges (KA7, AA1, AA2, AA3, IVC1, IVC2, SIE1)
-LU4: Methods to improve service performance (LL1, LL2, LL3)

Course Title: Data Visualization Continues With Me
About This Course:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
• Articulate the important principles in creating effective visualizations for data communication.
• Create calculated fields using built-in functions and operators in the data tools.
• Create responsive visualizations using calculated fields or built-in functions to enhance the interactivity in visualizations and/or dashboards.
• Apply advanced building techniques to create impactful analysis with the visualizations.
• Build interactive visualizations and dashboards using real world scenarios to tell compelling stories.
What You'll Learn:
A valued data practitioner can drill deep into the data and draw integrated insights to answer stakeholder’s complex data-problems. Such flair is possible with higher-level data manipulation skills as well as fluency in explaining discoveries, insights and limitations on the analyses performed. If you already have some basic knowledge in visualization and wish to level up your visual analytics skills, this is the course for you.

This course is a continuation of the basic course Data Visualization Begins With Me.  In this course, we will be diving into advanced-level skills, shifting towards more sophisticated visualizations that you can easily create to enhance your analysis. We will also be learning how to build formulas and expressions made up of functions and operators that can be combined to perform advanced calculations to better analyse your data. Together with the practical hands-on activities and project work, this will further enhance your learning experience and reinforce the skills and knowledge you acquired to better perform in your role at work.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Completed Data Visualization Begins With Me (or its equivalent)

Course Title: ChatGPT for Educators: Using it to your Advantage
About This Course:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to: 
• Understand the benefits and limitations of ChatGPT
• Understand the basics of ChatGPT and how it can be used in the classroom 
• Leverage ChatGPT in areas such as training materials, curriculum development, assessment
• Personalise ChatGPT using different criteria such as different age groups, subject matter, scenarios and case studies
• Understand ethical considerations and responsible use of generative AI
What You'll Learn: This course is designed to equip teachers with the knowledge and skills to use ChatGPT in the classroom. Throughout the course, teachers will learn about the potential of Generative AI such as ChatGPT, and how it can be used to automate administrative tasks, and personalize learning experiences. You will learn how to apply AI-powered solutions in a range of practical exercises, to explore how you can use this tool in your classroom. We will also explore the benefits and limitations of ChatGPT, providing guidance on responsible use, and equipping you with the tools to navigate ethical dilemmas in the use of AI.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participants should preferably have tertiary education or diploma with at least three years of relevant teaching experience.

Course Title: Effective Product Demonstration
About This Course:
This course emphasizes the importance of performing effective product demonstrations based on the types of information about the products and services to be presented in beauty care industry. Learners become effective in performing product demonstrations when they apply competently the different methods of demonstration while probing for customer’s requirements using effective communication skills.

The course is designed to include all essential skills and competencies in this area of expertise. SOQ incorporates practical learning including demonstration and hands-on practice with focus of enabling learners effectively transfer their learning and apply in the workplace within the beauty & wellness environment.
What You'll Learn:
The course will enable learners to competently qualify customers’ needs using appropriate questioning techniques, presenting the benefits of relevant products’ features that meet these needs, information on competitors’ products and services etc. 

With competencies in handling customers’ queries and feedback on products and services, learners are able to identify buying signals, apply selling strategies to close sale of products and services with customers, advise customers of any follow-up actions needed etc
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Aged 21 years and above.
• Minimum 1 year of work experience in retail or personal care industry.
• Possess some knowledge about beauty and personal care products such as cosmetics, skin care and beauty and personal treatments.
• Education level of at least Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) Level 3 or its equivalent.
• SOQ shall counsel and advise applicants without meeting the education, literacy and numeracy requirement that they may not be able to comprehend the content, keep up pace of training and/or cope with assessment conducted. Where necessary, unsuitable applicants will be discouraged from enrolling in the programme.

Course Title: Mastering Prompt Engineering for Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:
• Describe the key principles of generative AI models and the role of effective prompting in guiding Artificial Intelligence (AI) performance.
• Explain the relationship between well-crafted prompts and the quality of AI-generated content, as well as the importance of prompt engineering in optimizing generative AI models.
• Construct engaging and thought-provoking prompts tailored to diverse AI applications and project objectives.
• Assess the effectiveness of prompts in facilitating AI-assisted content generation and identify areas for improvement.
• Combine various prompt engineering techniques to create innovative prompts that enhance AI model performance and inspire creativity.
• Critique and refine the quality of prompts in real-life scenarios, ensuring optimal outcomes in AI-driven projects.
What You'll Learn:
Are you seeking to harness the power of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) models and inspire creativity, engagement, and growth in your AI-driven projects? Look no further! In Mastering Prompt Engineering for Generative AI, we delve into the power of inquiry and the art of crafting compelling prompts for various AI applications. Designed for professionals from all fields, including content creators, educators, and trainers, as well as AI enthusiasts, this course will equip you with the skills to create thought-provoking prompts that foster meaningful AI-generated content, enhance problem-solving, and improve communication.

Throughout this interactive course, you will explore the psychology of effective questioning and the importance of tailoring prompts to suit diverse AI applications and project objectives. Through hands-on activities and real-life scenarios, you will learn how to design engaging prompts that encourage creative and high-quality outputs from generative AI models. By the end of this course, you will be well-equipped to create an empowering AI-driven environment that encourages curiosity, enhances creativity, and leads to transformative outcomes.

Embark on this journey of exploration and mastery, and learn how to unlock the full potential of your generative AI projects by asking the right questions.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Basic IT Literacy. No prior understanding about AI or technical knowledge is needed for this course.

• provide statements and evidence in court in the correct manner

About This Course:

This course is targeted at helping the Retail Assistant/Cashier and Senior Retail Assistant/Senior Cashier in the Retail Sector to leverage practically and professionally on available organizational resources to engage customers over a range of various platforms. In this post-Covid era, many retailers have since pivoted to reaching and engaging their customers through various platforms in the customer service journey. Hence, there is an urgent need for frontline retail employees to skill up quickly in understanding the structure of their organization’s service knowledge base and be able to communicate and engage customers effectively and professionally over the various platforms that their organization has adopted.

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher)
About This Course:
On completion of this course, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include: 

The course will cover the following lessons and five topics:

Topic 1: Practise good personal hygiene
Topic 2: Use safe ingredients
Topic 3: Handle food safely
Topic 4: Store food safely
Topic 5: Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
What You'll Learn:
The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedure Course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020. This is to harmonise the training curriculum and assessment across retail and non--retail food businesses, in alignment with the refreshed SSG Skills Framework (SFw) for Food Services.

The course consists of 6 hours of training and 1.5 hours of asessment. Upon successful completion of the course and assessment, a Statement of Attainment (SOA) will be awarded to the participants. This will accord the participants to work in food and beverage preparation / pre-requisite to operate a food shop/stall.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Any person who is planning to handle and prepare food and beverage in SFA-licensed food establishment i.e. Kitchen Managers, Supervisors, Chefs, Sous Chefs, Cooks, Kitchen Assistants, Food Stall Assistants and all food and beverage handlers.

Course Title: Certified User for Child and Adolescents Needs and Strengths (CANS) (Synchronous & Asynchronous)
About This Course:
1. Illustrate how the TCOM framework is used in working with children, youth and families
2. Relate the applications of TCOM in the local context
3. Rationalise the use of standardised assessment tools for communication
4. Analyse the characteristics of the CANS assessment tool
5. Quantify client’s needs and strengths using the CANS assessment tool
6. Analyse the needs and strengths to be prioritised in a case plan.
7. Formulate a case plan to address prioritised needs and strengths
What You'll Learn:
Numerous researches have suggested clients respond favourably when the right level of care is accorded to their needs. Too little care leads to service inadequacy and negates effectiveness; too much care causes resource wastage and deprives the more needy others.
How do we quantify and measure the level of needs and strengths for the clients when each individual is different and unique? How do we measure the needs and strengths and use the information for service planning, intervention, respond to new needs as individual case workers, agency level or even at a system level?
For this simple reason – their needs and strengths must unfold rightly before the appropriate care and services could be determined. Encapsulated in the Child and Adolescent Needs and Strengths (CANS) communimetric assessment tool, professionals working collaboratively have a common assessment tool for service planning and intervention. The CANS communimetric assessment tool not only help caseworkers on the holistic assessment, to target the area of interventions bearing in mind the strengths of the C&Y and their families, the information will also be useful at the agency and system level planning, resourcing as well as research which will help in evidence informed service delivery.
In alliance with the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF), Social Service Institute (SSI) offers the CANS certification training – a critical step towards the renewed approach to the C&Y Service Model. Through our signature Task-based Learning approach, you will acquire critical competencies in administering CANS.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Target audience includes all social service professionals who work with children and young person such as Social Workers, Youth Workers, Heads of Children and Young Person Homes and School Counsellors.

Course Title: Boost Emotional and Social Intelligence with the Enneagram
About This Course: This course equips learners with greater emotional intelligence to better manage self and relationships, and monitor one’s actions to demonstrate resilience in handling diversity and challenging scenarios

A. Review the differences between cognitive and emotional intelligence at the workplace
1. Discover the key competencies and aspects of emotional intelligence

B. Develop emotional competence to better manage personal feelings and actions under different settings
2. Gain self-awareness through the Enneagram to monitor personal emotions and actions that affect work performance and interpersonal relationships
3. Apply emotional intelligence to manage personal impulses and reactions when interacting with customers and colleagues in diverse contexts
  
C. Enhance social intelligence to be more empathetic and accepting of people from different backgrounds and in challenging situations

Course Title: The Civic District and the Cultural Medallion Story (for Licensed Tourist Guides only)
About This Course:
At the end of the course, the participant should be able to:
1.  Relate the story from colony to nation and its development.
2.  Describe iconic monuments that correspond to Singapore’s historic milestones.
3.  Identify selected Cultural Medallion recipients and highlight their contributions to the Arts scene.
What You'll Learn: Let’s rediscover the iconic monuments that mark Singapore’s journey as a nation in the Civic District. The Cultural Medallion award was introduced to show the government’s intent to promote the arts and affirm the role of the arts and culture in national development. At the Cultural Medallion Story at The Arts House, the inspirational stories of the recipients may be told to enrich tour commentaries about Singapore and the people who live here.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Licensed Tourist Guides Only

Course Title: Food Safety Course (Level 1)
About This Course: To equip food handlers of both retail and non-retail food establishments with the knowledge and application skills to follow food safety and hygiene procedures and policies, as well as maintain the cleanliness and upkeep of premises.
What You'll Learn: Food Safety Course Level 1 is a mandatory training program for all food and beverage staff working in SFA licensed food establishments and/or anyone interested to learn safe food preparation.  The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedures course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under the TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020.  Persons preparing food for sale in SFA-licensed food establishments are required to attend and pass Food Safety Course (FSC) Level 1.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Able to understand, read and write in basic English.

Course Title: Standard First Aid + AED Course ( NROC / First Aider )
About This Course:
1) Understand the essential knowledge of First Aid
2) Handle common illnesses , accidents , medical emergencies    and sports injuries with procedures.
3) Perform effective Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) for adult casualties.
What You'll Learn:
1) Essential of First Aid 
2) Unconscious Casualty ( Non Cardiac Arrest )
3) Respiratory Problems
4) Shock , Bleeding and Wounds
5) Musculoskeletal Injuries
6) Burns injuries
7) Other First Aid Knowledge 
8) CPR(HO) + AED
Minimum Entry Requirement:
1) We highly recommend individuals to have attained at least secondary two education or level 5 of ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy.

2)  Must be physically fit.

3) Medically fit with no pre-existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury. Learners with medical problems, such as bronchial asthma, any upper respiratory tract infection, orthopedic problems (e.g. slipped disc), are encouraged to consult their own doctors before attending the course. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training.

4) Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training. You are advised to defer taking the course to at least 6 weeks after delivery.

Course Title: 运用图片提示来激发思考,促进口语及聆听的语言技能 (Using Picture Prompts to Stimulate Thinking and Promote Oral and Aural Chinese Language Skills) (Synchronous e-learning)

Course Title: Project Management Essentials (SF) (Synchronous E-Learning)
About This Course: This unit describes the competency unit for ICT-PMT-3002-1.1 – Project management
What You'll Learn:
Course Content * 
ICT-PMT-3002-1.1
1. Facilitate execution of small projects that are typically less than six months, with limited budget, limited interdependency with other projects, and no significant strategic impact
2. Implement realistic project plans based on the understanding of project objectives and project scope
3. Utilise appropriate methods and tools to track and drive progress of project against set plans and timelines
4. Identify risks to the success of projects and take appropriate actions to manage them

Course Title: GO E.A.S.T. (Experience Arts & Science with Toddlers) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:

1. Recognise the importance of sensory experiences, exploration and play in young children’s growth and learning. 
2. Explore how science process skills can be integrated with arts explorations.
3. Develop age-appropriate activity that integrate science and arts elements.
What You'll Learn:
Young Children are naturally curious. This sense of wonder drives children to observe, explore and act on their ideas. As children explore, work and experiment with nature and material in their environment, they discover and observe changes, cause and effect, patterns and seeing relationships between objects. Young children construct scientific concepts and knowledge through these natural explorations.

The use of art and natural materials is a great way to work with young children to encourage exploration with materials and motivate construction of knowledge. 

This workshop provides hands-on opportunities for Educarers to explore and experiment with art materials; and learn to plan activities to lead young children to discoveries such as cause and effect. It is aimed through observation of children’s skills, careful planning and guidance, children will be motivated to explore, discover and have fun.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
LON Certification Status: L1 , L2 ,  EY2

Course Title: WSQ WordPress Website Creation Course
About This Course:
By the end of the class, participants will be able to:
• List basic web design requirements to create a simple WordPress website
• Understand how to install a WordPress theme and use a drag-and-drop page builder
• Understand the differences between child themes versus parent themes and the advantages and disadvantages of free themes and plugins versus premium themes and plugins
• Create pillar pages and organise them into a main navigation menu
• Create a landing page using selected theme and drag-and-drop page builder
• Identify tools to test whether page speed/loading times are optimal, website is mobile-friendly, and whether there are any indicators of plugin conflicts/issues
• Install appropriate WordPress plugins to enhance WordPress website functionality and user experience
• Assess overall WordPress website functionality and determine plan of action to resolve any potential issues
• List required items to be included in a detailed WordPress design documentation
• Produce detailed WordPress design documentation for website managers
What You'll Learn:
Used by some of the most well-known Fortune 500 companies in the world including Sony, GM, UPS, and international news sites including CNN, Forbes, and The New York Times, WordPress has come a long way to become one of the World Wide Web’s most popular and free open-source content management system. As of 2020, WordPress now powers more than one third of the web.

In this fun and interactive hands-on WordPress class, you will learn from an award-winning web designer, how to create, customise, and maintain a modern-looking WordPress professional corporate and eCommerce website from scratch.

An individual demo domain and web hosting account will be provided to you for a practical experience in creating a modern website from scratch.

Video tutorials will be provided for your reference after the course. Should you face any issues customising your website, post-training support is also available.

Not only will you learn the technical aspects of how to manage and customise a website in this hands-on WordPress class, you will also learn modern web design concepts to create distinguished websites that will pique the interest of web visitors and encourage them to take important actions.

Your website is your 24/7 online salesperson. It works for you even when you’re asleep.

Start creating something great today at Equinet Academy.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Minimum age: 18
• Years of working experience: 0
• Possess basic ICT knowledge such as browsing the web, opening of folders and documents, and basic navigation of software interface
• Motivated learners
• Able to interact with fellow peers
• Proficient in spoken English with at least a PSLE certificate or equivalent

This course is targeted to PMEs (Professionals, Managers, and Executives) who are in marketing roles or intending to get a job in marketing.

Course Title: Color Concept Application

Course Title: Adapt to Change (SF-Associate)
About This Course:
At the end of this course, learners will be able to:
1.  Identify the impact of local and global trends on one’s employability and job role.
2.  Identify the implications of diversity in the workplace and participate in relevant approaches to work within a diverse workforce.
3.  Identify current and new job requirements, gaps in own competencies, and select  training and development opportunities that match personal learning styles.
4.  Transfer skills and knowledge acquired from training and development to the workplace and measure performance improvement as a result of training and development.
5.  Learn from and coach others a given set of skills from one job situation to another.
What You'll Learn:
As market trends and consumer behaviour are rapidly changing in the global economic landscape, the ability for employees to identify global trends and changes impacting their work becomes a crucial factor to organisational growth. Staff need to embrace changes with a view to keep themselves relevant and current to the needs of the industry while seeking to enhance productivity and effectiveness in a diverse workplace. 

This course seeks to enable participants to appreciate the global trends and changes affecting employability and the need to embrace lifelong learning. Participants will learn how to identify local and/or global trends and understand how these changes impact their role in serving customers, as well as adapt a lifelong learning mindset to remain employable in the new knowledge economy. 

This course covers the following content:

- Ways in which various types of local and global trends impact one’s employability and job role

- Ways to cope with adjustments and expectations required in current and new job situation in a local and global context

- Sources and stages of change and resistance to change

- Causes of gaps in own competencies 

- Types of learning opportunities and their characteristics and available resources and opportunities for development

- Ways to overcome barriers to the transfer of learning

- Factors that hinder and encourage learning

- Types of diversity in the workplace
Minimum Entry Requirement:
 GCE 'N' Level Credit (at least C5) in English and Mathematics or Workplace Literacy and Numeracy (WPLN) score: Level 4 for Reading, Listening and Numeracy; and
 With at least 1 year working experience in retail or no working experience are welcome to apply

Course Title: Assess Confined Space for Safe Entry  and Work
About This Course:
On completion of this unit, the learner will have the knowledge and be equipped with the application skills in basic principles in working within/around confined space. This includes:
• Use of appropriate gas testing equipment to ascertain that the confined space atmosphere is safe for entry and work. 
• Recognise the limitation of the test equipment used; calibrate the equipment and use it to obtain representative results for the assessment of confined space for safe entry and work.
• Monitoring the atmospheric conditions to ensure that it is safe for entry and work.
What You'll Learn:
1. Prepare for confined space assessment with persons involved in confined space safety management in accordance with the applicable legal and other requirements.
2. Identify hazards and take measures to prevent harm to safety and health when entering and working in confined space. 
3. Conduct gas testing to ascertain the atmospheric condition in the confined space is safe for entry in accordance with the applicable legal and other requirements; organisational confined space programme and entry permit system.
4. Participate in risk control and emergency response for entry into and working in a confined space in accordance with legal and other requirements.
5. Monitor the confined space conditions and control measures for safe working.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Literacy and Numeracy  WSQ Employability Skills Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 6 or Grade C6 in GCE 'O' Level Mathematics  Grade C6 in GCE 'O' Level Science (Chemistry and Physics) Other relevant skills/ working experience  WSH Skills & Knowledge equivalent to Certificate in WSH; or  3 years of relevant working experience in operations and co-ordination of safety work In place of the Certificate in WSH, we also recognise the following courses as equivalent:  CWSH: WSQ Certificate in WSH  BCSS : Building Construction Supervisors Safety Course  SSC : Shipyard Supervisors Safety Course  BISH : Basic Industrial Safety and Health Course for Supervisors  OPISC: Oil/Petrochemical Industry Safety Course for Supervisors

Course Title: Class A Rotorcraft Unmanned Aircraft Pilot Licence (UAPL) up to 7 kg Multirotor (Practical Training with Assessment)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to competently operate multirotor of up to 7kg to prepare for CAAS Class A Rotorcraft (up to 7kg multirotor) assessment in the following areas:
1. Knowledge on operating UA system
2. Pre-flight and post-flight checks of the UA, with reference to the Original Equipment Manufacturer documents and training manuals
3. Smooth and controlled flying of the following manoeuvres without Global Positioning System assistance:
• Precision hovering at different orientations
• Straight and level circuits
• Climbing and descending circuits
• Figure of “8”
• Precision landing
4. Mission planning procedures via ground control system and able to execute/modify mission during flight
5. Emergency procedures:
• Immediate landing
• Abort of landing
• Emergency stop
• Return to home
What You'll Learn:
Approved by CAAS, this five-day practical course with assessment is designed to prepare participants for the Class A Rotorcraft (up to 7kg multirotor) UAPL assessment.
Participants get two attempts at the Class A Rotorcraft UAPL (up to 7kg multirotor) assessment by our Authorised Flight Examiners (AFE) which will be conducted upon successful completion of the UAPL training course.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Be at least 16 years old.

Course Title: Introduction to Commercial Floristry
About This Course:
After completion of this course, learners should be able to:

- Identify and prepare the relevant tools and materials required for fresh flower arrangements according to commercial requests (table arrangements using foam, bouquets, floral stands)

- Recognise and select appropriate flowers, foliage and fillers for various floral designs

- Flexibly apply a variety of floral artistry techniques to different arrangements

- Professionally arrange fresh flower arrangements according to a range of commercial requests, specifications and market/client standards
What You'll Learn:
This course is designed to provide detailed training in floral arrangement, specifically in its practical application in commercial and artistic contexts.
 
Various foundational skills such as creating ribbon bows, matching accessories and wrapping materials, arranging with floral foam, arranging bouquets, floral stands will be taught, along with the relevant safety procedures. Candidates will also learn how to identify and select appropriate floral materials according to their market names.  

Course learners will be equipped with a variety of floral arrangement skills suitable for entry-level jobs and positions in floral retail outlets, wholesale floral establishments, online florists, hotels in-house florist that offers floral arrangement services.

Beyond providing the base knowledge in floristry required for aspiring florists and floral business owners, the short-term, intensive nature of the course makes it suitable for a wide range of audiences: career-switchers, or working individuals in various industries that wish to augment their existing skillsets for cross-disciplinary purposes (e.g. Hospitality, F&B décor, etc) and hobbyists who wishes to certify their pre-existing skills.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
The minimum entry requirement for the course is as follows:
1) Assumed attitudes, skills and knowledge
Learners are assumed to be:
o Able to listen to and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the
Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 4
o Able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to
Employability Skills System Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 4
o Able to use Numeracy skills equivalent to the Employability Skills
System Workplace Numeracy (WPN) Level 4
o Able to operate a smartphone with basic functions

Course Title: Advanced Certificate in Generative AI, Ethics and Data Protection Module 1: A Practical Approach to Generative AI
About This Course:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand Generative AI and how it is different from other types of AI as well as its learning model
• Explore the different types of Generative AI, including text, audio, image, and video generation
• Identify the potential benefits of using Generative AI in an organisational context and the new generation of apps available
• Learn about ethical considerations in Generative AI, including issues such as bias, transparency, and responsible use
• Gain hands-on experience in generating various outputs using Generative AI software
What You'll Learn:
As the latest hot topic in the tech world, generative AI is increasingly becoming perceived as the next cornerstone of products and services that will change the nature of work. Generative AI possesses various use cases for optimising business operations. It can be employed to automate workflows, create innovative products or services, optimise marketing campaigns, and predict trends. Comprising 6 modules, this programme seeks to provide participants with a good understanding of the use and best practicies of generative AI. The programme cover benefits, ethical and data protection issues, adoption and use, guidance on responsible use. 

With no coding knowledge required, Module 1 delves into the hierarchy of AI and how it learns, before exploring the world of Generative AI, including text, audio, image, and video generation. This course incorporates lots of hands-on practices, demonstrations and case studies to provide participants with a deep understanding of how this technology can be applied in different organisational contexts.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participants should preferably be a degree holder or a diploma holder with at least 3 years of relevant working experience.

Course Title: Data Analytics @ Work 101
About This Course:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Formulate a data-driven initiative using the Cross-industry Standard Process (CRISP) and Objectives and Key Results (OKR) techniques
• Profile and mine data for insight using calculated measures 
• Use data visualisation techniques to reveal hidden patterns
• Apply statistical techniques to understand systems
• Create indicator metrics and indicators to guide strategic decisions
• Forecast trends and create predictive models
What You'll Learn:
Enterprise Analytics – the use of data analysis and data science to drive what organisations do and how they do it – is now a fundamental skillset that is required to succeed in all sectors of advanced economies. As a result, we all face the challenge of developing an ability to design and execute “data driven” initiatives at the workplace. In this context, organisations are increasingly looking for what McKinsey has called the “Analytics Translator” – those individuals who can combine experience from the Business Domain with knowledge from the Analytics Domain to create value from Enterprise Analytics for their organisation.

This course is designed as a first step in a learning journey that will build these blended capabilities, covering the execution of specific analytics techniques alongside frameworks guiding the design of data driven initiatives. Taking a real-world case featuring challenges from Finance, Marketing, Service, Operations, and Strategy, this course will lead participants through a set of practical sessions providing an overview of the principal enterprise analytics techniques.
Minimum Entry Requirement: No prior understanding of enterprise analytics is expected or required. Prior experience of Microsoft Excel at a basic/ foundational level will be useful but is not essential.

Course Title: LUMA Certified Human-Centered Design Practitioner (Classroom, Synchronous & Asynchronous e-learning)
About This Course: The objective of this course is to introduce the concept of design thinking and allow participants to apply the LUMA System of Innovation for creative problem solving. The LUMA System of Innovation enables people to tackle problems of all sizes through design thinking, from employees who face daily work problems to budding entrepreneurs providing a new solution.      The course begins with LUMA’s two-day, in-person Fundamentals of Innovation workshop that introduces to the LUMA System of Innovation in a group setting through a dynamic mix of presentations and hands-on activities. Participants will then attend periodic peer partner sessions and three 2-hr check-ins over 3 months to refine good habits with expert coaching.
What You'll Learn:
1)What does it mean to be a designer, and what is Human Centered Design?
2)How can we build this capability in our people, teams, organisation?
3)Uncover new perspectives using Interviewing
4)From empathy to insight
5)Alternate Ethnographic Methods
6)Identify issues and insights using Rose, Thorn, Bud
7)Reveal themes and patterns using Affinity Clustering
8)Reveal preferences and opinions using Visualize the Vote
9)Focus on people using Stakeholder Mapping
10)Frame the problem using Abstraction Laddering
11)Invite broad exploration using Statement Starters
12)Spark new ideas using Creative Matrix
13)Shift your perspective using Alternative Worlds
14)Scores, Review and Reflection
Minimum Entry Requirement: NA. This course is suitable for anyone interested to use Design thinking to improve daily work processes.

Course Title: Practitioner Certificate in Personal Data Protection (Singapore) 2020 (WSQ) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
Upon completion of this Course, participants will have the following knowledge:
• Understand the importance of being accountable for the personal data that your organization handles
• Identify and manage risks in personal data management
• Develop a Data Protection Management Programme
• Conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment
• Help the respective organization establish a robust data protection infrastructure using risk-based tools
• Manage data breaches
What You'll Learn:
o enhance the capabilities of Data Protection Officers (DPOs) in organisations, a three-day preparatory course - "Practitioner Certificate in Personal Data Protection (Singapore) 2020 (WSQ)" - has been developed to equip them with practical data governance and data protection knowledge and skills, and learn to utilise risk-based tools to establish a robust data protection infrastructure for their organisation.

This is an intermediate course that complements the introductory course on the PDPA (titled "Fundamentals of the PDPA (2020)") under the SkillsFuture Singapore's Skills framework for ICT. Upon successful completion of the course, participants will receive the WSQ Statement of Attainment (SOA) issued by SkillsFuture Singapore.

Additionally, there is an optional computer-based examination that participants can take after the completion of their course to obtain the Practitioner Certificate for Personal Data Protection (Singapore), co-issued by the PDPC and the International Association for Privacy Professionals (IAPP).
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Participants are assumed to be able to:
• Ensure organisation’s compliance to Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)
• Manage risks associated with collection, use, disclosure and storage of personal data.

• Handle queries, complaints and disputes on the organisation’s management of personal data.
• Manage people and organisation in the areas of operational needs, optimising resources, budget allocation, managing and tracking team’s achievements.
• Assist the review of adherence to legislative and regulatory requirements in accordance with organisational guidelines / policies.
• Prepare management report for follow-up action.

Assumed Skills
• Have business writing skills to prepare management report
• Have analytical skills to assess policies and procedures
• Have information gathering skills to gather and collate necessary data
• Have interpersonal and communication skills to interact with relevant stakeholders; an

Course Title: Mixing Music Professionally in Your Home Studio
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to use a digital audio workstation to apply a range of professional sound mixing techniques to mix a music track for publication and distribution.

While there are many freelance music producers, feedback from industry stakeholders reflect a lack of formal training, which hinders their ability to work on larger scale commercial projects both specifically for the music industry or for applications in media and advertising.  In providing training aligned with industry practices, the course will contribute to the raising of professional standards in the music industry. It will empower those who complete the course to take on projects from more established clients, collaborate with seasoned professionals and expand their reach internationally.
What You'll Learn: This course will cover industry-standard music production skills. It will develop the ability of learners to mix music using Logic Pro, a widely used Digital Audio Workstation. The approach is aligned to industry practices and will enable learners to take on a wide range of commercial projects upon completion.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Applicants are required to the meet the following criteria:

1. Have good English proficiency: English language at GCE N(A) Level of 5 and above or equivalent qualifications
2. Possess working knowledge of Digital Audio Workstation software (eg; Logic Pro, Pro Tools, Ableton Live, etc)
3. Possess a basic level of understanding of the composition and arrangement of music tracks

Course Title: Vehicle Safety and Maintenance
About This Course:
This course will let the participants have better understanding about the vehicle, equip them with the knowledge on current automotive systems, including their functions, operations, advantages and disadvantages, maintenance, common problems and the causes of the problems. 

The course will focus on engine, transmission, traction control, suspension, steering, air-con and other current automotive technologies; emphasize the areas for reducing the vehicle maintenance cost and fuel consumption, prolonging the vehicle lifespan.
What You'll Learn:
This interactive course will provide opportunities to discuss the various systems on the vehicles, including training model demonstration and on vehicle inspection. 

The course will summarize the causes of the vehicle accident, how to handle the vehicle accidents and enhance the road safety. It will also analyze how the driving habits affect the vehicle systems, fuel consumption and the road safety.  
The course will also cover the common problems for the 5 years and above private-hire cars, including HEV and EV, the causes of the problems, the common practices of the workshop in rectifying the problems, and how these problems affect the vehicle safety, fuel efficiency and the comfort of the passengers.  

To prepare participants for emerging technologies that contribute to urban solutions, the course will cover HEV and EV as technologies that offer solutions in sustainable/clean energy and urban mobility so that the participants have the knowledge and understanding to help them transit to using such vehicles.
Minimum Entry Requirement: No minimum entry required, all car drivers, owners and junior customer service advisers are encouraged to attend the course.

Course Title: WSQ RESPOND TO FIRE INCIDENT IN WORKPLACE
About This Course: This course is curated to adhere with the MHA and Security Industry Stakeholders on the mandatory CERT training was identified as Upskilling efforts and enhancing the abilities of Security Personnel. AETOS Training Academy (ATA) will adopt and adhere to the MHA requirements to enhance the mandatory CERT training for security personnel. The intent of CERT training is to upskill our officers in their knowledge and abilities to bridge the training gap in their current roles. The enhancements do not aim to change officers' current job functions but rather to enhance their skillsets to grow in their current positions, given the advancement in Fire Emergency Response competency.
What You'll Learn:
 Learners have the knowledge & abilities to Interpret emergency response legislation and guidelines.
 Learners have the knowledge & abilities to identify fire hazard scenarios and conduct a situation assessment.
 Learners know the Company's Emergency Response Team (CERT) and can demonstrate the use of fire protection systems in the workplace.
 Learners have knowledge of the types and usage of fire protection systems and the ability to respond to fire incidents using various extinguishing mediums.
 Learners have knowledge of potential fire hazard scenarios and injuries. They are able to provide operational assistance to the appropriate body during an emergency situation.

Duration of Each Unit
• Unit 1 – Establish Legislations and Regulations of Fire Safety and 
        Protection  (75 mins)
• Unit 2 -  Establish Emergency response plan and CERT Team (60 mins) 
• Unit 3 -  Recognize Fire Hazard Scenarios and Situation Assessment 
        (75 mins)
• Unit 4 -  Operate Fire safety and fire protection systems (105 mins)
• Unit 5 -  Respond to Fire Incidents (105 mins)

Target Audience
Personnel performing the role of Auxiliary Police Officer (APO) and Auxiliary Police Officer (Enforcement) (APOE) and Security Officer.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Entry Requirements
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WPL Level 4 
• Be able to manipulate numbers at WPN Level 4 
• Be able to act in a professional manner 
• Be able to observe confidently 
• Be vigilant at all times

Nationality
Singapore Citizens, Malaysian Citizens who are Singapore Permanent, holders of Work Permits or Employment Passes.

Age
The minimum entry age for learners shall be 18 years old at the time of application and the maximum age shall be 70 years old.

Physical and Medical Requirement
• Certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work
• Not be colour-blind or hearing impaired

Education Qualifications
The minimum entry educational qualification for learners shall be 3 GCE ‘N” Level credits, 3 SPM Credits, NITEC or their equivalent.

Process of Application
The Training Provider shall verify the authenticity of all the documents supporting the application.

Course Title: User Experience Design Bootcamp
About This Course:
-Have a comprehensive understanding of UX design and the design process.
-Understand human-centered user research and the different research methodologies used to obtain data.
-Using principles of information architecture to develop and document personas, journey maps, user flows and annotated wireframes.
-Understand the ins and outs of usability testing to further understand user behaviors and what drives them when using products.
-Identify the best practices in visual and UI design to create user Iiterfaces with these principles.
-Utilize industry-standard tools such as Figma as a UI design and prototyping tool to create wireframes and prototypes.

You’ll learn current best practices and conventions in UX design and apply them to create effective and compelling digital experiences for FinTech websites or apps. Classes are led by experienced practitioners, culminating with a capstone project at the end that simulates real-world FinTech scenarios.

Course Title: Perform Rigger and Signalman Tasks
About This Course:
CE 1: Prepare to perform rigger and signalman tasks

Participate in risk assessment and lifting plan briefing for lifting operations as a rigger
Identify risks of lifting operation related to rigger and signalman at work site
Ascertain weight of loads
Determine the Centre of Gravity of regular and irregular loads
Conduct pre-lift inspection of the crane, lifting gear and accessories
Select appropriate rigging equipment, lifting gears and accessories for lifting the load
Check the serviceability of communication equipment and radio
Set up communications equipment and radio channels for safe lifting operations
Practice good housekeeping of communication equipment, crane lifting gear and accessories
Report any abnormalities/ defects in the crane, lifting gear, accessories and communication equipment according to standard operating procedures
CE 2: Perform rigger and signalman tasks

Observe and apply safety practices and hazard work site when carrying out rigger and signalman tasks
Identify hazards related to lifting operations
Use of PPE and tag line to carry out rigger and signalman tasks
Select and use appropriate slinging method, rigging equipment, lifting gears and accessories on load
Check to ensure an adequate number of lifting gears to lift the load
Apply rigging techniques to load
Verify that load is properly rigged
Apply 3-step lifting and lowering method
Direct load to destination with safe lifting techniques
Communicate lifting instructions using standard hand and voice signals
Check for blind spots and estimate clearance of swing path
CE 3: Reinstate rigger and signalman work area

Dismantle rigging equipment, lifting gears and accessories
Carry out housekeeping of equipment and work area
Carry out post-operational checks on communication equipment, crane lifting gear and accessories
Report any damage and defects on communication equipment, crane, lifting gear and accessories
What You'll Learn: Perform Rigger and Signalman Tasks is a course that teaches students the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively perform rigging and signalman tasks in a variety of industrial settings. The course typically covers topics such as rigging equipment and hardware, load handling and lifting techniques, rigging and signaling safety procedures, and communication and coordination with other workers. Upon completion of the course, students should have the ability to properly select, inspect, and use rigging equipment, understand load weight and stability, and understand hand signals. The course may be offered to workers in construction, industrial, manufacturing, or any field that requires the use of cranes, forklifts, or other heavy equipment.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Have a basic knowledge of the relevant sector of work
Be able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills (ES) level 2
Be able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2
Be able to manipulate numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ES level 2; and
Be medically fit

About This Course: The “Operate Lorry Crane” Course is aimed at providing individuals with the knowledge and skills to operate lorry crane safely. At the end of the course, participants will be proficient in lorry crane operations, especially in assessing risks and observing safety measures.

- Have a good sense of “situational awareness” and safety consciousness

Course Title: Data Visualisation with Power BI (SFw)
About This Course: The demand for visual analytics in business processes, for quick and informed decision-making, is ever increasing. Data is produced at an incredible rate and the ability to collect and store the data is increasing at a faster rate than the ability to analyse it. Data visualization has proved its worth as a crucial tool in today’s data focused business world. When it becomes difficult to understand complex data, resorting to the uncomplicated language of data visualization helps simplify it to an easy grasp manner.
What You'll Learn: This two-days course provides learners with the knowledge and skills analyze data with Power BI. Use Power BI Desktop to connect to data (usually multiple data sources), shape that data (with queries that build insightful, compelling data models), and use that model to create reports (which others can leverage, build upon, and share). Power BI Desktop centralizes, simplifies, and streamlines what can otherwise be a scattered, disconnected, and arduous process of designing and creating business intelligence repositories and reports.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Participant should have familiarity working with Microsoft Excel application such as creating Pivot Table, Charts and Excel formula (SUM, AVERAGE, etc)

Course Title: Lead Charger Series: CLIMB Lead & Construct Modules
About This Course:
At the end of the programme, participants will be able to 
• identify his brand, leadership style of self;  
• understand the concept of leading with his authentic self, 
• evaluate his current business situation, 
• apply the right leadership practices suited for the business, 
• manage teams with team dynamics mapping, 
• communiate effectively in a team, 
• manage team performance, team engagement and conflict resolution
What You'll Learn:
In a highly competitive business landscape, SMEs face challenges in developing leaders who can ensure sustainability and lead growth. To address this, often, the leaders are put through leadership development programs which focus on acquisition of business competencies and skills: For example, how to negotiate a winning contract, read a P&L sheet, create a strategic plan or devise meaningful metrics.

This module offers a completely different approach that trains participants how to capitalize on the two most essential assets a leader has at his or her disposal: 1) his or her leadership talents and strengths and 2) the talents and strengths of the people who comprise the organization. Using proven Talent Plus ® science and methodology as the foundation, this module trains how to spot, place, develop and retain top talent and identify the natural gifts of team members to make the most of their strengths for individual and organizational success. Competencies can be taught; talent is innate, and the greater the investment in developing its full potential, the further an organization’s leaders can accelerate positive business outcomes. The module addresses the core issues related to talent management through scientific methods of talent profiling, nurturing and thereby ensuring performance and retention. In longer term, the take-aways from this module help the learners to create and sustain a high-impact leadership within their organisations.

Course Title: Introduction to Information Technology (IT)
About This Course: The Introduction to Information Technology course provides participants with a fundamental understanding of Singapore's Information Technology (IT) landscape. It is designed to be a comprehensive introduction; the curriculum delves deep into the heart of IT, focusing on current trends in the industry, key job roles in Singapore’s IT sector, foundational hardware and software concepts, and the essential terminologies that are pivotal to success in the field. With a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical insights, the course aims to prepare trainees for a potential career in IT within Singapore and beyond.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to:
● Interpret the importance and impact of Singapore's IT industry across various sectors, including the current trends and dynamics shaping the IT industry.
● Explore diverse roles like software development, cybersecurity, and IT project management and the required skills and qualifications.
● Acquire a comprehensive understanding of computer hardware components and their functions, encompassing CPU operations, memory distinctions, storage comparisons, the dynamics of peripheral devices, differences between desktops and laptops, server roles, and the functionalities of input and output devices. 
● Develop a comprehensive understanding of software systems, encompassing the differentiation of software types, the functionalities of operating systems and device drivers, proficiency in software installation and file management, and a keen appreciation of software licensing nuances and variations.
● Acquire a comprehensive knowledge of IT terminology and networking principles, emphasising clear articulation of key terms and understanding of prominent acronyms, including essential network terminologies.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
● WPLN Level 4
● 1 GCE ‘O’ level or equivalent; OR
● NITEC/Higher NITEC; OR
● Mature candidates (≥ 30 years old with 8 years’ work experience in an ICT-related field); OR
● Candidates with other qualifications will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Course Title: ISC2 Certified Cloud Security Professional Common Body of Knowledge (CCSP CBK) Training Seminar
About This Course: The course domains are: - Architectural concepts and design requirements - Cloud data security - Cloud platform & infrastructure security - Cloud application security - Operations - Legal and compliance
What You'll Learn:
As more organisations adopt cloud-based systems, new complexities and challenges surface. To ensure that cloud security professionals have the required knowledge, skills and abilities to audit, assess and secure cloud infrastructures, ISC2 and the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) recently developed the Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSPSM).

The Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) credential reflects in-depth knowledge derived from hands-on information security and cloud computing experience. It validates practical know-how for professionals whose responsibilities involve cloud security architecture, design, operations and service orchestration.

CCSP defines the qualifications and experience necessary to competently secure cloud services. Ultimately, it provides a new benchmark for cloud security knowledge and competence and is viewed as the most reliable indicator of overall proficiency in cloud security.
Minimum Entry Requirement: For candidate taking CCSP exam, the requirements - Minimum 5 years of cumulative paid full-time IT experience, of which 3 years must be in information security and 1 year in 1 of the 6 domains of the CCSP examination. Earning the Cloud Security Alliance’s Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK) can be substituted for 1 year of experience in 1 of the 6 domains of the CCSP examination. Earning (ISC)²’s Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) credential can be substituted for the entire CCSP experience requirement.

The learners will comprehend the basic AI-related terms such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Expert Systems which will play a key role in the future of technology and science. Learners by working on some simple practices and small-scale projects will understand practical uses of AI in business and daily life as well as its diverse applications and possibilities, including AI as a career. In doing so, learners will be also able to appreciate the challenges of AI. As it is an introductory course, learners do not have to be an IT expert or programmer to attend it.

Course Title: Child First Aid Course (CFA)
About This Course:
By the end of the course, learners will have the relevant knowledge and
application skills in Child First Aid to apply during an emergency or accident for
adult and infant casualties.
1. Explain the duties and responsibilities of Child First Aid Provider.
2. Perform BCLS+AED effectively on adult unconscious casualties.
3. Perform the relief of Foreign Body Airway Obstruction (FBAO)
effectively on adult conscious and unconscious casualties.
4. Perform Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) effectively on infant
unconscious casualties.
5. Perform the relief of Foreign Body Airway Obstruction (FBAO)
effectively on infant conscious and unconscious casualties.
6. Apply first aid to adult, child and infant casualties.
7. Manage a medical emergency.
What You'll Learn:
This classroom-based training course will equip learners with the
competencies to provide skills outlined by Singapore Resuscitation and First
Aid Council (SRFAC) in the Child First Aid Provider Course.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
P1. Prior reading SRFAC Standard First Aid & BCLS+AED Manuals.
P2. We highly recommend individuals to have attained at least secondary two education or level 5 of ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy.
P3. Must be physically fit and able to render help to another individual during an emergency.
P4. Medically fit with no pre-existing medical conditions such as knee, spinal or joints injury. Learners with medical problems, such as bronchial asthma, any upper respiratory tract infection, orthopaedic problems (e.g. slipped disc), are encouraged to consult their own doctors before attending the course. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training.
P5. Pregnant ladies are discouraged from undertaking the CPR practice due to safety reasons. In case of doubt, please consult your doctor first and produce a Letter/Memo to indicate if fit for training. You are advised to defer taking the course to at least 6 weeks after delivery.

2. Wire flowers and accessories for use in floral arrangements according to accepted industry standards.

3. Recognize, choose and use appropriate main flowers, foliage and filler flowers for floral arrangement orders. 

4. Assemble Floral Bouquets and Floral Arrangements in accordance to customer's demands and needs.

What You'll Learn:
This comprehensive course is designed for professional florists and aspiring floral designers who want to elevate their skills and knowledge to the next level. Throughout the course, you will learn the fundamental principles of floral design, including color theory, composition, and floral care. You will also gain an understanding of the latest trends in the industry and how to apply them in your work.

In addition to design techniques, the course will cover essential business strategies, including pricing, marketing, and client communication. You will learn how to create proposals and contracts, manage a budget, and deliver exceptional customer service to build a loyal clientele.

Throughout the course, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of floral materials, from traditional blooms to unconventional elements such as succulents and plants. You will also have access to a variety of tools and resources, including online tutorials, video demonstrations, and hands-on practice sessions.
