What You'll Learn: Duties and responsibilities of an admin professional * qualities and skills in a multi-tasking workplace * applying principles of effective office administration * handling information, files, documents, and records efficiently * applying soft skills for interacting with people * working with bosses * tools for performing administrative tasks * performing and monitoring follow-up actions
Minimum Entry Requirement:
able to speak, read, and write at a English proficiency level of ES WPLN L3 or equivalent
attitudes that include:  a sense of responsibility, able to support and add value to business operation, being passionate in performing work activities
target age group:   25 and above
minimum education level:   GCE 'O' Level
required years of experience:   6 months of work experience

Course Title: Supervise Manufacturing Work for WSH (Classroom and Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
This unit of competency specifies the knowledge,
skills and attitudes required of a WSH Coordinator
or Supervisor to identify the common safety & health
hazards and take appropriate control measures
while working in the metal working or other
manufacturing industry
What You'll Learn:
• Explain and interpret salient WSH legislations and other requirements relevant to the manufacturing industry
• Describe the WSH duties and responsibilities of a supervisor in manufacturing industry
• Identify WSH hazards, evaluate and control risks in manufacturing industry in accordance with risk management process
• Carry out WSH inspections in accordance with organisational inspection procedures
• Implement WSH training and promotional programmes in accordance with legal and other organisational requirements
• Conduct incident investigation and prepare report in accordance with legal and other organisational requirements

Course Title: Developing a Professional Portfolio for Educators (DPPE) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course: This short course will cover the skills required for early childhood educators to develop a professional e-portfolio to support their professional development. Learners will be taught how to reflect on their professional practice, use reflective language and use this in goal setting for development.
What You'll Learn:
Learners will be able to:
1. Apply the reflection cycle and reflective language to reflective practice as an educator
2. Set goals for professional development
3. Create an e-portfolio
4. Use appropriate citation and digital tools to credit external sources and protect the privacy of minors
Minimum Entry Requirement:
- Be ECDA-certified as EY2/ L1/ L2
- Currently employed in a childcare registered or licensed with ECDA

Course Title: WSQ Enhancing Resilience and Self-care through Effective Stress Management
About This Course: The course is designed to equip learners with an understanding of basic self-care principles and apply stress management techniques in coping with work stress and reducing burnout.
What You'll Learn:
Upon the completion of this course, the learners will be able to:
1. Identify self-care strategies that boost dietary and physical well-being
2. Develop a simple self-care routine that is appropriate to individual’s need
3. Use appropriate strategies to cope with stress and anxiety
4. Identify unwarranted emotional bond or symptoms of stress at work
5. Develop self-awareness to gain mastery over personal responses at work
6. Express initiative to conduct work-related discussions with co-workers or Reporting Officers

Course Title: Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher) (Chinese)
About This Course:
On completion of this unit, participants will have the knowledge and skills in Food Safety and Hygiene and be able to apply them at the workplace. These include:

- Practise good personal hygiene
- Use safe ingredients
- Handle food safely
- Store food safely
- Maintain cleanliness of equipment and premises
What You'll Learn:
The Singapore Food Agency (SFA), together with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG), have revised the Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedures course (also known as Basic Food Hygiene Course) and renamed it as Food Safety Course Level 1 under the TSC name of Food Safety and Hygiene Level 1 with effect from 30 November 2020.

Thus, with effect from 30 November 2020, the Refresher Basic Food Hygiene course is now known as Food Safety Course Level 1 (Refresher).

The half-day course aims to refresh food handlers on the knowledge and application skills to Food Safety Course Level 1.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Participants must be able to read, write and understand basic Mandarin.

Candidates must be in proper dress code (e.g. no slippers, long hairs are tied up and no nail polish) and are encouraged to adhere to them when attending the course.

Previously attend the Basic Food Hygiene Course certificate awarded by any ONE of the following:

- Singapore SkillsFuture Singapore under the WSQ framework in any training center
- National Environment Agency (NEA)
- Ministry of the Environment

Our staff and course consultants attending course enquirers would screen interested trainees whether they fulfill the course pre-requisites which include the above WPLN levels. Learners who do not meet the WPLN Levels would be encouraged to take up the appropriate WPLN courses.

Course Title: 2 days - Office 365 - Excel 2021 and Data Analytics - level 1
About This Course: This course "2 days – Office 365 – Excel 2021 and Data Analytics – level 1"  is designed to provide learners with a solid foundation in using Excel for data analysis. By the end of the course, learner will understand business statistics and how to apply them in decision-making. They will be able to identify relevant datasets, manage and analyze data using Excel’s basic formulas and functions, and collect data from various sources. Learners also gain skills in preparing reports, handling data from different file types, and troubleshooting common errors in Excel.
What You'll Learn:
Learning Outcomes:

LO1: Able to define Business Statistics and its uses
LO2: Able to identify the Dataset that can provide the necessary information to answer the business questions
LO3: Able to use Excel to manage data, basic formulas and functions to compute results
LO4: Able to collect data, gather data from system and external sources 

Topics Covered:

• Data and Information
• Data Analysis Process and its stages
• Business Statistics examples and its uses in decision making – mean, mode, median, range, standard deviation
• Structured and Unstructured Data 
• Common Sources of Data
• Qualitative vs Quantitative Data
• Workbook and Worksheet Structure, insert and delete rows, columns, worksheets
• Data Types in Excel, moving around in Excel, different types of mouse pointer, shortcuts
• AutoFill, Ctrl+B,I,U,5 , borders, text alignment, use of format painter for quick formatting
• Basic Statistical Functions – sum, median, mode, max, count, countA, countblank, round
• Cell Referencing, A1, $A$1, A$1, $A1  in Formulae
• vlookup functions
• if functions
• Working with Excel Tables – auto filter, sizing handle, total
• Basic Data Visualization using Conditional Formatting and Graphs
• Freeze pane for long reports, Sorting and Filtering
• Page Layout and Report Output
• Types of Errors
• Data Analysis pipeline
• Get data from Worksheets and other Workbooks
• CSV files, Text Files
• External Files
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Minimal education qualification is PSLE with 1 year of relevant working experience
• Speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the WPL Level 3, and manipulate numbers at a not lower than the WPN Level 3.

Course Title: WSQ Communicate Effectively at the Workplace

1) Recognise sources of internal and external information, the types of information to be received, clarified and responded to, performing tasks related to interpreting and analysing information received

Course Title: Workplace Automation 101: Automation at Work with Microsoft Power Platform
About This Course:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
• Apply an Automation Design Framework
• Create Process Flow Automations using Microsoft Power Automate
• Create Automated Business Apps using Microsoft Power Apps
• Apply an Automation Governance Framework
What You'll Learn:
The Fourth Industrial Revolution has begun, spurring a wave of digital transformation that has spread across industries, sectors, and the wider economy. For many working in service-based organisations and “white collar” operations, this trend has led to a focus on the automation of business processes, with new digital technologies such as Robotic Process Automation and Intelligent Assistants increasingly taking root. The resulting impact on work in commercial and government sectors can be radical and disruptive.

In this context, this course will build practical skills in the design and use of the Microsoft Power Platform – an integrated set of low code tools that enable fast development of process automations at the workplace.
Minimum Entry Requirement: This course has been designed to be an introduction to automation with Microsoft Power Platform. As such, no prior technology skills are expected. However, familiarity with Microsoft Office 365 tools would be beneficial (e.g., Excel, Word, Outlook, etc).

Institution: SINGAPORE UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY AND DESIGN
Course Title: Business Model Innovation
About This Course:
• Demonstrated understanding of the Design Innovation (DI) Process, including the structural elements of people, process, methods, and principles
• Understanding and ability to cite example applications of Business Model Innovation principles and alternative approaches
• Understanding and ability to create a business plan
• Understanding and ability to develop elements and full Business Model Canvas
(BMC)
• Understanding and ability to apply Lean Startup principles and process structure, when paired with DI process and agile process
• Understanding and ability to assess organization with the DI audit tool and to develop DI management approaches
What You'll Learn:
In this digital economy, many companies have developed and pioneered innovative business models such as Apple, Amazon, AirBnB, Dropbox, Google, Netflix, Uber, Tesla and more. 
A business model describes the rationale of how an organization creates, delivers and captures value. Business model innovation looks at enhancing and sustaining an organisation's competitive advantage through unique value creation and delivery to its customers. 
The aim of this programme is to guide participants through a strategic analysis of their current business model in order to identify a focused selection of high potential opportunities that could boost their organisation's performance. 
Participants will engage with concepts and tools of Design Innovation for business model design, innovation, differentiation and diversification. They will also be inspired by lots of examples and walk away with creative mindsets that will boost their performance. 
By the end of the programme, each participant will have identified a focused selection of high-potential opportunities to apply business model innovation to their company and understand the concept of iterations using lean startup methodology.

Course Title: Specialty Perfumery Craft
About This Course:
Learning Outcome 1: Maintain a taxonomy of materials according to their functions and uses in specialty product design.
Learning Outcome 2: Analyze user needs for materials to be used in specialty product design based on current trends.
Learning Outcome 3: Propose materials for specialty product design based on material characteristics to meet user needs.
Learning Outcome 4: Inspect the final product design to ensure they have functionality, usability and form.
What You'll Learn:
For this course, involved in the design of such specialty perfume products are often different from factory-made ones or even artisan perfume making in which ingredients used are mainly alcohol-based. This course involved different types of non-alcohol-based ingredients used in specialty perfume making and selecting the appropriate materials based on their properties and characteristics to tailor the product to specific customer needs.

Specialty Perfume Design in general needs three main components: 
1. Gaining a deep understanding of customer’s needs (Functionality)
2. Understanding of the materials involved in crafting the product (Usability)
3. Consideration of aesthetic appeal factor in design (Form)
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Age: 21 years old and above
Minimum Secondary
Minimum PSLE English Language Score of C (pre-2021 system) or AL6 (post-2021 system)
Working Experience: Not Required
Be able to speak, listen and read English at a proficiency level not lower than the Employability Skills Workforce Skills Qualification (ES WSQ) Workplace Literacy (WPL) Level 4

Course Title: 选“对”华文图书和玩具 (Choosing the RIGHT Chinese Books and Toys for Pre-Schoolers) (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
1. 了解各类玩具的适宜年龄（各年龄段适宜的玩具）
2. 了解新加坡目前的玩具及图书的种类
3. 掌握选择图书及玩具的原则（教师/家长）
4. 熟练掌握选择适宜的材料制定华语学习计划

1. Select toys according to the children’s age appropriation 
2. Acknowledge the most updated selection of toys and books available in Singapore
3. How to choose books and toys according to their materials and content
4. Explore how to look for appropriate materials to develop Preschool Chinese language curriculum
What You'll Learn:
图书和玩具是幼儿在成长过程中必不可少的条件，幼儿早期及幼儿期以游戏为主，思维以直觉行动和具体形象为主，故在选择玩教具必需要适合幼儿所需的载体——玩具和图书。玩具是引起幼儿游戏动机的工具，通过在游戏时儿童必需依赖玩具的“隐性及显现”的“指引”，幼儿在“适宜的玩具”“带领”下有创造性的进行游戏。绘本图书的功能对有阅读能力的儿童来说，也极大程度促进儿童的发展。

Books and toys are indispensable to the growth and development of young children. Learning in early childhood is dominated by games and images. Therefore, the choice of teaching aids like toys and books should be selected carefully for our young learners. Through guided play,
toys can be a tool that motivates young children to play and learn creatively. The function of picture books can also greatly promote the development of children with reading abilities.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
LON Certification Status: L1, L2, EY1, EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Infant Educator, Infant Educator, Senior Infant Educator, Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Lead Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator

Course Title: Data Analytics Begins With Me
About This Course:
"Basic data analytics taught with a simple but powerful graphical user interface (GUI) drag-and-drop tool targeted at business analysts requires more sophisticated capabilities than what a spreadsheet can offer.

Understanding and using data is increasingly an important part of an executive function. Whether you are a business analyst, customer service officer, physiotherapist, procurement officer or HR executive – the ability to understand where potential data is coming from, and to properly collect, clean, and analyse it, will be an important and critical skill.

This course provides participants with the knowledge and skills to participate in the organisation’s data analytics process without any coding requirements.

It will cover basic concepts of data analysis, processing of data, and visualisation of raw data and processed data to gain insights, followed by building simple models for classification and prediction.

Participants will also learn to use the free and open source data analytics tool, Orange, a powerful and popular Python-based data analytics tool. Orange has a point-click-drag-and-drop GUI, no programming knowledge is required.

At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
• Understand the data analytics end-to-end workflow
• Identify where the potential sources of data can come from
• Use a GUI-based analytics tool to process, clean and prepare data for analysis
• Perform basic analysis such as classification and predictions
• Select the most appropriate analytics model to use for a specific task
"
What You'll Learn:

Course Title: Assess Confined Space for Safe entry and work course
About This Course:
On completion of this unit, the learner will have the knowledge and be equipped with the application skills in basic principles in working within/around confined space. This includes:
• Use of appropriate gas testing equipment to ascertain that the confined space atmosphere is safe for entry and work. 
• Recognise the limitation of the test equipment used; calibrate the equipment and use it to obtain representative results for the assessment of confined space for safe entry and work.
• Monitoring the atmospheric conditions to ensure that it is safe for entry and work.
What You'll Learn:
1. Prepare for confined space assessment with persons involved in confined space safety management in accordance with the applicable legal and other requirements.
2. Identify hazards and take measures to prevent harm to safety and health when entering and working in confined space. 
3. Conduct gas testing to ascertain the atmospheric condition in the confined space is safe for entry in accordance with the applicable legal and other requirements, organisational confined space programme and entry permit system.
4. Participate in  risk control and emergency response for entry into and working in a confined space in accordance with legal and other requirements.
5. Monitor the confined space conditions and control measures for safe working.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Literacy requirements:
WSQ Employability Skills Workplace Literacy Level 6; or Grade C6 in GCE ‘O’ Level for English.

WSH Skills / Working experience requirements:
A) WSH Skills & Knowledge equivalent to Certificate in WSH / BCSS / SSSC / BISH / SWSPP / SWCSO  or
B) 3 Years of relevant working experience in operations and co-ordination of safety work. 
Assumed Attitude:
Attitude that the individual are recommended to possess before taking up the unit so as to confidently undertake the unit and to be successful subsequently on the job.

The person should be vigilant, alert and wary at all times to spot hazards to safeguard the person as well as others entering and working in the confined space. Be adaptable, able to think and response fast is also important in react to any situations that may occur during confined space assessment and monitoring.
The persons should be self directed, with an analytical mind and a meticulous approach to problem solving; assertive, and objective

Course Title: Threat Observation (Recognise Terrorist Threats)
About This Course: This course aims to equip learners with the basic knowledge and skills required to apply procedures appropriate to terrorism related emergency situations or incidences. Learner will also learn how to harness technology to enhance their productivity in carrying out their duties relating to managing terrorism related incidents.
What You'll Learn:
Although Singapore is highly regarded as a country of law and order. The terrorism threat to Singapore remains high. There continues to be cases of Singaporeans (and foreigners) in Singapore being radicalised by violent extremist propaganda.  
The Terrorism Financing National Risk Assessment (“TF NRA”) conducted in 2020 has found that Singapore continues to be exposed to TF threats posed by terrorist groups both regionally and internationally, in particular the propensity for individuals in Singapore to be radicalised and influenced to carry out TF activities.

By the end of the course, learners would be equipped with the knowledge and skills in identifying, prevention, management and notification, and how to use technology to achieve better outcome and contribute to better security standards for Singapore.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
1. Learners must be above the age of 16 at the time of application. 
2. No minimum educational entry requirements. However, Learners must meet the required workplace literacy and numeracy level and should possess the relevant assumed skills and knowledge.

Course Title: Information System Security Professional
About This Course:
LO1: Perform risk management on organizational assets based on organizational guidelines and security principles.
LO2: Propose modifications to boost the protection of assets based on organizational guidelines.
LO3: Plan security blueprint based on organizational requirements and security principles.
LO4: Design network security system.
LO5: Integrate network security solutions into architecture.
LO6: Design IAM system.
LO7: Integrate IAM solutions into architecture.
LO8. Review system architecture against security requirements based on organizational guidelines and security principles.
LO9: Develop a control plan for the security system architecture based on organizational guidelines and security principles.
LO10: Design software-driven solutions.
LO11: Integrate software development into architecture.
What You'll Learn:
Targeted Sector(s) Background for the Training
IT Security is a skillset that is cross platform, domains and industries. Before any security controls can be implemented within the organization, having a clear understanding of the needs of the business, risks the business faces as well as the holistic requirements equips the security person with enough credible information to implement good security controls. We will be marketing the courses to more IT dependant industries that is growing because of IT reach (e.g. FinTech, Financial Institutes, Medical & Healthcare, Public Sector and etc.) but as long as the attendee is interested in an IT career, security will still be relevant to them. Currently as a training organization, we have a good pool of customers in the industries that is growing and has the need for Cyber Security professionals.   

Targeted Sector(s) Needs for the Training
As the consumption of IT increase in different forms and factors, cyber security personnel are growing in importance within the market. IT exists in almost all industries and sectors; and cyber security provides assurance to enable IT consumption. Based on hiring needs via the research done, we can see that there are still a lot of positions to be filled that requires cyber security knowledge. A search in monster (https://www.monster.com.sg/srp/results?query=cissp) brought up more than 1000 open positions while a LinkedIn search (https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search?keywords=cissp&location=Singapore) brought up more than 700 positions on 23th Sept 2022. 
This article from (https://resources.infosecinstitute.com/certification/cissp-job-outlook/) provides the insight of the value of the training and certification from a well-respected source.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
There are no prerequisite requirements for taking the CISSP Course or the CISSP exam; however, in order to apply for CISSP certification, the candidate must meet the necessary experience requirements determined by ISC2. 

- Minimum Diploma is required.
- Trainocate will assess the learner's suitability if they are unable to meet the minimum entry requirements.

2. Person-Borne Threats
3. Vehicle-Borne Threats
4. Object-Based Threats

This course is targeted at newcomers to the security sector in Singapore. This course is one of 3 mandatory modules required by the Singapore Police Force (SPF) Police Licencing and Regulatory Department (PLRD) to obtain a security officer licence. Within the primary target sector, security agencies must ensure that their security officers meet the necessary Progressive Wage Model (PWM) training requirements prior to deployment. 

This course seeks to equip learners with the essential knowledge and skills required to “Handle Security incidents and Services” and other related duties in adherence to the organisational procedures at their site of deployment. Furthermore, all officers must be trained and certified prior to their deployment as necessitated by The Police Licencing and Regulatory Department (PLRD).
What You'll Learn: On completion of the course, security officers and auxiliary police officers would acquire the knowledge, skills and attitudes to describe contemporary terrorist threats, identify person-borne threats, vehicle-borne threats and object based threat, and carry out appropriate actions.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to:
• Be able to read, write and speak English at WSQ WPL Level 3
• Be able to read from a computer monitor and see from a distance
• Possess basic skills in operating a computer
• Be truthful and honest

• Be disciplined and able to follow instructions when given

They must:
Be certified by a medical doctor to be physically fit for work as a security officer.
Not be colour-blind or hearing impaired.

Course Title: Creating a Self-Directed Learning Environment (Synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
The design of the physical space plays a primary role in facilitating the development and maintenance of relationship of the occupants. The space sends a message that getting to know one another is important, constructing expectations of how we work, live and play in those settings. Effective environments are comfortable, interesting, attractive and appropriate for the child, holding intrinsic interest and giving children myriad ways to practice and refine skills across all aspects of learning.

A self-directed learning environment is about children having opportunities to choose, extend their play, interest and learning. Children will have purposeful opportunities to become absorbed and engrossed, develop skill of concentration and perseverance. A self-directed learning environment not only provides opportunities to apply learning from other curricular areas, but also helps children to work collaboratively, which can be transferred and applied to all learning that takes place in the centre, at home and in all aspects of life. Thus, paving the way for lifelong learners.
What You'll Learn:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:

1. Recognize the effects of learning environments on preschool-age children.
2. Identify features of learning environment that help preschool-age children feel secure, comfortable, welcome and ready to explore and learn.
3. Acquire knowledge on how to design and maintain a developmentally appropriate environment for preschoolers.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
LON Certification Status: L1 , L2 , EY2

Occupational Title: Beginning Early Years Educator, Early Years Educator, Senior Early Years Educator, Beginning Preschool Educator, Preschool Educator, Senior Preschool Educator, Lead Preschool Educator

Course Title: Generative Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals
About This Course:
• Knowledge of generative models including different types of generative models (Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), and autoregressive models)
• Explore applications of Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI)
• Ethical considerations in Generative AI
• Immersive experience in generating various outputs using generative.
What You'll Learn:
Dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI) creativity with this course, perfect for participants from a non-technical background. Over two engaging days, you'll be introduced to generative models like Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), and autoregressive models.
Through friendly discussions and interactive sessions, you'll uncover how these models work and what they can do – from crafting lifelike images to generating text. You'll also explore where Generative AI is used in real life, touching on important ethical considerations along the way. The best part is, you'll get hands-on experience using generative AI software to create your own unique outputs, whether you're into art, writing, or just curious about the possibilities of AI. By the end of the course, you'll have a solid grasp of Generative AI's basics, ready to dive into the exciting world of creative AI.
Minimum Entry Requirement: Nil

Course Title: WSQ Microsoft Excel – Intermediate & Advanced Level

Learners are able to summarise and present business insights developed from data studies with proper selection of methods to apply statistical techniques and machine learning within Excel Application

Learners are able to perform appropriate data analysis on distinct data sets after knowing the importance of the domain context in data science

Course Title: Access Control Management (Operate Basic Security Equipment)

• Demonstrate the ability to operate alarm monitoring equipment
• Demonstrate the ability to operate CCTV equipment
What You'll Learn: This course is targeted at the Security Inudstry Sector. Under the Progressive Wage Model (PWM) for Security, a licensing condition under the Police Licensing and Regulatory Department (PLRD), any security officer who seeks to progress to the position of Senior Security Officer (SSO) must complete both certificate courses, namely Access Control Management (Operate Basic Security Equipment) SEC-TEM-2001-1.1 and Deterrence (Manage Disorderly Conduct and Threatening Behaviour) SEC-ICM-1001-1.1. The intent of the course is to transfer knowledge and skills to security officers so that they can duly operate security equipment as part of their job function to safeguard the premise he or she is guarding.

Course Title: WSQ Google Ads
About This Course: The Google Ads course is designed to provide learners with the required knowledge and skills to create, manage, and optimise effective Google Ads campaigns to drive targeted traffic and achieve business objectives. The course covers an overview of the Google Ads platform, its features, and its benefits, including learning how to set up a Google Ads account, navigate the dashboard, identify high-impact keywords, and use them to create compelling ad copy that resonates with their target audience. Learners will also learn the different types of Google Ads campaigns, including Search, Display, and Shopping campaigns, how to create and manage each type of campaign, and best practices for optimising campaign performance.
What You'll Learn:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to create a structure of a Google Ads account that will achieve marketing objectives, including:
• setting up a Google Ads Search and Display advertising campaign from ground up 
• using search and display advertising bidding strategies and set appropriate daily budget and campaign schedules
• constructing successful ads that drive clicks and conversions
• conducting effective and extensive keyword research with Keyword Planner to target relevant audiences 
• setting up conversion tracking for measuring performance 
• utilising Performance Planner to gauge effectiveness of advertising spend and refine campaign settings as pre-campaign testing 
• analysing reports and optimise campaigns to maximise return on investment

- Inform appropriate person or supervisor if work activities cannot be carried out.

Course Title: Creating Holistic Dining Experiences (for tourist guides)
About This Course:
Singapore restaurants are responding to the pandemic by taking a more holistic approach and by hybridising both physical and virtual offerings in creating innovative and authentic dining experiences for their customers. Guides could play their part in value-adding to restaurants in this process. They have to familiarise themselves with the transformation taking place. 

The objective of the course is to enable guides to swiftly acquire skill differentiators in order to play an effective role in value-adding to restaurants and to help to uplift Singapore's image as a leading dining destination both for foreign and local tourists.
What You'll Learn:
The Food Service Industry Transformation Map was launched in 2016. F&B companies are differentiating themselves with innovative dining concepts, products and services, in order to offer customers better dining experiences. The pandemic has heightened the need to fast forward this transformation roadmap.
Upon completion of the course, tourist guides would have the necessary knowledge and skillsets to value add to restaurants in their efforts to create innovative and authentic dining experiences for both local and foreign tourists.
Minimum Entry Requirement: STB tourist guide license

Course Title: Oriental Wellness Tourism through The Lens of the West (for Tourist Guides) (Synchronous e-learning with Practical Training)
About This Course:
According to the Global Wellness Institute, Wellness is defined as ‘The active pursuit of activities, choices and lifestyles that lead to a state of holistic health. Not only is the global market size of wellness consumers increasing (estimated to be around US$4.4 trillion in 2020), there is also an increasing trend of these consumers indulging in wellness activities while they are on the move. There are great opportunities for tourist guides to incorporate wellness related activities and story-telling into their tours.
Upon completion of the course, tourist guides would have the necessary knowledge and skillsets to create holistic and authentic wellness experiences for tourists.
What You'll Learn:
The course content is as follows:

1. Part 1 will explain what wellness and wellness tourism are and how wellness tourism differs from medical tourism. It will also look into the growing Asia-Pacific market in wellness tourism which is today the biggest in the world.
2. Part 2 will look at how the west perceive oriental wellness. This will be useful in creating wellness activities in tours which will appeal to or fascinate western tourists. 
3. Part 3 will bring the participants through a research study that has been conducted recently to help them understand the competitive landscape in wellness tourism in Southeast Asian and how Singapore  could differentiate itself.
4. Part 4 will look into some basic principles of TCM and TIM (Ayuverda) that shape oriental wellness, as well as the relevant knowledge and skillsets in herbs, food and alternative therapies in oriental wellness context that participants should have in order to run wellness tours effectively and with confidence. 
5. Part 5 will bring the participants through a case study in wellness tourism.
6. Part 6 will look into how to market wellness centric tours.

References:
The Science and Art of Fengshui Course, Singapore Polytechnic
Skillsfuture Course on Accupressure and Meridian by Doctor Clement Ng
Global Wellness Institute Report
Survey Report on Western Perception of Oriental Wellness by Wine Resources
Complete Wellness by Susan Curtis
Strengthen Your Immune System, Reader's Digest
Minimum Entry Requirement: STB Tourist Guide License

Course Title: Data Center Design Awareness (DCDA) (synchronous e-learning)
About This Course:
1. Explain data center evolution by understanding technological advances and developments, today's challenges and relevant industry bodies aligned with current standards & regulations. 
2. Identify key stakeholders and design considerations in development of data center specifications. 
3. Identify data center best practices for facilities and operations according to design conditions, including data center structural specifications, resilience levels & architectural design considerations. 
4.Understand business needs analysis in accordance with operating parameters. 
5. Understand how Tier levels & infrastructure resiliency can influence uptime and energy efficiency.
6. Recognise best practice in terms of cooling system design and implementation and review air flow options and cooling technologies.
7. Review electrical design recommendations and availability criteria associated with existing and future power technologies.
8. Understand the emerging IT cabling technologies together with the current and proposed standards regarding connectivity. 
9. Identify how IT technology selection impacts the operational parameters and how ASHRAE recommendations will change the Data Center environment of the future. 
10. Understand the available types of life safety and fire protection systems. 
11. Discuss best security plans for physical and electronic security and surveillance. 
12. Define building automation protocols, integrated systems, measuring & monitoring, reporting systems in line with applicable industry standards.
13. Identify commissioning scope, project phases, commissioning plan and documentation, maintenance plans, codes and statutory regulations. 
14. Understand the various data center infrastructure that would need to be included in a facilities management plan. 
15. Develop a maintenance schedule. 
16. Implement a change management process model to monitor & measure IT, new technologies and business process changes.
What You'll Learn: The course is designed to highlight the complexities & interdependencies of the major items involved in the design, build & operation of a data center. All the main topics are covered with an emphasis on delivering a comprehensive overview of this very complicated topic and how the component parts fit together. In addition to the key design considerations, the course also gives a good understanding of the governing bodies & organisations that are behind the industry, and that are creating the standards & regulations which will drive the industry forward. From business justification through to commissioning & handover, the course will help the student to get a good understanding of the wide ranging topics which are involved in the data center build process. The core technology topics of power, cooling, cable connectivity & IT are all discussed at length, along with all the other important areas such as site selection, architectural recommendations & supporting infrastructure technology.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Minimum ITE diploma in Engineering or Minimum 2 years of work experience in the Data Center Industry. 
If entry requirements not met, complete Business of Data Centers course as a prerequisite, to get learners to the same baseline understanding, required for this Data Center Design Awareness (DCDA) course

Course Title: BCLS+AED PROVIDER CERTIFICATION (Asynchronous E-learning and Classroom)
About This Course: Upon completing this course, learners will have the knowledge and application skills to recognise critical signs of emergencies, activate emergency medical services, manage patients requiring emergency care, and provide immediate basic cardiac life support. Abilities in performing Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and skills in using Automated External Defibrillator (AED) in accordance with established first aid principles and procedures. Increase awareness of identifying casualties with cardiac arrest and optimize health and performance at the workplace.
What You'll Learn: BCLS (Basic Cardiac Life Support) + AED (Automated External Defibrillation) Course is Accredited by SRFAC (Singapore Resuscitation and First Aid Council). This course aims to equip learners with CPR skills and relief of foreign-body airway obstruction for adult, child, and infant casualties. The course will also teach learners how to use an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) on adult and child casualties. The quality of training also focuses on CPR High-Performance Training using the latest technology manikin that is connected to Tablet with real-time feedback and recording. Learners are also taught to use a manual resuscitator / Bag-Valve-Mask for rescue breathing training during CPR training.

Course Title: Supervise Work in Confined Space Operation

CE6: Assist in Implementing an Emergency Response Plan

protective equipment when working in a confined space

Course Title: Team Kanban Practitioner (TKP) Preparatory Course
About This Course:
Learn core concepts of the Kanban Method. Team members will learn how to be effective within a Kanban team. 
Understand core concepts of the Kanban Method. 
Learn the 3 Change Management Principles and the 6 General Practices of The Kanban Method.
Experience the benefit of WIP limits to improve flow. 
How to run the Kanban meetings to focus on the work and allow the team to organize around it How to proceed to the next level with Kanban.
What You'll Learn:
The BFSI industry can reap significant benefits from adopting the Kanban Method, which provides a strong framework for gradual yet impactful change, ultimately leading to improved visibility, communication, and collaboration within teams. With the BFSI industry becoming increasingly competitive, companies must prioritize agility and quick adaptation to remain competitive. The Kanban Method can effectively enable this by promoting evolutionary change that acknowledges current roles and responsibilities while also fostering leadership at all levels.
The Team Kanban Practitioner course is an excellent first step for fintech companies looking to implement the Kanban Method. The course is designed to help people across technical, non-technical, and leadership roles work together to optimize their value stream from end to end. By understanding the core concepts of Kanban and educating individual contributors to be “good Kanban citizens,” fintech teams can improve their efficiency and effectiveness in delivering products and services to their customers.

Real-life case studies and examples presented in the course can help fintech companies understand how the Kanban Method can be applied to their specific context. The course also emphasizes the importance of continuous improvement and encourages teams to experiment with the Kanban Method to find what works best for them.
 
In conclusion, the Kanban Method can be a valuable tool for fintech companies looking to improve their agility and adaptability in a rapidly changing market. The Team Kanban Practitioner course is an excellent starting point for fintech teams looking to implement the Kanban Method and can provide them with the knowledge and skills needed to become more effective and efficient in delivering value to their customers.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
All are welcome to attend the course, regardless of experience. However, the following prerequisites are highly recommended: 
Attend a Leading SAFe® course Experience working in a SAFe environment 
Experience with Lean, Agile, or other relevant certifications.

Course Title: SCEM Professional Level: WSQ Energy Management and Economics (Classroom and Asynchronous)
About This Course:
Developing a demand management plan and knowing about the energy management system are important for energy efficiency investments. As energy managers, learners need to know the methodology, benchmarks, and audit procedures needed to set up an efficient energy management system. In this way, they will know what can or cannot be done as they perform their analysis and calculations for energy efficiency investment. 

Learners will then be able to develop demand management plans by conducting pre-audits checks on-site and developing demand management or integrated energy solution proposals for their organisation or clients of their organisation. 

In this course, learners will learn how they can
- Develop an energy management system 
- Conduct economic analysis and calculate potential savings based on prevailing market prices and usage
- Design demand management plans based on energy demand and market prices
What You'll Learn:
Engineering  professionals  who  intend  to  build  their  careers  as  energy  managers  need  to  understand principles  related  to  the  management  and  economics  of  energy.  This  module  covers  the  setting  up  of energy  management  systems  (including  an  introduction  to  ISO  50001),  the  formation  of  the  energy management  team  and  the  integration  of  energy  management  systems  into  business  practice.  Also covered  are  Singapore’s  energy  management  policies  and  energy  market  tariff  structure  to  enable better  evaluation  of  supply  contracts  for  reducing  energy  costs.  

Participants  will  also  learn  how  to evaluate  financial  attractiveness  of  energy  retrofit  projects  using  simple  payback,  ROI,  time  value  of money,  etc  and  understand  the  various  energy  performance  contracting  models  such  as  guaranteed savings  and  shared  savings.  Candidates  taking  the  EME  paper  are  to  be  familiar  with: 

1.  Energy  Conservation  Act  2012;  Energy  Conservation  (Energy  Management  Practices) Regulations  2013;  revised  31st May  2014 
2.  SS/ISO  50001  Energy  Management  Systems  –  Requirements  with  guidance  for  use 
3.  Energy  Market  Authority  –  Electricity  Policies  and  Regulations
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners are assumed to be:
• Knowledgeable of electrical engineering competencies
• Able to listen and speak English at a proficiency level equivalent to the Employability Skills System (ESS) level 4
• Able to read and write English at a proficiency level equivalent to ESS level 4 
• Able to process numbers at a proficiency level equivalent to ESS level 4
• Possess at least 1 year working experience in engineering-related jobs
• Possess knowledge of interpreting process diagrams and computer literate

The TP shall assess the suitability of learners by requesting for their CVs.

Learners keen to join without the necessary pre-requisite knowledge and experience stated above may be assessed if they have other relevant experience to access the course, on a case-by-case basis.

Course Title: WSQ Manage Work At Height
About This Course:
A competent employee with “Manage Work At Height” is a Competency Unit aiming to
• To equip all personnel with the relevant WSH competencies to work in the construction related industries;
• To reduce the gestation period before the worker can start working by harmonising the regulatory requirements with the industry endorsed WSQ training; and
• To provide clear progression pathway and address the necessary skills required to move up to the next level of responsibility
What You'll Learn:
The Generic Manufacturing Skills (GMS) WSQ framework aims to raise the professionalism of the workforce. This Competency Unit aims to equip the knowledge and skills in planning, supervising, assessing and managing of work at height.
“Manage Work At Height” is a Competency Unit under the GMS WSQ Framework. The Performance Statements covered are:
1. Identify, explain and apply the relevant Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) legislation/Approved Code of Practice/Singapore Standards applicable to work at height
2. Identify and explain the Roles & Responsibilities of stakeholders, competent and responsible persons.
3. Identify hazards, evaluate the risk, and implement control measures for work at height
4. Review the necessary fall preventive / protective control measures for safe execution of work at height
5. Establish, evaluate, review and implement a Fall Prevention Plan
6. Establish and implement a system for an effective monitoring and control of WAH risks
7. Don, check and correct Individual Fall Protection Equipment and respond to a fall emergency
Minimum Entry Requirement:
Learners must be above 21 years of age and are assumed to: 
• Have at least WSQ ESS Workplace Literacy and Numeracy Level 4
• Above or equivalent and the ability to carry out hazard identification, risk assessment, and risk control measures.

7. Plan a structured induction for mentees and a training programme for interns.
8. Demonstrate how to support interns’ and student teachers’ well-being as they ease into the Beginning Teacher phase
Minimum Entry Requirement:

Course Title: National EV Specialist Safety (NESS) Certification Course
About This Course:
The course covers the introduction of Electric Vehicle (EV) evolution and EV role as part of Singapore Eco-system in its push towards sustainability.

It also covers risk and hazard identification as well as mitigation measures to allow for handling high voltage vehicles in a safe working environment.

It familiarises participants with the EV battery characteristics and awareness of the charging process. It will further cover the architecture design of the HV system and components and equip knowledge on performing diagnosis, troubleshooting and basic maintenance of these systems.
What You'll Learn:
Under the Singapore Green Plan 2030, LTA has a comprehensive Electric Vehicle (EV) Roadmap to drive EV adoption.  LTA has set a target of 60,000 EV charging points by 2030 and phase out Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) vehicles by 2040.

While the industry is moving towards sustainable energy, i.e. hybrid and electric vehicle, there is a need to upgrade the skill level of techni-cians to meet this new demand.  The potential safety concerns of handling the maintenance and repair of high voltage vehicles calls for the need to ensure that technicians are equipped with the competencies of National EV Specialist Safety (NESS) standards.  

Based on the market study from the Singapore Motor Workshop Association (SMWA), there are generally about 10,000 automotive techni-cians in Singapore (Local & Foreign).  However, there are only less than a handful of institutions currently in Singapore providing some form of high voltage vehicle training programs. 

Hence, ComfortDelGro Engineering (CDGE) formed a partnership with TUV SUD to roll out an EV training program for the automotive engi-neering industry.  TUV SUD would provide course curriculum for the EV training program while  CDGE would conduct the program in its training academy in Loyang for internal employees as well as external participants.  This collaboration aims to upskill Automotive Technicians from ICE technology to Qualified Technicians in safe handling of high voltage vehicles through a national-level certification programme. 

This course is suitable for technicians, service advisors, workshop managers and engineers from the automotive engineering industry, as well as personnel and enthusiasts from vehicle sales, insurance, surveyor and inspection companies.

The modules are mapped to NESS TSCs:
1. Electric Vehicle Safety Management & Awareness
2. Electric Vehicle Battery Management
3. Electric Vehicle Charging Mechanism
4. Electric Vehicle Diagnostics & Maintenance
Minimum Entry Requirement: Applicants should preferably have Nitec or equivalent in Automotive or Electrical Technology with 2 years related working experience; or a Diploma with 1 year related working experience.

Course Title: Certified Artificial Intelligence Governance Professional (AIGP)
About This Course:
At the end of the 3-day course, participants will be able to:
• Define artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning; understand overview of the different types of AI systems and their use cases; and position AI models in the broader socio-cultural context
• Understand the core risks and harms posed by AI systems, the characteristics of trustworthy AI systems, and the characteristics and principles essential to responsible and  ethical AI
• Understand the existing laws that govern the use of AI, outline key General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) intersections and provide awareness of liability reform
• Identify and describe global AI-specific laws and the major frameworks and standards that exemplify how AI systems can be responsibly governed
• Describe the AI development life cycle and the broad context in which AI risks are managed
• Explain how major AI stakeholders collaborate in a layered approach to manage AI risks while recognising the potential benefits AI systems have for society
• Be able to map, plan and scope the AI project, testing and validating the AI system during development, and managing and monitoring AI systems after deployment
• Understand current discussions and ideas about AI governance, including awareness of legal issues, user concerns, and AI auditing and accountability issues
What You'll Learn:
The rapid rise of generative artificial intelligence has focused our collective attention on the promise and peril of an artificial intelligence-fueled society. With equal excitement and trepidation, we find ourselves asking how to build a future augmented by the potential benefits of artificial intelligence (AI), while avoiding its pitfalls.

Every day we hear more about the potential of AI-powered systems that will transform how we work, create, solve problems, communicate, and even diagnose and treat illness. The possibilities of advanced AI seem unlimited. But without proper testing, evaluation, validation, and verification at each stage of AI development, foundational AI models could perpetuate biases and amplify other societal challenges that will cascade through later systems and remain for decades. We must continue to build and refine the governance processes through which trustworthy AI will emerge and we must invest in the people who will build ethical and responsible AI. Those who work in compliance, risk management, legal and governance together with data scientists, AI project managers, model operations teams and others must be prepared to tackle the expanded equities at issue in AI governance.

To meet this demand, the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) has developed the Artificial Intelligence Governance Professional (AIGP) certification and training for the emerging AI governance profession. An AIGP trained and certified professional will know how to implement and effectively communicate across teams the emerging best practices and rules for responsible management of the AI ecosystem. We are privileged to grow a community of credentialed AI governance professionals, through which resources and expanding knowledge can be brought together in one place.
Minimum Entry Requirement:
• Participants should have some understanding of data protection law
• Tertiary qualifications and/or with at least 2 years of work experience

Course Title: The Guide's Role and Skill Set in Wine Hospitality (for Licensed Tourist Guides only)
About This Course: In experience-driven tourism, wine hospitality plays a crucial role in elevating the overall gastronomic journey for tourists. The primary objective of this Professional Development Course (PDC) is to equip tourist guides (TGs) with the relevant wine knowledge to empower them to assist guests in choosing wines that align with their preferences and can complement well with signature local, Asian, and Western cuisines. Additionally, the course imparts the essential skill set to TGs, ensuring that the restaurant delivers impeccable wine services, thereby enhancing the overall dining experience for their guests.
What You'll Learn:
1. Basic understanding of wine
TGs will receive an introduction to the alcohol family. The training will cover the categorization of wines into still, sparkling, and fortified types, emphasizing on the characteristics of various white and red wine styles. Participants will also gain the ability to interpret diverse requests for wine preferences, enabling them to work with restaurants to serve guests from various backgrounds.
2. Wine Selection & Recommendation
TGs will be taught the skill of identifying wines by interpreting wine labels. This proficiency will empower them to effectively choose, recommend, and present the appropriate bottles from the available wine lists.
3. Wine Services
This section will address crucial aspects of wine service, including serving temperature, selection of wine glasses, serving sequence, and decanting procedures. TGs will also learn about common wine faults. Additionally, it is essential for TGs to acquaint themselves with advanced wine service by high-end restaurants, such as the 'wine approval' and 'wine decanting' rituals.
4. Wine & Food Pairing
TGs will be taught the principles of wine and food pairing by exploring the five dimensions of Appearance, Flavour, Texture, Weight, and Taste. Through this training, they will acquire the expertise to offer recommendations to restaurant chefs, facilitating the creation of food flavours that complement the selected wines.
5. Practical Training
a. An interesting super-taster test to show their sensitivity to taste. This test is useful to allow them to stay objective in style recommendations.
b. Blind tasting in specially designed black glasses to truly understand wine styles.
c. Evaluation of different wine styles to enable them to interpret wine labels.
d. Pairing of wine with different types of food such as: Signature Hawker Food, Asian Food, and Western food
Minimum Entry Requirement: STB tourist guide license

Job Title: Software Developer, Senior Manager, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
We act as architects of digital change, helping our clients create innovative and effective solutions. Our teams are always client-focused and multi-disciplinary with a focus on digital problem solving. This is an exceptionally diverse role where you have the chance to make a real contribution to our business.
The opportunity
We are hiring developers to join us. We are most interested in individuals who wish to work across both account management and producers’ roles.
Your Key Responsibilities
Develop and support solutions and code for various projects
Contribute to the delivery of Service Level Agreement obligations
Ensure that client’s website is updated and functioning
Responsible to test and validate work produced and be able to highlight risk before delivery
Responsible for technical change and release management activities which includes environment deployment and rollback
Investigate, analyze and resolve issues which impact client’s websites
Make recommendations on right-sizing, security, availability and performance
Responsible for technical documentation and services to local and international clients
Responsible for responding and resolving application and infrastructure issues within SLA
Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and performance requirements.
Skills and attributes for success
Knowledge of web technologies and content management systems
Attentive to details and willingness to learn
Organized and meticulous
Customer-oriented and ability to work within team effectively
To qualify for the role you must have
Bachelor’s Degree in any of these IT related disciplines: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
At least 10 years of working experience as a developer
Knowledge of or Experience in .Net Frameworks / C# / ASP.NET / MVC
Experience in web and networking concepts
Knowledge of Javacript/JQuery
Excellent communication skills, with a flair of reaching out to people of all levels
Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in CMS development with Sitecore/Sitefinity/Kentico or related
Understanding of CI/CD activities
Experience in cloud hosting and architecture
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Job Title: Data Engineer, Senior Manager, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity:
EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
We implement information-driven strategies, data platforms and advanced data analytics solution systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end design, build and implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.
We are looking for a Data Engineer within the DnA team in our Singapore office. This role is offered on a flexible full time basis.
Your key responsibilities:

Develop and implement techniques and analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful
information using dataoriented programming languages and visualisation software.
Visualise, interpret, and report data findings and may create dynamic data reports as well
Design, develop, and maintain the organization's data architecture, including data pipelines, databases, and data warehouses.
Develop and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently move data from various sources to the data
Implement data quality checks and monitoring processes to identify and resolve data issues in a timely manner.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.
Skills and attributes for success
Experience in ETL, Data Engineering, Scripting.
Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects
Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills and stakeholder management experiences
Experience in business intelligence, data warehousing/platform, and data strategy projects
To qualify for the role, you must have
At least a Bachelor's degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science/Information Technology/Programming & Systems Analysis/Science (Computer Studies)
Minimum total 3 years work experience in at least 1 of these job titles: (1) Chief Data Scientist (2) Data Engineer (3) Data Scientist (4) Head of Data Analytics
At least 10 years of experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 is highly advantageous
Experience in development and maintenance of Data processing pipelines
Experience developing machine learning workflows
Work closely with business analysts to create data components
Application packaging and deployment experience across DEV to PROD environments
Experienced in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Dashboarding experience with Tableau / Power BI
Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry.
An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
EY offers a competitive remuneration package commensurate with your work experience where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements, where this may be needed, guided by our FWA Policy.
Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliver best-in-class transaction banking products to meet clients and business needs globally. This role manages the product development for our Cash Management Product Platforms and also looks into ongoing enhancements and development of the platform.
In this role the individual acts as Product Owner, responsible for leading an agile squad to deliver solutions to meet our changing business and client requirements, aligned with product vision and roadmap in partnership with Global, Regional & Local Product Managers, Global Service & Client Implementation Teams, Global Technology and Operations.
Lead the agile team as Product Owner to deliver the product build roadmap to support the business growth and strategy for Payments and TBFX.
Responsible for developing Business Requirements:
Work with our Product, Service & Client Implementation and Operations teams to document business requirements for new products and platforms or for enhancements to existing products and processes.
Work with Business Analysts to interpret business requirements for technical teams and assist them in requirements understanding and finalise on User Stories. Translate technical alternatives and solution plans to business teams and assist business teams in understanding the impact.
Develop product delivery roadmap; align with product/ sales commercialisation strategy.
Responsible for quality delivery of Product projects as per agreed scope, budget & timelines
Gain in-depth understanding of business processes to articulate use-cases/user-stories for identifying features/capabilities for the identified platforms.
Review and signoff on the user-stories prepared by Business Analysts teams
Defining operating model and client implementation procedures in conjunction with Operations, Client Implementation teams, Client Service Group and Technology partners
Monitoring the implementation of the end-to-end delivery of product projects & milestones
Managing User Acceptance Test and Production Verification runs.
Perform executive program reporting; develop program work plan
Responsible for successful platform rollouts to countries
Ensuring successful product implementation post technical implementation
Ensuring adequate training and knowledge transfer to in-country users
Support pilot client implementation
Plan and manage client migration
Responsible for annual platform review
Managing the annual platform and related channel partner upgrade projects
Continuous process improvement to update platforms to improve operations flexibility and business relevance
Forward planning for pipeline initiatives
Stakeholder Management:
Maintain regular connect and engagement with key stakeholders periodically to refine backlog; lead the team to work towards optimising the product value based on continuous feedback.
Our Ideal Candidate
Degree in Business or equivalent disciplines. Degree in Information Technology is an advantage.
Prior experience on Payments Product is a plus.
Working knowledge of ISOXML 20022 formats for Cash Management
Good understanding of API and how these are used in the Banking sector
Lead the agile team as Product Owner to deliver the product build roadmap to support the business growth and strategy for Payments and TBFX
Strong Product management, Project management, and analytical problem-solving skills and use of relevant tools
Solid product management experience in implementing medium-large scale product enablers and platforms in the transaction banking area and across multiple countries.
Good knowledge of global cash management practices
Ability to work to tight timelines and at the same time produces a quality deliverable.
Ability to engage stakeholders within business, operations and technology.
Excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills.
15+ years of banking experience

Payments

Job Title: Director & Relationship Manager, International Corporates, CIB Client Coverage
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
To achieve financial and non-financial targets by acquiring, growing and retaining profitable CCIB customers within acceptable risk parameters
Contribute toward achieving the team and segments overall target and delivering optimal portfolio return.
Collaborate and build effective partnerships with other relationship managers and segment heads, as well as colleagues in CDD teams and partners in risk, compliance, other support functions, and product
Responsibilities
Business
Achieve agreed upon individual financial and non-financial targets while contributing towards team’s overall deliverables through:
Effectively generating new business – identify prospects and convert in line with the Bank’s appetite
Strategically formulating account plan – provide clients need-based solutions, structure appropriate credit facility, and execute various banking transactions
Proactively building trusted client relationships – maintain a portfolio of active and growing customers
Market and sell broad range of products including trade service, cash management, treasury and corporate finance
Support the credit analysis team with credit and facility applications for clients while ensuring annual review on a timely basis
Work closely with the credit team to ensure good quality lending decisions are made; to ensure the strict adherence to the prevailing EAR / credit policy
Implement agreed upon business plan to achieve sales/ revenue targets
Generate creative ideas for customer acquisition and products/ services
Regularly provide market and client feedback to the team and peers on new and anticipated financial and service needs and recommend appropriate improvements to processes on new products
Maintain a high level of professionalism in client engagement, internal stakeholder management and other business conduct
If the portfolio has a sub-credit /EA account then actively managing account to maximise recoveries and minimise losses for the bank for the accounts.
Processes
Drive continuous improvement of the operational efficiency and effectiveness of processes to increase the consistency of systems and processes.
Support the framework for effective management of operational risks across the Business and compliance with applicable internal policies, and external laws and regulations at a global level.
Support the execution of Business strategy in a safe and well-controlled manner and on an end-to-end basis – incorporating infrastructure requirements and ensuring that they are fit-for-growth.
Ensure CDD profiles are error free for timely sign off
Follow and comply with AML CDD policies and procedures where applicable
Identify KYC issues, provide solution or escalate to line manager if necessary
Ensure internal / external KYC requirements are adhered to AML CDD policies and procedures
Timely handling of customer issues, complaints, and product enquiries in accordance with established procedures
People and Talent
Embed the Group’s values and culture with the team and beyond
Coach peers and other staff wherever appropriate and needed
Partner effectively with internal stakeholders to deliver effective client solutions
Governance
Ensure relevant systems and controls pertaining to the role remit are in compliance with Group and Business policies, procedures, standards and codes, including those governing all Risk types, Compliance, Operational Risk, Technology and Operations, Finance and Reputation
Ensure adherence with the following Regulatory Compliance policies and processes (as is applicable):
Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and all applicable money laundering prevention procedures
Client Due Diligence & Related Periodic Reviews
Client Suitability Standards
Treating Customers Fairly
Approval & review of Credit Applications
Maintain Documentary standards
Data Confidentiality
Cross-Border Policy
Sanctions
Environmental and Social Risk Management (ESRM)
Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC)
Embed the Group’s values and code of conduct to ensure that adherence with the highest standards of ethics, and compliance with relevant policies, processes and regulations among employees form part of the culture
Engage with all audit report findings and ensure feedback is acted upon
Risk Management
Abide by appropriate frameworks to guarantee that business is carried out within the Group’s risk appetite and relevant risks are appropriately managed in conjunction with line managers other stakeholders.
Ensure compliance with the highest standards of regulatory conduct and compliance standards and practices as defined by internal and external requirements. This includes compliance with regulations and guidelines on Sanctions, Anti-Money Laundering (AML), and Environmental and Social Risk Management (ESRM).
Abide by the Group’s values and code of conduct and foster a robust culture to ensure that adherence with the highest standards of ethics, and compliance with relevant policies, processes and regulations among employees.
Ensure that Risk Management matters that are brought to the job holder’s attention are subject to direct remedial action and/or ensure adequate reporting to the relevant superiors and/or Risk Committees.
Do what is right in order to avoid reputational risks and operational losses
Regulatory & Business Conduct *
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Lead the Business to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Operation of Financial Markets; Financial Crime Prevention; The Right Environment.*
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Other Responsibilities
Embed Here for good and the Group’s brand and values
Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures
Work effectively across SCB, using values behaviours to drive overall business growth
Key Stakeholders
Internal:
Colleagues in CIB and CM teams, Product, Risk, Compliance and other support Functions and Businesses
External:
Clients
Our Ideal candidate
· Bachelor degree in Banking, Economics, Finance or Accounting preferred.
· 10 years experience in banking with local Singapore corporates

Business Acumen
Risk Management
Client Relationship Management
Managing Changes
Planning: Tactical, Strategic
Financial Analysis
