Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too.
We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills and enhance performance. You will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
The Opportunity
As a Cloud Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud solutions that align with our business objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the scalability, security, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure. Your primary responsibilities will include:
Responsibilities
Design and architect cloud solutions based on business requirements, ensuring scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
Automate cloud operations, develop infrastructure automation scripts and participates in the continuous improvement of cloud solutions.
Participate in the specification, setup and run Proof of Concepts and demonstrations of cloud solutions
Administer and maintain servers across virtual platforms.
Plan and execute the migration of on-premises applications and workloads to cloud environments, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies.
Maintain detailed documentation of cloud architectures, configurations, and procedures.
What we look for
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
Qualifications:
At least a bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, programming & systems analysis, Science (Computer Studies) or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience in designing, implementing, and managing cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Strong understanding of cloud architecture principles, including IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools and automation.
Knowledge of security best practices and cloud security services.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect) are a plus.A Degree in one of the following: Accountancy, Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Information Technology or equivalent
At least 6 years of experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 or boutique consulting firm is highly desirable
Experienced in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Statutory and Regulatory Compliance
Ensures compliance with the Companies Act, Singapore Exchange (SGX) Listing Rules, and other applicable laws and regulations.
Maintains statutory registers, including registers of members, directors, and substantial shareholders.
Oversees the preparation and timely submission of SGX announcements, annual returns, and other regulatory filings.
Corporate Governance
Advises the Board of Directors on corporate governance best practices and SGX requirements.
Ensures adherence to the Code of Corporate Governance and other governance standards.
Facilitates the onboarding and training of directors to enhance governance awareness.
Board and Committee Support
Organizes, schedules, and attends board meetings, committee meetings, and general meetings.
Drafts, reviews, and distributes meeting agendas, minutes, and resolutions.
Coordinates the timely execution of board decisions and ensure proper documentation.
Shareholder Engagement
Manages the organization of Annual General Meetings (AGMs) and Extraordinary General Meetings (EGMs).
Prepares and distributes notices, circulars, and annual reports to shareholders.
Addresses shareholder queries and ensure effective communication channels.
Regulatory Liaison
Acts as the key point of contact with regulators, including SGX, ACRA, and other relevant authorities.
Monitors changes in regulatory requirements and ensure company compliance.
Documentation and Records Management
Maintains accurate records of board and shareholder decisions.
Ensures safekeeping and proper maintenance of statutory documents and company records.
Corporate Transactions
Supports the company in corporate exercises such as mergers, acquisitions, fundraising, and restructuring.
Ensures timely and accurate disclosures to SGX and other stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Law / Business Administration or equivalent
Professional qualification in Corporate Governance (e.g. Chartered Secretary from ICSA)
Minimum 8 years’ experience as Company Secretary in a listed company
Strong familiarity with SGX Listing Rules, Companies Act, and Code of Corporate Governance.
Exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills for engaging with board members, regulators, and shareholders.
Detail-oriented with the ability to handle complex regulatory requirements.
Proficiency in corporate secretarial software and MS Office Suite.
Our Address and Working Hours:
Seatrium Pioneer Yard
50 Gul Road, Singapore 629353
(Islandwide transport provided)
Mon - Thu: 8am - 5:15pm, Fri: 8am to 4:30pm

Job Title: Lead Client Solutions Manager, LinkedIn Marketing Solutions
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Description
LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description
The vision of LinkedIn’s Marketing Solutions (LMS) business is to create economic growth for every organization worldwide by helping marketers reach, engage and convert their audiences at scale.

Through sponsored content in the feed (video, lead-generation forms, connected TV, carousel ads), personalized messages to your LinkedIn inbox (InMail), LinkedIn Events/Live and many other innovative formats, LinkedIn is transforming B2B (Business 2 Business) and high-consideration B2C (Business 2 Customer) marketing.

As a Client Solutions Manager, you will nurture client relationships while executing against their objectives as a trusted advisor. Working closely with your Account Director and cross-functional teams, you'll drive customer growth in South Southeast Asia by identifying trends, offering in-depth data-driven consultation, and enhancing advertising effectiveness. With your extensive digital sales experience, you'll serve as a proactive consultant, fostering deep relationships with clients and agencies. You will need to be hands-on with campaign execution while also strategically engaging in client planning and budgeting to deliver ROI and drive long-term marketing objectives, accelerating client revenue growth.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

Build strong client relationships through best-in-class customer experience, leveraging communication, relationship-building skills, and analytical abilities to provide consultative solutions.
Reach and exceed sales quotas while contributing to overall team goals.
Understand annual business and marketing objectives of the client and translate them into marketing outcomes with specific metrics/KPIs
Develop a deep understanding of clients' marketing campaigns to make creative and data driven recommendations for utilizing the LinkedIn platform and proving ROI through campaign insights.
Create and manage a tiered service approach for clients to drive growth.
Proactively analyze and optimize customers' advertising campaigns and marketing programs, making strategic and tactical recommendations.
Consult on all aspects of clients' media campaigns, including targeting, implementation, optimization, and reporting
Articulate and communicate new product features proactively.
Identify upsell or cross-sell opportunities across the client base to drive incremental revenue.
Advise on creative and content quality and development, leveraging marketing expertise for performance maximization.
Support customers with communication, onboarding, and education needs.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional partners in product, product marketing, insights, content marketing, technical support, and others to ensure customer success.
Establish trusted executive-level relationships with the C-Suite and other Senior client leaders based on an ability to provide LinkedIn and industry insights
Own renewal and always-on conversations with client
Basic Qualifications
8+ years of experience in client-facing role, agency, advertising sales, marketing or media
6+ years of auction based or programmatic campaign management and optimization experience (i.e. Google Adwords, SEO/PPC, ad exchange/trading desks)
Demonstrated understanding of digital media, internet advertising technology and marketing automation landscape
Demonstrated success in excelling within a target-driven environment, adept at managing CRM for the sales process
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to drive results and build relationships across multiple client levels.
Experience managing and prioritizing large portfolios of customer advertising budgets and campaigns.
Demonstrated ability to negotiate and close deals through consultative selling.
Experience of using insights to drive commercial success through upsells and pitches
Ability to translate analytics and present them as insights and recommendations in a client facing setting.
Ability to conduct regular forecasts and reports
Ability to think strategically with a proven track record of achieving results by connecting a customer’s pressures with data-driven products and solutions.
Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize tasks and work within deadlines with little supervision. Ability to work independently and collaborate cross-functionally
Strong executive engagement and stakeholder management skills
Demonstrated commitment to understanding and prioritizing the needs of the customer
Suggested Skills
Media Sales
Campaign Measurement and Analytics
Strategic Planning
Negotiation
Client Relationship Management

Job Title: Enterprise Product - Senior Risk & Pricing Platform Product Specialist - Singapore
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Multiple solutions. One system. Bloomberg’s Multi-Asset Risk System (MARS) is a comprehensive suite of risk management tools that delivers consistent, consolidated results across client’s entire firm. Powered by Bloomberg’s world-class pricing library, market data and mortgage cash flow engine, MARS enables front office, risk and collateral professionals to analyse their trading and investment portfolios, manage and mitigate their exposure and ready themselves for any turn of events.

The Team and the role?

The Enterprise Product Platform and Risk Specialist team is responsible for supporting Bloomberg's Enterprise Product Platform and MARS Solutions, including areas such as Front Office, Market Risk, XVA, and SIMM. We are looking to hire an individual contributor in the Asia team to join our exciting and fast growing team. In this role, you will work closely with the sales team to deliver product demos, perform testing and reconciliation, manage the product needs of our production clients, and participate in risk and cross-product projects designed to enhance and expand our risk solutions and the overall enterprise product platform for both buy-side and sell-side clients.

The ideal candidate will have strong modelling, data analysis, project management, and communication skills. A deep understanding of market risk is crucial, as is the ability to explain complex analytics and recommend best practices.

We’ll trust you to:
Be responsible for our client’s experience on the MARS Risk platform & cross-product solutions
Conduct in depth product discussions with key clients, ensuring product offerings meet client needs
Documenting and communicating product enhancements to both internal and external stakeholders
Manage delivering committed product enhancements on time
Training clients on use of the system and/or MARS API Schema
Acting as point of escalation from support and implementation teams for client questions and issues, and, when necessary, coordinating internally to get them addressed
Work on risk related projects and initiatives
Providing feedback to colleagues on client needs, competitor intelligence and market trends
You’ll need to have:
8+ years of experience working in financial technology, financial markets or financial consulting organizations
Demonstrated experience in quantitative finance, financial engineering or risk management roles
Demonstrated experience in developing and managing client relationships, within the past 3 years
A bachelor's degree or higher degree-equivalent qualifications in relevant Finance Engineering, Quantitative Finance or related field
Ability to work under pressure with multiple internal and external stakeholders and often under tight timeline
Extensive experience in the multi-asset class market risk space
Strong project management skills, including the ability to work across multiple teams and reporting lines
Passion for technology and demonstrated experience with Python and/or other programming languages
High level of energy, creativity, flexibility and dedication. A willingness to focus and commit to finding the best solution for our clients
Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization
Excellent written and verbal communication skill in English
We'd love to see:
Professional working proficiency of an Asian language
Prior working experience with the Bloomberg suite of products
Work experience in Python or other programming languages
If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Why Bloomberg?

We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
We act as architects of digital change, helping our clients create innovative and effective solutions. Our teams are always client-focused and multi-disciplinary with a focus on digital problem solving. This is an exceptionally diverse role where you have the chance to make a real contribution to our business.
The opportunity
We are hiring developers to join us. We are most interested in individuals who wish to work across both account management and producers’ roles.
Your Key Responsibilities
Develop and support solutions and code for various projects
Contribute to the delivery of Service Level Agreement obligations
Ensure that client’s website is updated and functioning
Responsible to test and validate work produced and be able to highlight risk before delivery
Responsible for technical change and release management activities which includes environment deployment and rollback
Investigate, analyze and resolve issues which impact client’s websites
Make recommendations on right-sizing, security, availability and performance
Responsible for technical documentation and services to local and international clients
Responsible for responding and resolving application and infrastructure issues within SLA
Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and performance requirements.
Skills and attributes for success
Knowledge of web technologies and content management systems
Attentive to details and willingness to learn
Organized and meticulous
Customer-oriented and ability to work within team effectively
To qualify for the role you must have
Bachelor’s Degree in any of these IT related disciplines: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
At least 5 years of working experience as a developer
Knowledge of or Experience in .Net Frameworks / C# / ASP.NET / MVC
Experience in web and networking concepts
Knowledge of Javacript/JQuery
Excellent communication skills, with a flair of reaching out to people of all levels
Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in CMS development with Sitecore/Sitefinity/Kentico or related
Understanding of CI/CD activities
Experience in cloud hosting and architecture
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Job Title: Software and Applications, Manager, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too.
We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills and enhance performance. You will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

The Opportunity
You will apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services, you’ll focus on client opportunities where your expertise can make a substantial impact, and motivate your team. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues.

We are looking for a dynamic Software/Application Manager who is capable of overseeing software development projects while also taking charge of the testing process. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the entire software development lifecycle, from planning and design to deployment and maintenance, while also leading the testing efforts to ensure the delivery of high-quality software applications.

Key Responsibilities:
Software/Application Management:
Lead the software/application development team, including developers and other relevant personnel.
Plan, design, and oversee the entire software development lifecycle, from concept to deployment and maintenance.
Collaborate with project stakeholders, including project managers and business analysts, to define project requirements and timelines.
Ensure software/application projects adhere to established coding standards, best practices, and quality benchmarks.
Manage software/application release schedules and coordinate deployments.
Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends to guide technical decisions.
Oversee the acquisition and development of software systems in organisational units
Monitor results and quality of different software solutions and projects impletemented
Oversee the development of Proof-of-Concept/ solutions and provide technical expertise on the development of software and platform features, ensuring that appropriate security and risk factors are considered.
Testing Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts.
Execute manual and automated tests to identify defects and issues in software applications.
Create and maintain test documentation and provide regular reports on test progress and results.
Ensure that testing is carried out in a structured and organized manner, adhering to established testing standards and best practices.
Identify and report defects, track their resolution, and verify fixes.
Continuously improve the testing process by incorporating industry best practices and tools.
What we look for
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
Qualifications:
At least a Bachelor's degree in any of these faculties - Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis or equivalent
At least 6 years of experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 or boutique consulting firm is highly desirable
Experience in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Job Title: Equity and Structured Products DACS Dealer
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
This headcount is part of the CMPS (Capital Markets Products and Sales) Team focusing on offering Direct Access service (DACS) to Private Banking clients.
DACs team offer a bespoke Equity (EQ) and EQ structured products trading service to sophisticated private banking clients who are active in the asset class.
Responsible for driving DACS revenue, providing proactive advisory directly to clients including idea generation, margin & risk management and execution support.
Work closely with Private Bank Front Office in new DACS clients prospecting.
Providing support to team in overall Structured Products (SP) business.
Ensuring compliance with all internal and regulatory requirements.
Maintaining good relationship and to work closely with internal and external stakeholders including the front, middle and back offices.
Providing support to ad hoc projects in relation to specific aspects of desk activities.
Key Responsibilities
Business
Achieve yearly team equity & structured products target with awareness of risk and control
Processes
Ensure awareness of execution processes and deliver quality execution service. Ability to identify and suggest ways of enhancements to existing processes.
Risk Management
To proactively manage risk for both bank and clients
Governance
Awareness of overall business governance
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Our Ideal Candidate
Degree(s) in relevant subjects such as Business, Economics and Finance related preferred.
5 plus years of Equity and Structured Product margin trading experience.
Experience in Equity and Structured Product margin trading, with experience in direct handling of private banking clients preferred.
Proficiency in mandarin is preferred, as the role will require regular interaction with Chinese clients.
Ability to work with a high level of attention to details to ensure quality trade execution.
Required to perform holiday duties & early shifts.
Ability to work under a fast paced environment.
Good in internal and external stakeholders management.
Strong work ethic with high level of self-motivation and initiative.
RNF and CACS holder is required.
CMFAS Qualifications is required - Paper 1A or 1B, 5, 6, 6A, 8, 8A (or RES12B, RES5, CM-EIP, CM-SIP, M8, M8A) as well as CACS 1, CACS 2 and FMRP.
Basic analytical and technical skills that can be practically applied to day-to-day operations.
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Analytical Thinking
Market Knowledge
Products and Processes
Understand EQ as an asset class.
Understand the how-to in cash equities and structured product trading.

Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SUMMARY
We are seeking an experienced and strategic product management leader to drive the growth and innovation of our FI Clearing product suite globally. The role will sit at group with active involvement across USD, EUR, GBP, RMB as well as a large number of other locations with FI clearing solutions.
This role encompasses core product management responsibilities, commercialisation strategies, leveraging data for insights, standardisation efforts, and the enhancement of our Asian Clearing proposition. The role initially involves leading a small team with extensive collaboration with group-level and in-country product managers.
The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in cross-border payments, correspondent banking needs, payment clearing systems and bank/on-behalf-of payment flows and solutions. You will have a strategic and solution-orientated mindset, being client-led, risk aware. You will also have a proven track record of leading product managers, delivering innovative FI relevant capabilities and driving commercial success.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategy
Position SCB’s capabilities and reputation within the FI clearing business.
Lead the end-to-end management and lifecycle of FI clearing products, with a specific focus on Banks and Affiliates. This will include enhancements of existing capabilities and new initiatives.
Define and execute the product roadmap in alignment with the global payment strategy, FI clearing growth agenda and evolving client needs. Prioritise based on commercial opportunity, market intelligence, client feedback and competitive analysis.
Drive revenue growth by developing robust commercialisation strategies, including product performance tracking, pricing models, value propositions, standardisation opportunities and go-to-market plans.
Lead initiatives to modernise the FI clearing product suite, leveraging emerging technologies (e.g. API, ISO20022, real-time cross border) to improve functionality, commercial advantage and efficiency.
Partner closely with other TB Product Teams, to include Transactional FX, Liquidity & Trade Lending teams to drive cross-sell and further revenue opportunities.
Spearhead the enhancement of SCB’s Asian clearing proposition, ensuring competitive positioning, local nuances and regulatory compliance.
Stay ahead of market trends, emerging technologies and regulatory changes to ensure the product suite remains innovative and relevant.
Determine and assess partnership requirements for FI Clearing to evolve the product offering.
Collaborate with senior leaders across the bank to secure buy-in for product initiatives and drive alignment with strategic goals.
Business
Drive the P&L for the FI clearing product, focussed on revenue growth, NFI, balances and overall profitability.
Contribute to the development of the overall product strategy, product roadmap, and business plan
Act as a subject matter expert in correspondent banking / FI Clearing, engaging with Sales, Coverage and clients to understand needs and pain points.
Analyse product performance using data-driven insights, identifying areas for improvement and growth.
Determine opportunities for standardisation to drive fee optimisation, claim recovery rates and/or processes that impact the end-to-end clearing offering.
Partner with regional and in-country teams, and drive a holistic FI Clearing product plan across all booking locations.
Work closely with other Product Owners, Product Developers, Solution Delivery, Marketing, Sales, Coverage, Operations, Digital Channels, Platforms and Engineering teams to define and develop detailed product/business requirements.
Constantly monitor the business environment as well as analyse competitor’s offerings in the market and recommend appropriate strategies to respond to market opportunities and/or threats.
Run a robust operating plan outlining product release timelines and implementation with coordination of all the activities required to bring the product to the client/market.
Collaborate with key location product managers to ensure product readiness before pilot / launch, including commercialization tool kits, product packs and training.
Provide business solutions for complex deals or RFPs to drive sales and solutions.
Establish and attend meetings with Swift, across various initiatives.
Represent SCB at client events, industry conferences and working groups.
Processes
Understand the end-to-end operating model across locations, while taking steps to improve points of friction in the client journey and potential failures from a risk management perspective.
Look for opportunities to optimise the end-to-end product lifecycle, across processes.
Understand the FI clearing product capabilities and gaps across locations, while taking steps to reach consistency.
Ensure seamless management of products by partnering with technology, operations, risk and compliance teams to establish efficient processes and frameworks.
Create new revenue streams with meaningful returns over the long term, through product enhancement and innovation, whilst uplifting current revenue streams through process efficiencies and digitization.
Manage product investments from reduction of unit cost of product to optimization of launch/go-to-market cost for products.
People & Talent
Initial direct management of 1-2 Group Product Managers (a sub-set of Group Payments) with possibility for growth.
Drive a performance culture in the team and build a strong talent pipeline.
Lead through collaboration, influence and client outcomes to drive superior results.
Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values.
Set appropriate tone and expectations amongst colleagues and work in collaboration with risk and control partners.
Ensure active communication of vision, priorities and progress to the business to foster engagement, awareness and motivation.
Risk Management & Governance
Responsibility for the product programme and related country addendums which impact FI Clearing products. Ensure variations are reflected accordingly.
Execute new FI deals within the framework of the deal review policy.
Ensure client facing documentation relating to FI clearing products are maintained and up-to-date.
Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.
Willingness to ‘speak up’ in the event of any realized or perceived breach of group conduct rules or laws by colleagues.
Willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key Stakeholders
External
FI Clients
Competitors (industry initiatives)
Regulators
SWIFT
BAFT
Internal
CCIB Coverage, Sales, respective country/region Heads
Technology & Operations
Digital Channels
Central and regional / local product management
Legal and CFCC
Our Ideal Candidate
10 years of relevant experience in Transaction Banking Product Management, focused on the FI segment.
Deep understanding of correspondent banking/ global clearing, cross-border payment flows, financial messaging, payment systems & technology
Commercial and financial acumen to drive a strategic growth priority for SCB, measure product success, develop business cases, and actively manage internal and external stakeholders.
Strong strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to develop a business vision, proactively define and execute product strategy, prioritise effectively and deliver a product roadmap
Experienced product manager across the product lifecycle to include ideation, requirements, commercialisation and sunset.
Experience working with industry and regulatory bodies across markets, including standard setters.
Creative problem solver, capable of developing innovative and differentiating solutions. Keen interest in emerging payment technology, new financial services players, and the application to global clearing.
Proven leadership track record in a product leadership role, well versed at cross-team collaboration, managing change and setting up high impact teams
Demonstrated knowledge of payment regulations and product risk management as it applies to global clearing/ correspondent banking.
Global perspective: experience working across multiple geographies and understanding nuanced payment ecosystems and client requirements.
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Knowledge of Product Line
Disruptive Innovation
Business Performance Management
Product Development Lifecycle
Strategic Planning

Job Title: Digital Product Manager (Financial Services), Director, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services.
The opportunity
With our Data & Analytics team in FSO experiencing rapid growth, now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for talent with a passion for data and the know-how to partner with our to clients to disrupt and transform Financial Services organisations. Whether you are a Consultant at the start of your career or a Manager looking for the next opportunity, if you want to make a difference by developing leading data and technology strategies and helping to solve our clients’ most pressing data challenges, we would love to hear from you.

Your key responsibilities
· Design the execution of our clients’ transformation programs to support their transition towards a digital and data-driven organisation, with data and people at the heart of change.
· Manage the life cycle, from strategic planning to tactical activities.
· Bring to life a seamless data and analytics strategy that solve our clients’ most complex business challenges to enable the making of better-informed decisions.
· Design and implement data and technology operating models that encompass people, process, technology, and data.
· Leverage data platforms and solutions to help our clients visualise and better understand their data.
· Provide thought leadership on how our clients can innovate with traditional or emerging technology tools and disrupt their current ways of working to extract greater value from their input.
· Lead and support the creation of client proposals and business development initiatives.
Skills and attributes for success
· Understand how digital and data strategies are created and implemented.
· Passion for designing large, multi-year digital and data transformations with people at the centre of change.
· Passion for solving big complex problems using data and technology
· Working with diverse and inclusive teams of talented people solving client issues.
· Build strong, meaningful relationships with client stakeholders.
· Work as a team player to support other team members by sharing your knowledge, experience, and skillsets.
To qualify for the role, you must have
· Minimum 10 years’ experience in Financial Services (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level). Preferably a year of consulting experience in any of the Big 4 or consulting firms.
· Experience in data and analytics approaches such as data mesh.
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
· Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
· Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
· Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
· Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES
Job Purpose
Maximize new business/acquisition/referral opportunities and deepening existing customer relationships to the specified service standards for the Priority Clients segment
Implementation and oversight of the below individual responsibilities:
To conduct a professional, consultative financial analysis and profiling session with customers to meet their financial needs/objectives.

In consultation with the PB team manager/ branch manager/ PTL, draw up monthly plans for achieving/exceeding sales targets to meet new business and customer acquisition goals

To source and call on individual prospects
To provide quality, efficient after-sales services
To manage anti-attrition and retention of clients
To organise and conduct sales presentations to groups, clubs, associations, companies and other organisations.

Agreed service standards to customers

CMFAS Exams
Experience in Managing North Asia Market
Good understanding and command of Mandarin as the incumbent will be supporting North Asia market
7 years of experience in Banking.

Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too.

We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills and enhance performance. You will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

The Opportunity
As a Cloud Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud solutions that align with our business objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the scalability, security, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure. Your primary responsibilities will include:

Responsibilities
Design and architect cloud solutions based on business requirements, ensuring scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
Automate cloud operations, develop infrastructure automation scripts and participates in the continuous improvement of cloud solutions.
Participate in the specification, setup and run Proof of Concepts and demonstrations of cloud solutions
Administer and maintain servers across virtual platforms.
Plan and execute the migration of on-premises applications and workloads to cloud environments, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies.
Maintain detailed documentation of cloud architectures, configurations, and procedures.
What we look for
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
Qualifications:
At least a bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, programming & systems analysis, Science (Computer Studies) or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience in designing, implementing, and managing cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Strong understanding of cloud architecture principles, including IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools and automation.
Knowledge of security best practices and cloud security services.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect) are a plus.A Degree in one of the following: Accountancy, Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Information Technology or equivalent
Experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 or boutique consulting firm is highly desirable
Experienced in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

Job Title: Actuarial Life Insurance (Financial Services) Manager, Risk Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The Opportunity
As part of our life actuarial team, you’ll focus on high-impact opportunities to apply your knowledge and experience that will shape our services. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues. You will be at the forefront of issues that are shaping the insurance industry in Asia and gain a wide exposure to a diverse range of actuarial projects.
Your Key Responsibilities
As a Manager in the Actuarial team, you will be assisting and leading the delivery of a wide range of client engagements, leading or working as part of a project team, relating to IFRS 17, Appointed Actuary work, actuarial valuation, pricing and product development, actuarial modelling, Merger & Acquisitions (M&A) and due diligence. You will also be performing evaluation in areas related to financial risk, product distribution and capital issues. You will also work with advanced financial modeling approaches and systems, e.g. designing valuation and Asset Liability Management (ALM) frameworks.
Skills and Attributes for Success
Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients
Possess strong interpersonal and teaming skills
Has strong analytical and creative skills
Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading edge best practices
To Qualify for the role, you must have
Minimum 6 years of experience in the life actuarial team or an actuarial consulting firm.
Newly or Nearly qualified with either the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries (UK), the Society of Actuaries (US) or the Institute of Actuaries of Australia
Good knowledge of Prophet software
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ideally, you’ll also have
Depth of experience in at least one of the following areas:
- financial modeling
- financial and regulatory reporting
- product and distribution strategy
- ERM / Solvency II
- M&A due diligence
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
Trade & Working Capital is an integral part of the Bank’s DNA. As a network-driven Trade bank, we support vast international trading networks across a large range of commodities, markets, and specialisms – helping millions of people, clients and businesses achieve their financial aspirations. Our uniqueness is our distinctive network that stretches across core emerging markets with onshore Trade solutions in 42 markets across Asia, Africa, the Middle East and beyond.

Trade & Working Capital, within Transaction Banking, is grounded in the Bank’s strategic priorities through delivering customer value, innovation, driving productivity, optimizing cost efficiencies, facilitating #simplefasterbetter, and living the valued behaviours.
To get things done faster to support this growth, a core team of product managers serving as Product Initiatives Leads for Trade will, on a rolling basis, drive selected high-impact and high-visibility group or regional initiative(s) under Trade’s core priorities and strategies that will help move the needle in reaching our goals.
This role reports into the Head of Trade Initiatives & Business Enablement and requires commercial-minded individuals with strong trade domain expertise in documentary/ open account trade finance, a ‘can-do’ attitude and ability to work independently. Ability to collaborate with Global/ Regional product heads and other stakeholders such as RFOs and operations teams will be key to delivering on this role. Key objectives will entail establishing strategy, business cases and execution plans as well as actual execution of agreed initiatives. Product Initiative leads will be responsible to the Group/ Regional product managers for the end-to-end execution and commercialization of initiative(s) they lead.
We are looking for individuals who can operate in new (often ambiguous) areas, can provide critical thinking, problem solving and drive execution of the product initiatives they lead.

Key Responsibilities
Business
• Work closely with global and/ or regional product heads as product initiatives leads to establish a strategy, business case, project plan and execute the agreed scope of initiatives
• Apply a “client-first” lens while considering speed to value, time-to-market and cost-benefit trade offs
• Drive innovation (e.g., Digital Assets), ideation and thought leadership and execute on innovation initiatives through to commercialization in alignment with business strategy
• Define detailed scope, success KPIs, system /process/people requirements & work with the lead product manager and frontline teams to deliver commercial outcomes.
• Lead authoring of relevant artefacts such as requirements/scope, impacted PPGs, end-to-end product & process flows, interface requirements, risk impacts, and clearly articulate these flows and processes to the relevant business and technology teams
• Engage and work with relevant 1st line and 2nd line stakeholders to define, seek approvals and deliver, product/process changes for the initiatives they lead.
• Work with Technology & POs to track progress for relevant system changes linked to initiatives they lead.
People & Talent
• Champion and act as a role model of the Group’s values and culture. Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Sets appropriate tone and expectations for their team and work in collaboration with risk and control partners.
• Lead and support a change in mindset, building a culture of client centricity, agility, and accountability through standardised metrics and measurement, ensuring everyone in the Bank are drivers and owners of client outcomes.
• Set effective metrics and standards, transparently communicating them to team members, providing feedback and rewarding employees accordingly. Set the appropriate tone and expectations for the wider team.
• Ensure team structure/capacity is reviewed to enable delivery of client outcomes.
• Create a motivational and challenging environment for team members which is conducive to creativity and performance with customer centricity in mind.
• Provide feedback on team members to their people leaders, as part of performance reviews
Risk Management
• Under Trade Process Universe mappings end-to-end and impact of these initiative led changes to the Trade PU.
• Work with risk teams to seek approvals for any risk related items such as product/TB risk, legal, OR/GRAM risk assessments etc., for said changed driven by the product initiatives they lead.

Skills and Experience
Regulatory & Business Conduct
• Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
• Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
• Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
• Lead the N/A to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles
Key stakeholders
• Global Head, Trade & Working Capital
• Head, Trade Initiatives & Business Enablement
• Head, Trade Product Development
• Global Product Heads
• Regional Product Heads
• TB Sales
• TB Central
• DCDA
• Trade COO
• Trade CIO
• Group Process owners
• Functional Partners including TB Risk, CFCC, HR, Finance, Legal, GIA

Our Ideal Candidate
University Degree
Licenses and Certifications/ accreditations: CDCS, CTFP, GTC, or related Trade related training a strong plus
12 years of experience in Trade related product management/operations/sales domains
Strong Project Management experience, with PMP, ACP or related project management certifications a plus
Prior management consultant or in-house business/ strategy consulting and execution experience a plus
Excellent knowledge of MS Office - Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel a must.
Strong presentation skills, extensive experience writing successful project proposals, experience planning and execution related projects, and demonstrated project management skills and experience
Strong influencing and communication skills – oral, written and presentation. Proven success in communicating technical information in a simple way.
A team player: multi-culturally aware with a proven ability to work in a global service delivery model, with onshore and offshore resources.
A track record of success in product/portfolio/ programme and project management roles in the trade domain
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills; ability to steer through ambiguity and determine proper course or methodology without direction or supervision.
Solid organizational skills, including experience engaging strong stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, process mapping, draft scoping statements, develop project, resource and costing plans, establish and run governance models, and stakeholder communications.
Ability to produce clear, concise, relevant and accurate documentation based on captured requirements and information gathered from stakeholders/
Proven ability to prioritise issues within a large, rapidly changing environment and manage a wide variety/ high volume of tasks while maintaining quality delivery.
A results-driven professional. Takes ownership to deliver, with a high level of flexibility and a preparedness to ‘roll up his/ her sleeves’ to get the job done. Proven success in holding individuals accountable for progress against agreed deliverables.
A proven ability to work independently, solve problems and make balanced judgments / decisions
Demonstrates ability to work with limited direction and multi-task without loss of quality
Confident and courageous to raise/ escalate issues in a pro-active, professional, and timely manner
CDCS, CTFP, GTC, PMP, or related Trade related training a strong plus
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Trade Products
Project Management
Digital Assets & Innovation
Stakeholder Management
Communications & Tools (PowerPoint, Excel)

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
Job Overview
Digital currencies (including cryptocurrencies, virtual currencies, central bank digital currencies and more) represent the potential to truly digitise cash management. Digital currency (over centralised or distributed databases or stored-value forms) will become the lubricant of the new economy. If you are a person that thinks this and is driven to create client relevant and value accretive solutions; this is the job for you.
Looking for a competent, self-driven product associate to join the Digital Currencies product team who is passionate about the potential for Digital Currencies to disrupt and innovate payments. An individual who has proven experience of involvement in Blockchain and Digital currencies use cases, proof of concepts and product management and who enjoys researching, communicating and educating on Digital currency topics. You would be joining a team at the forefront of our efforts to digitize cash e2e for the new economy and you will help to drive the “next” for Cash Management.
The Role Responsibilities
Business
• Contributing to the Digital currencies strategy, roadmap and operating plan
• Supporting the Digital currencies team on executing the digital currencies strategy and operating plan
• Researching potential digital currency and sustainability use cases leveraging blockchain technology, crypto, eFiat, tokens, coins, purpose coins and other digital assets including the Regulatory responses and pronouncements related thereto.
• Helping to evaluate and prioritize new product and services opportunities and develop a business case for them including the governance aspects of SCB in Tech, Ops, CFCC, across all PRTs.
• Working with the Digital Currencies team and wider product teams to develop prioritized opportunities from concept through to the execution of a proof of concept
• Supporting the Digital Currencies Product Manager, Product Development, Governance and technical teams on the delivery of Digital Currencies projects
• Supporting the Digital Currencies Product Manager on the commercialization of Digital Currencies initiatives, with specific emphasis on the internal risk, tech, ciso and domain architecture approvals.
• Joining client meetings to discuss co-creation opportunities for Digital Currency use cases
• Researching and joining meetings with potential partners to discuss Digital Currency collaboration opportunities
• Monitoring the constantly changing and fast moving world of Digital currencies and providing updates to the Cash team with the latest news, whitepapers etc.
• Providing education sessions on blockchain and digital currencies to the wider global cash team to upskill digital currencies knowledge within the bank
• Leading the co-ordination of regular newsletters on digital currency news regarding what is happening in the market and what the bank is doing
• Developing and maintaining an internal web page and information depository on Digital Currencies
• Contributing and helping to co-ordinate thought leadership whitepapers on Digital Currency topics.
• Organising internal events and participating in external events on Digital Currencies

Key Responsibilities
Processes
• Works with the team to analysis new revenue streams with meaningful returns over the long term
• Contributes to product build, from reduction of unit cost of product to optimization of launch/go-to-market cost for products.
• Contributes to process design work with Operations, Technology and other function partners with the aim of translating process optimization to bottom line cost control with a high degree of reliability.
Risk Management
• Adherence to all Group Policies and relevant legislation covering credit, operational, reputational risk among others.
• Commitment to Group Code of Conduct
Governance
• Specific responsibility for the governance chains relating to new products, regulatory approach, Cash Tech approvals, DCDA Tech Approvals, Compliance, CISO and other production approval boards.
• Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group’s arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas
• Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.
• Willingness to ‘speak up’ in the event of any realized or perceived breach of group conduct rules or laws by colleagues
• Willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
• Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
• Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
• Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.

Skills and Experience
Key Stakeholders & Partners
• Central Cash Management team & Pillar Leads
• Product Development Teams
• DCDA (DXCE) Delivery Team
• Local Cash Product teams
• Cash Tech Delivery teams
• CFCC, Legal and Operations Risk, COO

Our Ideal Candidate
7 plus years of experience of working on blockchain and digital assets (technology/and or applications).
Experience of working with Fintech companies and payments systems.
Experience in DLT and related technologies.
Knowledge in Digital assets & tokenization.
Ability to work as part of a team and independently.
Strong co-ordination and organisational skills.
Creative and innovative mindset open to learning and feedback
Role Specific Technical Competencies
DLT and related technologies
Digital assets and tokenization knowledge
Fintech exposure
Research, evaluation and prioritization skills
Communication and presentation
Payments knowledge
HCD

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
What will you do?
We are looking for software developers that are open and enthusiastic about end to end software delivery and trying out new technologies.
Be part of a cross-functional development team that values quality, automation and user experience of the software we deliver.
Mainly responsible for software design and development of web frontend and backend applications
Write automated functional and unit testing for the code you write
Develop backend APIs & databases supporting the applications
Design and develop applications leveraging cloud technologies
Assist DevOps Engineer on build and release automation
Work closely with fellow developers in pair programming and code review
Work closely with Business Analyst, Quality Engineer, User Interface/User Experience Designers to deliver features
What are we looking for?
Experience with front-end development framework such as React.js / Next.js
Experience in server-side web application development using Node.js
Experience on working on CI/CD pipeline
Experience of leveraging on cloud platforms such as Amazon AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Familiar with Javascript unit testing frameworks such as Jest or Mocha
Familiar with Agile and Continuous Integration and Delivery Practices
Familiar with version control using Git
Open to work on other platforms because we want a cross-functional team
Solid Fundamentals in Javascript & Typescript
Familiarity with building reusable web components will be an advantage
Familiarity on how search engines components work (crawl, index, search)
Familiar with practices such as Test-Driven Development and Behavior-Driven Development
Familiar with Docker
Collaborative team player with good interpersonal and presentation skills
Minimum of 3-5 years of software development experience
A Pass in ICT Assessment Certification for Solution Architect or Software Developer by NUS-ISS is a plus.
What do we offer in return?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program
Does it sound like something you are interested in exploring further? Please be in touch with our team for an initial chat at chi@activate.sg
Activate Interactive Singapore is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Activate Interactive Pte Ltd does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.
Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Activate Interactive Pte Ltd.

Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are:
minden.ai is a technology venture founded by Temasek in strategic partnership with DFI Retail Group and coalition partners Breadtalk Group, DBS Bank, PAssion Card, Mandai Wildlife Group, Singtel, Great Eastern, FoodPanda and GoJek.
We are on a mission to redefine how brands engage with their customers through the power of machine learning and artificial intelligence. We are building a next generation insights-driven platform to serve millions of customers and merchant partners across Southeast Asia.

The way we work:
At minden.ai, our culture is the foundation of everything we do. We believe in the power of teamwork and collaboration. We are continuous learners and commit to stay ahead of the curve to drive positive change in our industry. We do not settle for mediocrity without our best effort. We do our best to create the greatest value for our customers' long term success.

We are seeking a Senior CRM Executive who demonstrates a deep understanding of the company's product, be able to identify consumer touch-points and propose actionable items to meet customers' needs. The ideal candidate should possess strong research and communication skills, be highly organised, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously.

As a Senior CRM Executive, you will:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product & Engineering, Marketing, Partnership) for effective GTM strategies
Participate in CRM planning and executing CRM & campaign programs
Drive platform retention, loyalty, engagement and usage metrics (e.g. CTOR)
Manage user segmentation, communication delivery (emails, push notifications, etc) and performance evaluation
Conduct comprehensive experiment throughout the customer lifecycle to identify successful strategies for funnel conversion and customer engagement
Coordinate analysis of industry trends to meet business objectives
Create hypotheses, run A/B tests or other experimentations and apply basic statistics to improve campaign performance
Spike the CRM applications to better plan and implement the campaign
You will be a great match if you have:
Minimum 3 years of experience in CRM or BA roles
Proficient in delivering campaigns and managing automation with rigorous A/B testing (or other different experimentations before)
Sensitive to numbers, logical thinking and analytical skills
Proven track record of using data and analytics tools to increase performance and enhance customer experience
Excellent project management and communication skills
Experience in SQL or HTML is an advantage
Familiarity with CRM software (e.g. Braze) is a plus
Familiarity with Design software (e.g. Figma) is a plus
Demonstrates a strong sense of ownership, responsibility and commitment
Self-directed learner with a motivated attitude
Quick to adapt to ever-changing and volatile market conditions
Interest in and familiarity with financial news preferred
Strong ownership of grey areas

Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are:
minden.ai is a technology venture founded by Temasek in strategic partnership with DFI Retail Group and coalition partners BreadTalk Group, DBS Bank, PAssion Card, Mandai Wildlife Group, Singtel, FoodPanda, GoJek and Great Eastern. We are on a mission to redefine the engagement between brands and consumers in Southeast Asia.

The way we work:
At Minden, we treat each other with respect. We embrace authenticity and transparency. We pride ourselves on agility and innovation, and believe in embracing continuous learning and self-improvement. We strive to be the preferred employer by providing comprehensive benefits, a dynamic and exciting working environment, work-life balance and effort recognition.
We are seeking for individuals with grit and passion, an insatiable intellectual curiosity and a heart for people to amplify effectiveness as a team.

As a Machine Learning Lead, you will:
Lead, coach and mentor a high-performing Machine Learning team.
Guide our ML architecture to ensure performance, security, and extensibility.
Collaborate with the leadership team to develop the company's roadmap for AI/ML.
Work closely with the product team to design and deliver a ML-based pricing system that delights our customers with a hyper-personalised experience.
Work cross functionally to operationalise machine learning models and serve inferences efficiently, which include automating data pipelines, machine learning pipelines, performance monitoring and testing.
Be the evangelist for AI/ML through mentoring and technical/knowledge sharing.
What you should have:
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, IT or a related discipline.
Possess at least 8 years of experience in software engineering, data engineering and ML engineering. Minimal 3 years experience in leading a ML team.
Experience in creating, managing and coaching high performing engineering teams and being technically hands-on as a leader.
Programming experience in Python, Java, Pyspark and Scala.
Possess knowledge of Big Data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, etc
Experience in building and optimizing Machine Learning models, ML pipelines, data pipelines and architectures.
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.
Experience working in an agile startup environment

Job Title: Senior Professional Officer, Chemical Process Engineering, Analytical Technology
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is actively searching for a Senior Professional Officer, Chemical Process Engineering, Analytical Technology to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:
Design and teach labs & practice modules
Mentor students in Capstone Projects and the Integrated Work Study Programme (IWSP)
Lead or co-lead innovation projects with industry
Manage labs and equipment to support academic programmes and applied research
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
A good degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field. Masters, PhD and/or relevant professional certifications would be advantageous.
At least 10 - 15 years of working experience in chemical processing, quality control, and characterization with an expertise in organic/inorganic chemistry and biopharmaceutical synthesis and modification.
Proficiency in analytical techniques such as HPLC, GC-MS, LC-MS, ICP-OES, ICP-MS, NMR, and related methods, with a focus on biopharmaceutical analysis.
Operational Knowledge in unit operations (for e.g. Heat Exchanger, Distillation Column, Reactors, Cooling Tower etc).
Practical knowledge of Quality Management Systems and Engineering standards including but not limited to ISO9001, OSHA and BSI etc.
Practiced in Chemical Process Design software (for e.g. HYSYS)
Extensive experience and knowledge of industry practices to bring industry perspective to the University
Keen interest in innovation projects, with demonstrated ability in developing solutions to technical problems.
Strong supervisory skills and enjoy working closely with students in an educational environment.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is actively searching for a Manager/Asst Manager, Data eXchange Unit to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:
Support and work closely with the Chief Data Officer (CDO) to develop and implement hospital's Data Strategy to enable data exploitation for meaningful and insightful decision making.
Develop, review and update hospital's data-related policies to ensure alignment with Ministry of Health’s (MOH) and National Healthcare Group’s (NHG) data policies (e.g., MOH’s HealthTech Instruction Manual - Data Management (HIM-DM) and NHG Data Access & Sharing Policy).
Oversee the management and maintenance of Platform for one-stop request in hospital (PorT) to facilitate data requests by hospital and NHG staff. Put in place protocol that complies with relevant data access, sharing, and security policies.
Serve as a point-of-contact to liaise with other NHG institutions’ DXOs and external parties for data request as well as to contribute to NHG’s analytics and digitalization effort.
Develop and implement proper data assets management standard operating procedures and workflows across the Data Life Cycle from data acquisition, fusion, access and distribution, to disposal (e.g. tracking and maintaining registries of data access, monitoring of data handling and disposal processes).
Collaborate with relevant departments/units to build staff literacy, competency, capabilities, and knowledge in safe, efficient, and effective data exploitation and management on various platforms such as Oracle OBIEE/OAS, SharePoint, NGEMR, etc.
Oversee the secretariat support for departmental and hospital working committees to support hospital’s digital transformation agenda and build communities of practice to share knowledge and best practices (e.g. Data Management Working Committee (DMWC) and Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics (AiDA) Digital Innovation Technologies (DIT) committee).
Lead change management, engagements, and communications with different levels of stakeholders, on issues pertaining to data management, data sharing, and data exploitation.
