Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview:
The Operations Manager is responsible for the overall strategic management and execution of core operational functions within the company. This includes leadership over Trip Support, Medical Evacuation Sales and Operations, Aircraft Owner Accounts, Crew Logistics, and the coordination of suppliers and vendors. The Operations Executive will ensure that the company's services meet the highest standards of efficiency, safety, and client satisfaction, while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements and optimizing cost-efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Management of Trip Support Functions
Oversee the planning and coordination of flight operations, including route planning, overflight permits, ground handling, and fuelling.
Ensure seamless execution of client trips by maintaining close communication with internal teams and external service providers.
Monitor regulatory updates in international aviation to ensure compliance
Medical Evacuation Sales and Operations
Lead and manage the Medical Evacuation (Medevac) division, ensuring rapid response capabilities and adherence to medical and aviation protocols.
Establish partnerships with hospitals, insurance companies, and other service providers.
Oversee pricing strategies and service level agreements (SLAs) for MedEvac operations.
Management of Aircraft Owner Accounts
Serve as the primary point of contact for aircraft owners, ensuring client satisfaction and operational transparency.
Manage aircraft scheduling, utilization, and financial performance of owned aircraft.
Conduct regular reviews of aircraft maintenance status and liaise with technical teams for upkeep and service.
Crew Logistics
Oversee the coordination and management of all crew-related logistics, including commercial positioning flights, accommodation, and catering.
Ensure efficient crew rostering and duty time management in compliance with regulatory standards.
Manage relationships with vendors providing crew services such as transportation and lodging.
Executive Coordination and Vendor Management
Lead the selection, negotiation, and management of contracts with key suppliers and vendors, including handling, catering, fuel, and other critical operational services.
Develop and maintain strategic relationships with suppliers to ensure service continuity and cost-effectiveness.
Oversee the procurement process and ensure it aligns with company standards and budget constraints.
Safety and Compliance
Ensure that all operations are conducted in accordance with international and domestic aviation safety regulations.
Maintain strong working relationships with aviation regulatory bodies and ensure that safety audits and compliance checks are conducted regularly.
Implement and monitor a robust safety management system (SMS) across all operations.
Budget and Cost Control
Develop and oversee the operations budget, ensuring that all functions operate within budgetary constraints.
Conduct regular financial reviews to identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising service quality or safety.
Monitor expenditure on vendors and service providers, ensuring that financial objectives are met.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing operations team, ensuring alignment with company goals and operational excellence.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement, identifying areas for process optimization and innovation.
Facilitate training and professional development opportunities for team members.
Crisis Management and Problem Resolution
Act as the point of escalation for operational challenges, resolving issues related to trip disruptions, client concerns, or vendor service failures.
Oversee the development and execution of contingency plans to manage disruptions, ensuring minimal impact on clients and operations.
Lead emergency response coordination in the event of operational crises.
Reporting and Performance Metrics
Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to operations, trip support, vendor performance, and client satisfaction.
Provide regular reports to the executive leadership team on operational performance, including recommendations for improvement.
Ensure that data analytics are used effectively to enhance decision-making and operational efficiencies.

Working Conditions:
Full-time position, typically Monday to Friday, with occasional overtime as needed.
Office-based with occasional site visits as required.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
Extensive experience in aviation operations, preferably within the private jet or corporate aviation sector.
Strong understanding of international aviation regulations, safety protocols, and best practices.
Proven experience in vendor management, contract negotiation, and strategic supplier relationships.
Exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Strong financial acumen with experience managing budgets and cost control.
Ability to thrive in high-pressure environments and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Job Title: Head of Operations / Manager (5* Hotel / Healthcaare)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Manager/Head of Operations, a pivotal role in our client’s new setup. Reporting directly to the General Manager (GM), you will oversee and integrate operations across our hotel and hospital services, ensuring exceptional guest and patient experiences.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic Coordination
Lead and execute operational strategies across hotel and hospital functions, aligning with organizational goals.
Collaborate closely with the GM and executive leaders to ensure seamless integration between hospitality and healthcare services.
Serve as the primary liaison between hotel and hospital teams, fostering effective communication and synergy.
Operational Excellence
Oversee daily operations, including guest/patient services, housekeeping, food & beverage, facilities, and healthcare management.
Monitor performance metrics to uphold the highest standards in hospitality and healthcare operations.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, policies, and standards.
Guest and Patient Experience
Cultivate a culture of excellence in service delivery, catering to the unique needs of guests and patients.
Develop initiatives to enhance satisfaction and build loyalty.
Resolve escalated guest and patient concerns promptly and effectively.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and inspire departmental heads across hotel and healthcare operations.
Promote collaboration and accountability within the team.
Implement training programs to enhance operational skills and elevate service delivery.
Financial Management
Manage budgets for hotel and hospital operations, focusing on cost optimization and revenue growth.
Prepare and present financial reports to the GM and senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency without compromising service quality.
Innovation and Compliance
Introduce innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency and satisfaction.
Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes in hospitality and healthcare sectors.
Qualifications and Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
A Master’s degree is an advantage.
Experience
5 to 10 years of senior leadership experience with significant exposure to both hotel and healthcare operations.
Proven track record of managing large teams in high-performance environments.
Skills
Strategic leadership and operational management expertise.
Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
Financial management skills and regulatory compliance knowledge.
Preferred Candidate Profile
Demographics: Singaporean or Permanent Resident (PR).
Cultural Fit: In-depth understanding of Singapore’s hospitality and healthcare sectors.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a creative and results-oriented Marketing and Event Manager (APAC) to drive internal employee engagement initiatives and external partnership events, enhance employer branding, and create impactful content for both internal and external stakeholders. This role is pivotal in fostering a positive work environment, strengthening employee engagement, and positioning the company as a top employer and partner in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating engaging events, designing compelling visuals, and producing high-quality content that aligns with the company's goals and culture.
Responsibilities
Internal Employee Engagement and Communication
Collaborate with Office Management team to plan and execute internal engagement events such as team-building activities, holiday celebrations and cultural initiatives to promote a positive workplace environment.
Design office decorations for key celebrations, company milestones, and themed events to enhance workplace aesthetics and morale.
Develop and distribute engaging internal newsletters to keep employees informed about company updates, achievements, and upcoming events.
Collaborate with HR to create programs that recognize employee achievements and foster a sense of community.
Act as the primary owner of internal communication channels, ensuring timely and engaging dissemination of company updates, policies, and initiatives.
Partner with leadership to craft messages that align with the company's vision and values.
External Sales Partnership Events
Organize and manage external events, such as partner summits, industry conference and networking sessions to strengthen relationships with sales and technology partners.
Develop event strategies and logistics, including venue selection, budgeting, and coordination with vendors to ensure seamless execution.
Create visually appealing event materials such as invitations, brochures, and presentation decks to support partnership events.
Act as the point of contact for external partners to ensure alignment on event objectives and outcomes.
Content Creation and Design
Create high-quality marketing materials, including posters, videos, white papers, infographics, and presentations to support both internal and external campaigns.
Design and produce visually appealing content for social media platforms, company websites, and newsletters to enhance brand visibility.
Maintain brand consistency across all communication channels.
Employer Branding
Develop and execute employer branding strategies to position the company as an employer of choice in the APAC region.
Collaborate with Talent Acquisition team to create campaigns that highlight company culture, employee success stories, and career opportunities.
Leverage social media, career fairs, and industry events to attract top talent and build the company's reputation.
Marketing Campaigns and Strategy
Develop and implement marketing campaigns for key company initiatives, ensuring alignment with business goals and regional market dynamics.
Monitor campaign performance and provide data-driven insights to refine strategies and improve results.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to align marketing efforts with organizational priorities.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or a related field.
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in marketing, event management, or content creation, preferably in the technology or system integration industry.
Proven experience in planning and executing both internal and external events.
Expertise in creating engaging visuals, videos, and written content tailored for different audiences.
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro) or Canva.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to effectively engage internal employees and external stakeholders.
Strong understanding of strategies to enhance employer branding and attract top talent.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery within budget.
Knowledge of social media management, email marketing, and basic analytics tools to track campaign performance.
Creative thinker with a strong eye for design and attention to detail.
Collaborative team player with the ability to work across departments and regions.
Highly organized with excellent time management and problem-solving skills.
Enthusiastic and proactive with a passion for creating engaging experiences for employees and partners.

Job Description:
This is a contract role (12 months) for a Warehouse Assistant located in Pioneer. Our client is Freight forwarding service in Singapore, you will be taking the responsible on for managing the flow of goods within the warehouse, ensuring smooth operations from receiving to dispatch. This includes tasks like checking and storing inbound items, picking and packing outbound orders, and preparing cargo for shipment. They also handle value-added services such as repacking, cleaning, and performing minor maintenance on spare parts. Inventory management is a key part of the role, involving regular cycle counts, stock assessments, and minor rework on pallets or products as needed. Additionally, they ensure all documentation and processes comply with the company’s internal controls and standard operating procedures. Maintaining a clean, safe, and organized warehouse environment is essential for this role

Job Description:
This is a full role for an Air Operation Officer located in Changi. Our client provides full-fledged freight forwarders offering full inter-model transportation services for both inbound and outbound cargos. Your responsibility involves managing import operations, including awaiting pre-alerts to handle cargo release or delivery arrangements. Responsibilities include inspecting cargo at the warehouse for discrepancies and consulting the team leader for further instructions. The role requires regular communication with customers and overseas agents, monitoring emails, and handling customs-related tasks such as pre-declaring permits and submitting shipment details via the CCN system to Singapore Customs. Additional duties include billing, email correspondence, and other air import operations tasks, with a willingness to work overtime as needed.
Qualifications:
Minimum GCE N/O Level
Good in MS Office – word, excel, PowerPoint

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented BIM Coordinator specializing in ACMV systems to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and coordinating Building Information Modeling (BIM) processes for ACMV projects, ensuring that all designs are accurate, efficient, and aligned with project requirements. The BIM Coordinator will work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to optimize workflows and ensure successful project execution.

BIM Management and Coordination:
Develop, manage, and maintain BIM models for ACMV systems throughout the project lifecycle.
Coordinate with multidisciplinary teams, including MEP engineers, architects, and contractors, to ensure seamless integration of ACMV systems within the overall design.
Review, verify, and ensure compliance with project BIM execution plans and standards.
Model Creation and Detailing:
Generate detailed 3D models for ACMV systems, including ductwork, piping, and ventilation components, using software like Revit, AutoCAD, and Navisworks.
Create accurate shop drawings, schematics, and installation layouts based on the BIM models.
Clash Detection and Resolution:
Conduct clash detection and resolve conflicts between ACMV systems and other building systems using tools like Navisworks or BIM 360.
Provide solutions to design issues, ensuring efficient coordination and conflict-free models.
Project Documentation and Standards:
Ensure all BIM models comply with industry and company standards, as well as project-specific requirements.
Maintain up-to-date project documentation, including revision tracking and as-built models.
Collaboration and Communication:
Act as the primary point of contact for ACMV-related BIM coordination.
Facilitate regular BIM coordination meetings to address issues, update stakeholders, and ensure project milestones are met.
Provide technical support and guidance to team members on BIM-related processes and software.
Training and Development:
Train and mentor junior team members in BIM processes and best practices.
Stay updated on the latest BIM technologies, tools, and trends to continually improve workflows.
Requirements
Diploma or degree in Mechanical Engineering, Building Services, or a related field.
BIM certification (e.g., Autodesk Certified Professional or equivalent).
Familiarity with green building standards and sustainability practices.
Proficiency in BIM software, including Revit, AutoCAD MEP, Navisworks, and BIM 360.
Strong knowledge of ACMV systems, including ductwork, piping, and ventilation design principles.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in BIM coordination, preferably in ACMV or MEP fields.
Experience in clash detection, model coordination, and project documentation.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with various stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Roles & Responsibilities
POSITION SUMMARY
The Legal Counsel will provide comprehensive legal support to our manufacturing and oilfield services operations, which span across six countries. This role is crucial for ensuring that our global operations comply with relevant laws and regulations while addressing legal matters that arise in our diverse business environment. The Legal Counsel will work closely with various departments to maintain accurate legal documentation, conduct thorough legal research, and manage legal risks associated with commercial contracts, intellectual property, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance. If you're driven to navigate complex legal challenges and eager to grow in a dynamic, global industry, this role offers an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to effectively manage multiple legal matters.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Legal Documentation & Records: Maintain accurate and up-to-date legal documentation, records, and databases to support the company's global operations.
Legal Research: Conduct research on a variety of legal topics relevant to the company’s operations, including commercial contracts, intellectual property rights, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.
Compliance Monitoring: Monitor changes in laws, regulations, and industry standards to identify potential legal risks and ensure ongoing compliance with applicable requirements.
Cross-Functional Support: Collaborate with various departments to address legal issues impacting their operations and provide solutions that align with company objectives.
Contract Management: Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of contracts, including non-disclosure agreements (NDAs), supplier agreements, and service contracts, ensuring they align with the company’s interests and legal standards.
Document Preparation: Assist in creating, formatting, and proofreading documents, including letters, reports, memos, and presentations, to ensure accuracy and professionalism in all written materials.
Regulatory Guidance: Provide guidance on regulatory compliance and legal risks associated with the company’s global operations.
Risk Management: Identify and address potential legal issues proactively to mitigate risks and safeguard the company’s interests.
Deadline Management: Record and monitor deadlines, update status, and track internal databases/reports of relevant tasks and projects to ensure timely completion.
External Coordination: Coordinate with external legal advisors and service providers as necessary to support legal operations and obtain expert advice.
Ad-Hoc Tasks: Carry out other ad-hoc tasks and projects as assigned by the CEO, demonstrating flexibility and a willingness to support various initiatives.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Law or related field required; Juris Doctor (JD), LLM or equivalent degree preferred
3-5 years of experience in a legal role. Experience in the manufacturing and oilfield services industry is preferred.
Proven experience in handling legal matters related to commercial contracts, intellectual property, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manage multiple legal matters simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex legal concepts to non-legal professionals.
Proficiency in legal research tools and software.
Self-starter, ability to work independently and as part of a global team, maintaining a proactive and results-oriented approach.

Roles & Responsibilities

Job Title: Project Coordinator
Job Summary: As a Project Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in coordinating all operations and projects related matter with various team. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure reports and requests are delivered on time. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Assist in the planning and coordination of project activities, including scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, PowerPoint presentation and documenting minutes.
2. Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, to ensure timely delivery of project deliverables and resolve any issues or conflicts that may arise.
3. Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or deviations from the plan, escalating to Service Delivery Manager (SDM), Project Director (PD) any necessary requirement from customers.
4. Plan, track and monitor the tasks assigned to the managers, team leaders and members
5. Clear and open communication with customers on operations and project issues or clarifications.
6. Assist in creating of PowerPoint presentation and Excel documents.
7. Provide administrative support as needed, such as managing project-related correspondence and other ad-hoc duties.

Job Skills and Qualifications:
• Diploma or equivalent
• Proven 3 years’ experience in project coordination or project management support roles, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English
• Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
• Analytical mindset with the ability to identify issues, analyse data, and propose solutions.
• Advance skill sets in Excel and PowerPoint
• Adaptability and flexibility to navigate changing project requirements and priorities.
• Experience in Government IT projects is a plus.

You’ll get to:

Quick to learn new skills

Roles & Responsibilities
Requirements for IT Infra Engineer
We are requesting for 1-3 augmented resources (Associate Consultant/Consultant) for a minimum of six (6) months to create comprehensive user guide documentation to configure their systems to pipe logs to Government Cyber Security Operations Centre (GCSOC).
This documentation is crucial to enhance the self-help capabilities of Whole-of-Government (WOG) agencies, leading to more efficient and adoption of GCSOC services.
By providing clear, detailed user guides, we anticipate a reduction in support requests, faster onboarding times for agencies, and improved standardisation of practices across Government.
The scope of work encompasses approximately 150 products, including operating systems, servers, networking security, databases monitoring, cloud native services etc.
Scope of Works /Job responsibilities
Create clear, concise, and comprehensive user guides for WOG ICT products (Operating Systems, Servers, Firewall, Database, Cloud Service, etc) to send required logs to central monitoring service provided by GovTech.
Develop step-by-step instructions for ICT product configuration and/or setup required, to achieve GCSOC outcome
Conduct own research or setup to gather accurate technical information
Ensure documentation adheres to GovTech standards and best practices
Update and maintain existing documentation as products evolve
Incorporate user feedback to improve guide clarity and usability

Required Skills:
Must have experience in creating technical documentation (user guide, product guide, etc)
Familiarity with ICT concepts, including operating systems, networking, databases, and security
Understanding of SIEM systems and log management
Able to setup temporary system using virtualisation technology to collect relevant information or visual contents required for documentation
Ability to translate complex technical information into user-friendly content
Self-reliance and ability to work independently on creating the documentation
Knowledge of technical documentation best practices and standards (optional)

· Strong analytic and good persuasion skills

Receptionist
Work Dynamics - Integrated Facilities Management
We are seeking a professional and versatile Front of House Receptionist to manage our reception area, switchboard services, and meeting room operations. Reception Management:
Greet and welcome all visitors professionally

Provide information on site facilities and local amenities

Answer and route calls promptly and professionally
Manage general email inquiries
Handle press inquiries and difficult callers appropriately
Ensure data protection and information security
Meeting Room Services:
Manage room bookings using Microsoft Room Finder
Support meeting/event setup and maintenance
Provide first-line technical support for AV equipment
Monitor and report on room utilization
Helpdesk Services:
Manage all service-related inquiries and requests
Operate helpdesk system for logging and processing work orders
Route and track work orders to ensure timely completion
Communicate clearly with end-users throughout the service process
Monitor service level agreements (SLAs) and escalate as needed
Participate in ongoing training to improve customer support skills
Mailroom and Document Management:
Supervise mailroom operations and document archiving systems
Ensure efficient mail distribution and secure document storage
Security and Compliance:
Adhere to site security protocols and visitor policies
Manage "Dawn Raid" procedures and unplanned regulatory visits
Coordinate with security for additional or after-hours assistance
Administrative Support:
Manage office supplies for reception and meeting rooms
Update information packs and notice boards
Assist with basic office tasks as needed
Reporting and Continuous Improvement:
Record daily visitor numbers and provide utilization statistics
Participate in ongoing training and quality improvement initiatives
Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent; associate's degree preferred
2-3 years of experience in a receptionist or similar customer service role
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and facility management software
Experience with multi-line phone systems and AV equipment
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Professional appearance and demeanor
Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Customer-oriented with a positive attitude
Basic understanding of health and safety regulations
The ideal candidate will be a highly organized and customer-focused professional capable of managing diverse front office responsibilities while maintaining a welcoming and efficient environment for all visitors and staff.

· Ability to obtain and supervise the use of equipment and materials needed

Roles & Responsibilities
Your new company

Join a global authority on recognizing excellence in people practices, with a presence in many countries over the world. Our client empowers organizations to accelerate their people practices, enriching the world of work for employees worldwide.

Your new role

Our client is seeking an experienced HR Generalist to join the team. As an HR Auditor, you'll play a vital role in delivering the certification process to clients worldwide. Your responsibilities will include:

- Supporting clients in submitting surveys and validating answers
- Conducting quality checks to ensure objective and diligent certification processes
- Analyzing data and results to provide insights to clients
- Gathering HR best practices from clients and sharing knowledge within the organization

What you'll need to succeed

To excel in this role, you'll need:

- Bachelor's degree in HR or a related field
- At least 5 years of experience in HR, in a generalist or business partner function
- Strong HR knowledge and analytical skills
- Excellent communication and client-facing skills
- Fluency in English (written and spoken) and Mandarin (for business)

What you'll get in return

In return for your expertise and passion, we offer:

- A dynamic and international work environment
- Opportunities for growth and professional development
- Flexible work arrangements with WFH
- A competitive salary and benefits package
- A chance to make a meaningful impact on the world of work

Company: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Facilities Manager

Role Purpose
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Facilities Manager who will manage all high performing operational aspects of the assigned sites within the account owned and/or occupied portfolio in accordance with the requirements of all local requirements. The Senior FM will oversee the teams in APAC supporting all on account. This role is client facing and candidate must be able to exhibit exceptional customer and stakeholder service and communication.
What this job involves

The key focus for this role will be to support the team in APAC to ensure clear management and ownership in driving the internal operations of stakeholders and its clients. Ensuring services to the highest possible standards are delivered within adequate timeframes as well as representing the client and JLL values in appearance, presentation and manners throughout the APAC portfolio.

In this role, you will bring your people focused skills including strong stakeholder management and relationship building, continuous engagement and communications as well as your ability to proactively support the needs of our staff, clients and business partners.

You will be instrumental in ensuring the APAC workplace delivers a great experience for visitors and staff whilst also overseeing some remote sites. Your ownership of these multiple sites and people management to ensure you have happy customers in your whole community and your ability to proactively resolve queries and issues will be the cornerstone to your success in this role.
Promoting high level of satisfaction among client users by promptly responding to their service requirements.
Demonstrates leadership, gives direction and mentors the JLL team on site to promote engagement and excellency in customer service and delivery
Responsible locally for Building Management Systems, PPM Schedules, Task System, EHS and Quality Compliance
Ensures compliance with JLL and client best practice, policies and procedures including statutory compliance, Quality and EHS compliance.
Acts as go-to person in relation to all facilities/project/fit out/crisis management activities on site ensuring timely solutions and identification and removal of potential roadblocks
Develops a close working relationship with Client Key Stakeholders, Landlord, Managing Agents and all of the FM vendors to ensure that they fully understand the Client culture and become partners in delivering a high-quality service
Monitor PPM schedules, O&M’s, warranties, Task System, Asset & Life Cycle Registers
Responsible for Health & Safety during events, including contractor supervision, reviewing of H&S documentation and working closely with the Health & Safety Manager
Monitors and ensures office housekeeping and cleanliness is delivered to highest standards and that soft services functions are delivered in a timely efficient and customer orientated fashion
Proactively manages spend and budget locally in line with JLL policies and procedures including the processing of PO’s, invoices, budgets, service charges, rates, rent, insurance and local taxes etc. as applicable
Sound like you? To apply you need to be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent facilities or property management experience.
Strong FM Background with a proven ability to understand and interrogate hard service / soft service delivery.
Ability to react quickly and decisively when faced with a problem or issue
Able to work off their own initiative and with minimal direction
Strong team player with a commitment to support their colleagues
Able to demonstrate superior people management skills
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Knowledge of building systems, HVAC, electrical, mechanical, and plumbing services.
Superior client relationship management skills.
Strong leadership, supervisory and people management skills across multiple service lines.
Ability to work without supervision and drive positive outcomes.
Experience in a customer facing environment within technical FM services.
Experience with event management and planning.
Must be able to demonstrate flexibility in relation to type of works carried out and availability.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation and negotiation skills.
Ability to display initiative, confidence, and professionalism at all times
Must be prepared to travel in order to support region wide delivery
Ability to plan and manage financials within budget and time constraints as well as identify cost savings and avoidance opportunities.
Experience with contract management, vendor management and small capital projects.
Computer proficiency with MS Office and Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS).
Able to demonstrate knowledge of local health and occupational safety requirements
Experienced in dealing with critical facilities and vendor management for specialized services
Strong written and verbal English as a second language
You also need to be:
Self-motivated; confident & energetic
Flexible – able to adapt to rapidly changing situations
Goal-oriented – able to focus on meeting all performance targets
A strong communicator – good presentation skills and possess strong verbal & written communication skills (English & local language)
Critical Competencies for Success
Firm First mind-set
Able to cooperate and work well with others to meet targets
Support the team effectively as and when needed
Proven ability to commit to flawless execution while complying with firm’s procedures and standards
Client Focus & Relationship Management
Demonstrate and ensure to instil a culture in the team that match our ‘I am JLL’ core behaviours and values of being an Expert, Proactive, Innovative, Versatile, Team Player and valuing the Customer
Able to interact with the general client staff & vendors with ease
Ability to manage conflict and conflicting priorities
Demonstrates ability to work with vendors to deliver efficient services
Demonstrates proactive & professional approach to customer service
Project Management & Organizational Skills
Proven ability to manage multiple and complex operational matters on a daily basis
Demonstrates ability to prioritize and manage the completion of projects in an efficient and timely manner

Roles & Responsibilities
Duty and Responsibility
Procurement engineers oversee the purchase of technical equipment for industrial operations.
They collaborate with designers/Site to determine the equipment needed to complete manufacturing or construction projects according to specifications, research vendors for that equipment, then order it.
These engineers negotiate purchase agreements with vendors and award contracts to vendors for equipment.
They also monitor any adjustments to the equipment needed to maintain an optimum supply of equipment to complete projects on time and within budget.
A procurement engineer must possess high-level organization and record-keeping skills to maintain a consistent flow of equipment to the company’s factories or worksites and ensure vendors are fulfilling the terms of their contracts. Influencing and negotiation skills are also crucial for procurement engineers, as it’s up to them to negotiate the purchasing agreements for engineering equipment and hire vendors for projects.

Requirement
At Least have 5 years Construction Sector

Experience
Good communication skills to liaise with associates, clients, Supplier, government authorities.
Good team player

Roles & Responsibilities

Review of Civil & Structural working drawings and shop drawings in connection with SEM and steel structure shop drawings during pre-construction phase to prepare construction methods, identifying risks to promote strategies and alternative methodologies to mitigate.
Organizing regular meetings with the sub-contractor's technical teams to resolve technical problems in pre-construction and construction phase.
Working closely with Design team and LTA/QPS (client) to resolve execution issues with appropriate functional proposals with an aid of presentation or sketches.
Preparing method statement for construction working including RA and SWP.

Site Supervision of construction of structures such as pile cap, undergrounds tanks, base slab, column (~12m high) including corbel, RC beams, Capping beam, RC and PC beam connections, ramps, steel and RC struts, hanging sumps and staircases.

Assisting construction manager for planning and preparing daily progress reports
Tracking and optimizing manpower for each works

Reviewing sub-con's shop drawing for steel strut and supervision of installation work.

Roles & Responsibilities
Your new company
My client (located in the North) is a leading provider of innovative technology solutions and manufacturing services.
Your new role
Below are some of the key responsibilities for the role;

Conceptualize and develop innovative hardware, circuits, and software solutions, ensuring feasibility and efficiency.
Collaborate in design reviews, offering expertise in design for manufacturability and assembly.
Create and release engineering documentation, communicating with vendors to expedite design parts and assemblies.
Drive the design of AC/DC power distribution systems, including circuit breakers, power supplies, and cabling harnesses.
Develop, test, and document designs, ensuring compliance with safety standards and customer requirements.

Facilitate a seamless transition from engineering to production, collaborating with manufacturing and other organizations.

Maintain cutting-edge technical knowledge and direct engineering and technical support personnel as needed.
What you'll need to succeed

Educational Background: Bachelor's Degree with 6 years of experience or Master's Degree with 3 years of experience in Electrical/Electronics/Mechatronics Engineering.
Technical Expertise: Working knowledge of electrical systems, motion, temperature measurement, PID loops, and safety interlock circuits.
Design Experience: Dynamic electromechanical system design and proficiency in OrCAD, AutoCAD, PCAD, SolidWorks, or similar 3D CAD software.
Safety Knowledge: NFPA, Semi Safety Requirements, and Machine safety.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal English and effective communication skills.
What you'll get in return
Joining a company that is at the forefront of our industry
Working with a talented and ever-evolving team
Enhancing your skills while working on exciting and challenging projects

Roles & Responsibilities
Junior Radio Frequency Design Engineer
About Doodle Labs
Doodle Labs is the global leader in high-performance private wireless systems. We build cutting-edge mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. Doodle Labs has experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our radio systems have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies (e.g. Airbus, General Electric) and industry-leading innovators (e.g. Boston Dynamics, FLIR).
Your Opportunity
Doodle Labs develops market-leading broadband mesh radios. Products include handheld mesh hotspots (Wearable Smart Radio) and tiny embedded multi-band radios for robots (Helix). Your opportunity is to build novel RF products while implementing Doodle Labs’ patented RF techniques. You will design and develop next generation wireless communication systems utilizing Wi-Fi 4/5/6/6E chipsets and protocols.
Job Description
· Perform detailed radio frequency translation plans and architectures
· Evaluate gain, noise parameters (NF, SNR), dynamic range, linearity, and power consumption analyses to execute a predictable, robust design
· Collaborate with CAD engineers and drive PCB implementation of the design with emphasis on clean power supply design, interconnect design for required EMI and RF transmission performance
· Participate in design reviews and prepare design documentations at every stage of development until the final prototype test and characterization
· Perform parametric evaluation of transceivers, like Pout, IMD/IP3, EVM, noise parameters with spectrum analyser, modulation analyser and perform wireless link level functional evaluation to complete the product characterization
· Collaborate with product engineers for various certification procedures and NPI, followed by the Transfer of Technology (ToT) for large quantity production
Job Requirements
· Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Electronics Communication Engineering or Digital Communication Engineering
· Minimum 4 year of experience as a RF system hardware with proven track record of meeting industry delivery standards in the relevant areas
· Good interpersonal and creative skills with the ability to multitask in a demanding and fast paced environment
· Hands-on experience in the design and integration of RF, Analog, and Mix signal blocks such as PA, LNA, mixer, frequency synthesizer, filter, coupler, detector, microcontroller, etc., supplemented with knowledge of specification derivation from system level requirements
· Experience working with basic CAD tools and competence in evaluation flow and operation of appropriate test equipment to evaluate product performance
· Experience in script writing such as Bash, python etc., will be a plus as it is used in test automation

Roles & Responsibilities
Our People and Culture team designs and executes people strategies to ensure that Rainbow Centre has a competent and engaged workforce to meet the aspirations of Rainbow Centre and the clients we serve. The postholder will contribute by channeling in potential talents for Rainbow Centre.

Critical Work Functions
Employer Brand Activation
Articulate organisation's employer brand across all recruitment touchpoints, including the drafting and delivering of presentations, conversing with potential candidates, and using the right key messages when promoting a career in the organisation
Expand job candidate pool via utilising various recruitment touchpoints such as job portals, career fairs, referrals schemes, partnerships with institutes of higher learning, sector schemes, and professional associations
Lead in organising, coordinating, and executing events such as career fairs, recruitment drives, outreach at institutes of higher learning
Collaborate with communications department to design and produce employer brand assets, such as visuals, social content, and collaterals
Design the methodology and evaluate performance of talent acquisition through for example recruitment funnel, time-to-fill, and time-to-hire
Talent Selection
Remain updated about the goal, strategies, and workforce plans at both the organisational and unit/programme level

Manage the administration of job portals and relevant access matrix
Collaborate with hiring managers to conduct resume screening
Perform first round interview of potential job candidates via phone or video calls

Talent Schemes Administration
Remain updated about scholarship schemes available at the national or sector level, and leverage on them to create talent pipeline for the organisation
Coordinate with funding bodies (such as National Council of Social Service and Workforce Singapore) to deploy national or sector level scholarship schemes
Manage organisation’s sponsored scholarship schemes, and where necessary review terms and conditions
Administer scholarship deeds, bonds, and related agreements with all stakeholders (funders and scholars), including handling compliance matters and submitting reimbursements and reports to funders

Talent Relationship Management
Oversee the end-to-end management of scholars lifecycle; selection, onboarding, engagement, development, placement, and offboarding
Understand the hiring needs of various departments and execute placements of scholars
Conduct regular engagement with scholars and interns to facilitate important organisational updates and understand career aspirations
Evaluate potential of interns and where relevant, channel or convert as potential talents for the organisation

Job Holder Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in human resource, preferably in talent attraction, and/or employer branding
Service is at the heart of RC’s purpose and we seek to serve our clients with respect, dedication and compassion, understanding that we are entrusted by society to serve with excellence and the highest ethical standards. Join us if you share our passion and values.

Roles & Responsibilities
Doodle Labs is the global leader in high-performance private wireless systems. We build cutting-edge mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. Doodle Labs has experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our radio systems have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies and industry-leading innovators.
Job Description
We are looking for a dedicated Industrial Process Engineer to join our QA team. You will work closely with the operations and engineering teams to document and review operational processes and identify improvements to existing manufacturing and engineering process flows.
Primary responsibilities
• Process Development: Design, develop, and optimize manufacturing processes for electronic products to improve efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness.
• Continuous Improvement: Identify and lead continuous improvement initiatives using Lean, Six Sigma, and other methodologies to enhance production processes.
• Equipment Management (Assembly Jig and tool): Oversee the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of manufacturing equipment like Test Jig, Tool and accessories to ensure optimal performance.
• Documentation: Create and maintain detailed process documentation, including work instructions, process flow diagrams, and standard operating procedures.
• Collaboration: Work closely with design engineers, production teams, and quality assurance to ensure seamless integration of new processes and technologies.
• Training: Provide training and support to production staff on new processes and equipment.
• Safety Compliance: Ensure all manufacturing processes comply with safety regulations and environmental standards.
Qualifications
· Education: Degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
· Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in electronic manufacturing process engineering.
Required Skills:
· Proficiency in process simulation software and statistical analysis tools.
· Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
· Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
· Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, and other continuous improvement methodologies.
· Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
· Software skill: Python
Preferred Certifications:
· Certified Manufacturing Engineer (CMfgE)
· Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt
· Professional Engineer (PE) license
Dispositions:
• Enjoys leading & interacting with people of all levels.
• Independent with an outgoing personality
• Self motivated with a desire to achieve.
• Mature, Outgoing & result –orientated.
Work Environment:
· This position typically operates in a manufacturing environment with exposure to various production equipment and processes.
· Frequent travel to Batammay be required for training and collaboration with other facilities.

Roles & Responsibilities
Core skills:
Experience with Linux wireless stack/kernel/driver/git
C/Linux programming and debugging
Experience in trouble-shooting embedded systems
Experience in common interfaces, networking protocols, and hardware subsystems
Additional skills:
Experience with wireless drivers such as ath11k
Web GUI development for embedded systems
Scripting with Bash shell, Python
Requirements
Candidate must possess at least a bachelor’s degree, Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent.
Experience with Linux, C
Strong communication skills and ability to engage with a cross-functional team.
Hardworking, committed, and fast learner in tight deadline environment

Company: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Property and Asset Management

What this job involves:

Being the glue that binds
Working as part of a team and assisting the headquarters portfolio managers, you’ll play a key role in our delivery of quality property management services to clients. You’ll drive initiatives that help improve our capabilities in achieving the highest service levels expected by our clients. You’ll achieve such an outcome by building strong relationships not only with your team members, but also with the property’s council members and residents.

Beating the daily grind
You’ll plan the daily operations and ensure the general maintenance of the condominium. Preparing and implementing an emergency/crisis management plan will also be part of handling the operations. Handling daily operations should be in compliance with the relevant building statutory requirements.

Creating an operation rhythm
In this role, you’ll ensure that your team gets through the daily grind of managing condominium properties. Particularly, you’ll be on top of the planning to achieve optimal daily operations—from the basic stuff to the nitty gritty details such as emergency/crisis management plan preparation and rollout. While all these sound like routine on the surface, getting everything in compliance with the relevant building statutory requirements should keep things exciting.

Going into the details
You’ll keep all details in check, specifically in terms of budget and financial transactions. You need to be on the lookout for the vendors’ intention to renew their contracts, as well as ensure proper delivery of all their invoices and insurance. You’ll have to be as accurate as possible as you may have to discuss such details during monthly council and annual general meetings.

Sound like you? To apply, you need to be:
If you’re a residential property management professional, with at least three to five years’ experience, come talk to us. We’re keen to know more about you. It’s also helpful if you have a working knowledge of condominium management software and a knack for keeping up with the latest tools of the trade. You should also have the capability to deal with an up-tempo work environment, where you can put your strong business, marketing, and management sense into great use.

An active, team-oriented leader
Do you have what it takes to build a strong and flexible team? Can you embed strong work ethics in people’s values, while at the same time keeping them well trained and motivated? If your answer is yes, then you might be the one we are looking for.

A critical thinker with consummate communications skills
You must be a problem solver who can get your message across. Additionally, having effective interpersonal skills will help you make sure everyone understands what needs done exactly. You must be level-headed during difficult times, and flexible and capable enough to carry your team through. You’re one who never gets tired of learning, as you need such an attitude to adjust in a fast-paced work environment.

What you can expect from us
At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.
Apply today!

Role

HR Operations

Roles & Responsibilities
Who We Are
As Singapore's first institute for lifelong learning, the Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS) champions inclusivity to bring education to all and ensure that they are given equal opportunities to develop to their fullest potential in our diverse learning environment.
We advocate for the same for our people. We believe everyone should have equal opportunities and develop to their fullest potential in their careers.
Embark on an exciting lifelong journey with us in making a positive difference in your career and serving our society.
For more information on Singapore University of Social Sciences, please visit www.suss.edu.sg
About the Job
The Graduate Studies office is responsible for the governance and development of the University’s graduate programmes, which include Graduate Certificates, Graduate Diplomas, Master's Degrees and Doctoral Degrees. In addition, the office manages admissions and recruitment of graduate students, working in close collaboration with the Schools and various academic and administrative units across the University. The Graduate Studies office also directly oversees two cross-disciplinary degree programmes: the Master of Social Sciences and Doctor of Philosophy.
What You Will Be Doing
• Assist in developing and executing comprehensive marketing and outreach strategies across offline and online platforms.
• Organize and conduct dialogue sessions with external vendors, internal departments, partners, and prospective students.
• Create high-quality marketing collateral, including brochures, flyers, videos, and social media content.
• Host visitors, coordinate presentations, and showcase graduate program offerings.
• Manage stakeholder relationships to maximize the impact of outreach events and engagement activities.
• Collaborate with Success Academies on overseas outreach events and education fairs.
• Work with the marketing team to promote graduate programs on various social media platforms.
• Ensure timely updates of program information on websites and social media channels.
• Analyze data to refine outreach and recruitment strategies effectively.
• Stay updated on trends and best practices in student recruitment.

Working under the guidance of trained educators, Assistant Teachers contribute to the quality learning experiences for our students, and support in the curriculum delivery to help our students to acquire valuable skills and knowledge. Assistant Teachers also foster partnerships with parents and participate in the building of a more inclusive community involving various stakeholders, in the endeavour for Good Lives for our students.
Our Rainbow Centre Special Education Programme caters to students with multiple disabilities and autism spectrum disorder, aged from 7 to 18 years. With RC, you can expect a rewarding career in Special Education, making a difference in the lives of students with disabilities.
Assistant Teachers will receive mentorship and training to take on teaching responsibilities, including a potential nomination to complete a sponsored Diploma in Special Education (DISE) offered by the National Institute of Education (NIE).

Job Title: Guest Service Agent - Pools and Recreation
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SCOPE
As a Pool Guest Service Agent, you will be part of the team operating one of the world’s most iconic and Instragramable Infinity Pool. Being a Pool Guest Service Agent, you will deliver the highest level of guest service to ensure guest experience a luxurious and leave them with an unforgettable memories.
The role will require you to perform and enhance multiple guest’s experience of the Infinity Pool from welcoming all guest, walking all guest to their sun beds area, setting up guest’s sun beds, providing guest with a fresh towel, introducing guest to the offerings / directional of the areas at the same time ensuring their stay at the Infinity Pool was a memorable and everlasting experience.
Operational Related
Warmly welcome and engage all guests visiting the Infinity Pool.
Share a quick introduction of the offerings available while escorting guests to their dedicated sun beds.
Provide exceptional service and create a memorable experience for all guests.
Set up and maintain the available sun beds, ensuring that they are ready for the next guests.
Take and process food and beverages orders.
Interact with guests and answer their inquiries appropriately.
Process guests’ requests. Own and communicate requests that are not directly related to the Infinity Pool, to the respective department and ensure that the requests are fulfilled.
Conduct tours at the Infinity Pool.
Ensure the availability of fresh towels, and present them to the guests.
Maintain and ensure that the towel distribution counter and return bins are neat and presentable.
Ensure that the Infinity Pool deck area is clean and presentable.
Ensure adherence to Company policy for access to the Infinity Pool
Bid all guests with a fond farewell upon their departure.
Departmental Related
Be familiar with the local community and major events in town, and make appropriate recommendations to guests to enhance their stay.
Maintains close liaison with all other Departments to have a good understanding of other Departments’ operational flow, thus ensuring seamless guest experiences.
Monitor activities in the Infinity Pool and report any suspicious characters, items or/and activities to the Manager.
Perform administrative duties as requested such as filing of reports.
Contribute ideas to improving the operations of Pools & Recreation.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Minimum GCE ‘N’ or ‘O’ Levels.
Excellent guest relations and communication skills.
Prior customer service experience in the same capacity is an advantage.
Possess a good command of spoken and written English.
Ability to speak additional languages is an advantage.
Pays attention to details.
Able to speak in front of groups.
Be willing to work shifts in an outdoor Pool environment.
Able to work with minimum supervision.
Team player who takes the initiative to assist other Team Members when required.
Have impeccable follow-through; and “Can Do” attitude and mindset.
Well-groomed with professional disposition.

Roles & Responsibilities
Mechanical Design Engineer
12 months contract, renewable
Work location: Depot Close
The Opportunity
Designs portions of engineering solutions for mechanical and thermal hardware, electronics enclosures, and production tooling based on established engineering principles and in accordance with development technology practices and guidelines.
Develops and implements parameters and test plans for existing designs, including validation of tolerances, form/fit/function, shock and vibration, electromagnetic interference, safety, reliability, developing fan curves, system power measurements & acoustics.
Conducts feasibility studies, design margin and validation analyses and empirical testing on new and modified designs.
Performs root cause analysis of defects, propose, evaluate and implement solutions.
Works in a collaborative environment to design, analyze, build and test mechanical components, devices, structures and assemblies, including mechanical ground support equipment.
Participates as a member of project team of other mechanical hardware engineers and internal and outsourced development partners to develop reliable, cost effective and high quality solutions for low to moderate to complex products.
Manages relationships with outsourced partners and suppliers, on mechanical and thermal design and development, including setting expectations regarding deliverables, product quality, schedules, and costs.
Manages design engineering change notifications/engineering change approval request processes, qualification tests, and schedule.
Manages value engineering project proposals, schedule, tests, and communication.
Impacts immediate team and acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input.
Your Background
No experience required; must be four-year or graduate Degree in Mechanical Engineering or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Ideally has 2-4 years of work experience, preferably in engineering design and solutions, implementation across hardware development lifecycle, or a related field or an advanced degree with little or no work experience.
Knowledge & Skills: 3D Modeling, Ansys Simulation Software, Computer-Aided Design, Electromechanics, Engineering Design Process, Finite Element Methods, Injection Molding, Machining, Manufacturing Processes, Mechanical Design, Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Systems, New Product Development, Product Design, Product Lifecycle Management, Prototyping, PTC Creo (CAD Suite), Sheet Metal, SolidWorks (CAD), Thermal Management

Your new company

Your new role
We are looking for a detailed-oriented and proactive Shipping Executive to join our team at Singapore Distribution Center.
Your role will involve a wide span of activities from export documentation, timely booking of export containers, co-ordinating of inbound arrivals and all other related shipping operational activities. This role will be reporting to the Order & Shipping Manager, and be part of the Order & Shipping team.

Shipping Coordination and Documentation
· Coordinate and execute all export shipment related activities from Singapore warehouse to the complete dealer network including supplier returns
· Prepare all related export documentation including dealer invoicing, delivery orders, Certificate of Origins, etc.
· Ensuring that all goods are processed for export properly i.e. coordinate DG packing and export declarations
· Membership renewal with Singapore Chamber of Commerce
· Coordinate closely with the internal teams including relevant Business Areas and warehouse operations to track all order lines are processed shipped out in time.
· Working closely with Service Centre and Operations team in cases of urgent or special delivery requests from dealers.

Coordination with 3PL/Freight Forwarders
· Closely work with the relevant 3PLs to ensure that the shipments and transported in time
· Ensure that all export documents are archived properly
· First line of resolve for all day-to-day shipping issues (including basic related systems issues)

Support Business Objectives & Continuous Improvements
· Responsible for performance measurements within your area, e.g. updating and analysing reasons and actions when gaps are found
· Continuously improve the way of working within your individual role as well as together with the Order & Shipping team.
· Whenever required, act as a backup and support towards the team including performing cross-functional activities
· Engage actively in cross-departmental projects and initiatives to ensure company’s success as a whole

What you'll need to succeed
Experience in handling supply chain / Shipping documentation (export markets)
Coordination with internal and external stakeholders
Able to commit to 6 months contract

Roles & Responsibilities
About Agora Student Care

Agora Student Care provides care and supervision to primary school-going children after school hours. We provide a safe and supportive environment, support students' academic progress, as well as their social and emotional development. The curriculum includes homework supervision, online worksheets, guided research, and team sports.

Role

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Student Care Teacher to join us as we look to build the future of student care at Agora Colearning.

Responsibilities
Implement class programmes in accordance with our pedagogical framework, including conducting the Agora Student Care enrichment programme, encompassing Learn to Learn, Life Skills and Physical Activity.
Supervise primary school children in preparing for, initiating, and completing their daily homework.
Observe and track evidence of children's academic and holistic development using educational tools provided by Agora Colearning, and contribute to reporting progress to parents.
Prepare, rearrange, and upkeep teaching resources and learning environment.
Ensure safety and security at all times, taking active initiative to identify and mitigate risks.
Model positive behaviour to ensure compliance and discipline.
Ensure smooth transfer of student custody between the parties (parents/guardians, drivers), quick checking-in and out of the Agora centre.
Requirements
Diploma or higher qualification. Diploma in Care and Programme (Student Services & Coaching) or WSQ Student Care Programme is an advantage
Minimum of 2 years’ relevant teaching experience
Ability to understand the primary school curricular content and supervise homework completion (accuracy and academic support are not expected, but minimum understanding is important)
Great communication and classroom management skills
Creative, enthusiastic, and energetic, with a positive mindset to learn and grow
Working days/hours
School term: Monday to Friday 11:00 am - 8:00 pm (Inclusive of 1 hour's lunch break)
School holidays and ad-hoc school closure days: Monday to Friday 9-hours shifts between 7:00 am and 8:00 pm)
Part-time Working Arrangement can also be arranged.
Why Join Agora

We embrace input from our team members and encourage fresh ideas and continuous improvements, whether you are an educator, an events host or a part of our front of house team.
Here's why you should join us:
Innovative Environment: Work in an environment where your ideas matter and you have the opportunity to drive real change within a tech-enabled setting
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication and mutual respect.
Growth Opportunities: Benefit from professional development and courses to advance your career.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy flexible arrangements to fit your lifestyle, whether full-time, part-time, or freelance.

Become part of a forward-thinking team that’s passionate about creating a better place to learn and grow. If this resonates with you, reach out to us.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Agora Playschool & Preschool
Agora Playschool is an enrichment programme for children aged 6 months to 3 years old that can be adult accompanied. It offers a complete sensory and educational experience for young children that prepares them for Preschool. Our teachers engage on a deep level with the children in order to discover their likes and dislikes, allowing them to display their true characters through imagination and exploration.
Agora Preschool places an emphasis on providing a genuinely personalised experience for each child. Our innovative and creative teachers, along with differentiated and tiered lessons, offer an opportunity that challenges each individual to reach their full potential. During a unique observation period, our teachers are given the time to comprehend the needs of their students and gain insights from parents, enabling us to tailor an experience that thoroughly prepares each child for their next steps in education.

About the role
At Agora Playschool and Preschool, the teaching team create meaningful experiences through its play-based foundation to learning. We help children grow as whole persons, develop curiosity, and strive in the world around them.

Responsibilities:
Aid the preparation and delivery of appropriate lesson plans based on the 6 domains.
Help facilitate opportunities that encourage skill, content learning, individual expression and creativity.
Help to develop strategies and guide diverse learning and development needs.
Help to motivate students and staff to work productively and responsibly.
Help prepare and maintain dynamic learning stations.
Meet regularly with the team to develop planning, assessment, and student progress across the curriculum strands.
Help to identify children that need extra support to meet class goals across development areas and assist the main class teacher by working 1:1 with specific children when necessary.
Requirements
Fundamentals in Early Childhood teaching is good but not necessary. Diploma or higher qualification. Diploma in Care and Programme (Student Services & Coaching) is an advantage, but not necessary.
Passion for working with children.
Great communication and classroom management skills
Creative, enthusiastic, and energetic, with a positive mindset to learn and grow

We are an education startup dedicated to transforming learning experiences for children of all ages.
We combine our own programmes with an education marketplace offering tuition and enrichment programmes, both at our own centers and at schools.
Our mission is to simplify access to great educational opportunities and empower families to tailor their child's unique learning journey, with a strong emphasis on using technology in all aspects of our business.

We are looking for an Education Consultant to join our team. You will be the first point of call for managing parent enquiries. The ideal candidate will have had prior experience in education sales or business development, have a strong grasp of parent and student needs across a number of tuition and enrichment areas and be highly proactive in managing their pipeline.

Managing new parent enquiries promptly and effectively through a variety of communication channels (email, telephone, chat, in-person)

Work closely with our Student Care and Early Years teams to understand the parents' and students' needs and advise on suitable programme follow-ups
Systematically manage our customer base to help identify learning needs and identify solutions from our range of offerings

Strong interpersonal skills and prior experience in prior sales roles preferably within the education sector

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
What will you do?
As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining web applications across both front-end and back-end technologies.
You will work closely with our customers and teams which consist of Software engineer, DevOps specialist, Data analyst/scientist to deliver easy to use application to help improve developers experience and accelerate application delivery while using our runtime platform.
Design and develop responsive web applications using modern front-end frameworks and back-end technologies.
Integrate third-party APIs to enhance the functionality and user experience of our applications.
Implement security best practices to protect user data and prevent unauthorised access.
Optimize application deployment cycle through improvement of application design and automation workflow.
Collaborate with cross-functional team from Development, Platform, and Product management teams to achieve common objectives.
Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and secondary SRE-role rotation for better understanding of runtime platform.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role, preferably with background in containerization, orchestration, and cloud-native technologies.
Proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks like Next.js, React, Angular, or Vue.js.
Experience in DevOps
Strong understanding of back-end technologies including Node.js, Express, Python, or Go.
Solid understanding of Git, RESTful APIs, and Agile methodologies.
Hands-on Experience with developing application in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) or PaaS platforms (Vercel, OpenShift, Heroku, or similar offerings).
Experience with database systems such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, or similar offering from cloud providers.
Experience with microservices architecture or serverless computing is preferred.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with runtime technologies (ECS, Lambda), and infrastructure-as-code (Pulumi, Terraform) is advantageous.
Familiarity with DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, and CI/CD (e.g. GitLab CI/CD, Github Action) is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing AI/ML based application, BI solution, Data warehouse, analytics, or visualisation is a plus.
Certifications such as AWS Certified Developer or AWS Solutions Architect is a plus.
A Pass in ICT Assessment Certification for Solution Architect or Software Developer by NUS-ISS is strongly preferred.

Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
We are seeking a talented and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic tech team. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports our rapidly evolving platform.
You will collaborate closely with our development, QA, and product teams to streamline deployment processes, enhance system performance, and ensure the scalability and reliability of our services.
What will you do?
Infrastructure Development:
Design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable infrastructure on AWS EC2.
Utilize Docker, Kubernetes, and EKS for containerization and orchestration of microservices.
CI/CD Pipeline Management:
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and ArgoCD to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
Integrate QA tooling into CI/CD pipelines, including Cypress for E2E testing.
Configuration and Automation:
Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform for efficient resource provisioning.
Manage configuration management using Ansible to automate system configurations and deployments.
Networking and Security:
Configure and manage load balancers using Traefik to ensure optimal traffic distribution.
Implement service mesh technologies like LinkerD to manage service-to-service communication securely.
Ensure infrastructure security and compliance with industry best practices.
Monitoring and Logging:
Set up and maintain monitoring and alerting systems using tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, and Splunk.
Proactively identify and resolve system issues to maintain high availability and performance.
Collaboration and Support:
Work closely with development and QA teams to understand application requirements and ensure seamless integration.
Provide support for development and staging environments, facilitating efficient testing and deployment cycles.
Optimization and Cost Management:
Analyze system performance metrics to optimize infrastructure for cost and efficiency.
Implement strategies for resource optimization without compromising on performance.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a DevOps or similar role.
Proven experience with AWS services, particularly EC2, RDS, and networking components.
Strong expertise in containerization using Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
Past experience as a software developer is highly advantageous.
Proficiency in setting up CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and ArgoCD.
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform.
Familiarity with configuration management tools such as Ansible.
Knowledge of load balancing with Traefik and service mesh implementations using LinkerD.
Experience with logging and monitoring tools, specifically Splunk.
Scripting skills in Bash, Python, or Go for automation tasks.
Understanding of microservices architecture and RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with our tech stack is a plus: TypeScript, Go, ReactJS, ExpressJS,
Gin-gonic, GraphQL with JWT authentication.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality work.
Certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes
Administrator (CKA), or similar.
Knowledge of Redis, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch.
Experience with QA tools integration, including Cypress and Pact.js.
